story:
What is Lacquerbar and why should you care?

Going to nail salons today is like drinking cheap pink rosé at a gender reveal party: you'll take what you can get because it's better than nothing. If you want your nails done, you can go to a grimy hole-in-the-wall with reliably decent manicures OR you can go to a high-end spa for an exorbitant price and stuffy customer service. Enter Lacquerbar.

Lacquerbar is the next Drybar/The Wing, but for the nail salon industry. We opened the first Lacquerbar in West Berkeley, which has already been recognized as a Top 15 Bay Area Beauty Brand, and it's been the talk of the town because we are a feminist focused nail salon and lounge that serves alcoholic drinks (#yaaas).

 

What makes Lacquerbar different than any other nail salon?

What makes us any different from any other nail salon that wants to create a national chain and sell nail polishes? Not only do we offer all the bells and whistles when it comes to mani/pedi services, nail artistry, and handmade nail care products, but we also are a feminist playground. With our high ceilings, neon signs, portraits of inspiring women on the walls, tasty adult beverages, and upbeat hip hop and pop tunes, our space was designed specifically to be a destination for fun meetups, parties, and anyone who wants a boost of girl power. We also sell and serve alcoholic beverages at our nail stations and in our expanded lounge areas where clients can hang out pre- and post-appointment.

But our biggest differentiator is our vision for the future. We aren't just about opening fun nail salons and selling cool beauty products. Our mission is to empower our teammates, clients, and women from all cultures and backgrounds with education, beauty, and confidence. Because the industry has been overlooked for so long, the education and schooling for nail technicians is stuck in the 90's. The majority of nail schools only teach the requirements to pass a state board exam. These women (and men) aren't being the taught the newest manicuring techniques, nail artistry, business finance skills, etc. We want to fill that gap and become the industry leader in the education and career development of nail technicians.

How will this Indiegogo campaign help?

This money will help us hire the staff we need to build out and launch the San Francisco location. We're fundraising in tandem with venture capital firms and angel investors of course, but we wanted to open this up to our RIDE-OR-DIE customers and fans. Y'all have been begging for more locations, so your contribution can help us open the next Lacquerbar faster. 

LET'S DO THIS BAES!!!!

 

What goodies do you get when you help fund Lacquerbar?

Depending on how much you contribute, you'll receive Lacquerbar swag (nail polish, cuticle oil, bath bombs, oh my!) and most importantly UNLIMITED MANICURE MEMBERSHIPS! #omfg #yasqueens!

 

To our HELLA amazing customers and fans:

Thank you so so much for your love and obsession with Lacquerbar!!!

story:
Short Summary

Greetings from beautiful Dahlonega, a picturesque town located in the mountains of North Georgia, USA. I am Nicholas Alicea. ‘Chef Nick’, I was born and raised in Brooklyn, NY and I am very proud of my Italian and Puerto Rican heritage. While other kids my age were watching Sesame Street, I grew up watching Julia Child and The Frugal Gourmet. One of my favorite childhood memories is of the vendor behind our house that would make smoked cheese, and us kids would take turns leaning over the fence trying to grab a piece without being caught. I have carried that love of food throughout my life from Brooklyn to Manhattan and during my years abroad in Copenhagen, Denmark, France, Sweden & Holland.  That passion grew stronger as I made my way back to the States and up the Coast of Florida all the way to here.

Working in over 125 kitchens all over the world, I wouldn't change a thing.

Four years ago, I decided to make Dahlonega my home. I acquired Yahoola Creek Grill and within three years doubled in business. The Grill went from having five events a year to 200 a year. With Yahoola on a successful path, I was ready to add a new project. A friend of mine was visiting our quaint town of Dahlonega for the first time and talked me into taking The Dahlonega Walking Ghost Tour. The tour brought us to the old Corkscrew restaurant and I was immediately mesmerized by the deep history of the building. I told my friend, “this is where my next restaurant has to be”. Within two weeks I had the keys in hand. We started directly on the renovations. As each stud and sheetrock was removed, more of the inspiring history was revealed.

As the first jailhouse in Dahlonega (200 years ago), it was only logical to allow the history of the building to take over. My original desire to create a fun space on the square was replaced by the history of the building. Instead of just another restaurant, we wanted to create a unique destination, showcasing the rich history that is being revealed.

I want to take this abandoned and dilapidated space and offer Dahlonega another point of interest for locals and tourists alike, “other than just the vineyards”.  This will be a place that is suitable to all, from the locals to the tourists to the college students and professors. We want to offer something for everyone.

Why Do We Need You

So, you may be wondering why we need your help. Renovating a historic building is expensive. Previously, the deep history of this building has been covered up numerous times. We do not want to do that.

Your contributions will allow The Yard to exceed everyone's expectations, including my own. Your contributions will help further the renovations so that the authenticity of the building takes center-stage. Your support will be essential in helping us to open the doors sooner in full glory. We would like for the originality of the building to be exposed, instead of just passing through the old jail, you will experience its ambiance.

We need you to help us deliver the most authentic, historic, dining venue Dahlonega has ever had.

What We Need 

The amount of funding that we need will go farther that you can imagine.  The renovation is very extensive. The funding will help us with:

  • Authentic decor
  • Custom made wood burning brick oven
  • An old school dumb waiter. Allowing faster food service to all floors
  • A new rear staircase between the main floor and the downstairs jail area
  • Amazing stage and dance floor
  • Appropriate lighting, electronics, and sound system

If the contributions are enough, I also want to use the funds to begin planning the roof top seating area - which will entail a great deal of structural work to ensure the safety of this project.  The rooftop will provide spectacular views of the square and the university campus.

If I do not reach the total goal - the funds raised will still be used entirely for the authentic restoration and remodeling of the building.

What You Get

Your funding will not only be helping The Yard, but you will enjoy some amazing limited-edition perks! You will be involved with bringing history back to life. Together we will create lasting memories for you and everyone visiting Dahlonega.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Even if you don't think you can contribute right now stay tuned for special perks that will only be available during certain days/times for all budgets!
  • Share this with your friends and family! They will want to see this!
  • Indiegogo has great share tools! It is super easy!
  • Once we open, Come See Us and Support Us!!

Thank you all for your support

I am committed to doing as much as I can for this community and I appreciate your support. I have long term goals here in Dahlonega and “The Yard” will be a place that makes us all proud.

story:
Fred Isch and I signed a lease for what would eventually become The Flaming Buoy Filet Co. at 1100 Packer Street on September 9, 2009. We opened–less than two months later–on October 23, 2009. A Friday. Fantasy Fest weekend.

And we had no idea what we were doing: no menu, no tables, no chairs, no silverware, no employees, no kitchen equipment, no experience with permits, inspections, or licenses.

You know, like that song in the musical Hair.

No?

Yeah, you know the one.

The one that ends with, "I got this, and I got that, and something, something, hair."

Nina Simone sang it on one of her albums.

But, I digress. (That's code for Fred telling me to cut the Hair part.)

Hair.

Part.

There's a joke in there somewhere.

Then came The New York Times, People Magazine, Out Magazine, USA Today, TripAdvisor, Yelp, Grindr, etc... Those two guys who worked at [Restaurant's Name Redacted] we ran into at Don's Place that bet we wouldn't last three months. (Bitches better have my money. No, really. That money would be very useful right now.)

We did the impossible, and that made us mighty.

We realized entrees were just sandwiches without the bread.

Today, however, we find ourselves nearly four months and counting deep into opening a new location at 424 Eaton Street. (For perspective, Brett Kavanaugh was nominated and confirmed to The Supreme Court of the United States in less time.)

Following the financial hit of Hurricane Irma and the sale of our building, we found this a necessary, if not wholly inevitable move.

(Cue sad music. Think Sarah McLachlan and busted up dogs.)

Unfortunately, despite our best efforts in planning a smooth transition, opening this new location has taken a rather challenging turn.

Whether opening a new business, or, thinking, like...Sex. Money. Power. Fire. Choking. Being dragged behind a speed boat. It's all the same thing–you find yourself helplessly facing forces that are beyond your control or influence.

Thus, we find ourselves here, asking for your help.

Financial assistance from the pretender to the throne of Nigeria has gone horribly astray. Should you run into Fred, please, gently welcome him home. He's quite easily startled as of late.

So, to borrow a phrase: Help us...You're our only hope.

As of October 1, The Flaming Buoy Filet Co. is no longer generating an income; income that fueled our move to Eaton Street; income that supported a staff of ten and provided for their families and bad habits; income that Fred and I always put back into The Flaming Buoy Filet Co. to make her a better dining experience.

Remember when our sandwiches had no bread?

We expect this situation to remain unchanged throughout the month of October. Perhaps, longer.

Our goal–our pledge–is to remain intensely focused and have finished this project at 424 Eaton Street as quickly as possible; making certain that the staff of The Flaming Buoy Filet Co. not needlessly worry for their future employment through these unexpected bureaucratic delays and surprise expenses incurred while undertaking this rather–we'd hoped–banal undertaking.

(Cue uplifting music. Think the music in the second half of any anti-depressent commercial.)

In exchange for your investment through this month, we are willing to offer these great incentives:

Donate $20.00 and receive a $25.00 Gift Certificate.

Donate $50.00 and receive a $65.00 Gift Certificate.

Donate $75.00 and receive a $100.00 Gift Certificate.

For every $100.00 donation up to $900.00, receive $150.00 in Gift Certificates (in any increments you like, because Gift Certificates make great gifts), and a big hug.

Donate $200.00 and receive a $250.00 Gift Certificate and Guest Host any evening of your choice. Enjoy all the special perks that come with that position. Perks like:  a staff dinner of your choice; too many shift drinks; polishing glassware and silverware; and unwinding with the staff at the round table with a nice bottle(s) of wine when all the guests are gone and the front doors are locked. A night at the round table is no legend. I have the videos to prove it.

Donate $400.00 and enjoy a Free Dinner with 4 Other Guests and any Staff Member of your choice:  Brian (Dirty Jesus)! Jay! Jill! Kyle! Scot! or, please, Brian (Dirty Jesus)!

Donate $500.00? Star Wars. As many of you know, because we don't shut up about it, The Flaming Buoy Filet Co. closes up with the release of each new Star Wars film. Join the nerd side with the staff and friends and plus ones on this very special evening. With your donation, you'll be provided not only with two tickets to Star Wars IX, but you will join the staff in our pre-gaming festivities at The Flaming Buoy Filet Co. Warning: This can get messy. May the force be with you. You'll need it.

For every $1000.00 donation up to $2000, receive $1750.00 in Gift Certificates (in any increment you like. Want 1,750 one dollar gift certificates? Done.).

Donate $3000.00 and enjoy a Private Party for you and 30 of your friends at The Flaming Buoy Filet Co. with a maximum spend of $4000.00 on any night, Monday through Thursday, excluding holidays. (Arrangements will, of course, need to be made prior to confirm availability.)

Donate $5000.00 and enjoy a Private Party any day of the week for you and 40 of your friends at The Flaming Buoy Filet Co. any night of the week, excluding holidays. (Arrangements will, of course, need to be made prior to confirm availability.)

Donate more than $5000.00 and I'll give you my private cell number and we'll work something out.

Thank you for considering us.

Regards,

Scot and Fred

story:
Hi my name is Brianna O’Hara and I have owned and operated Salon No. 15 for almost eight years.  My dream was to open up a space where I could serve like-minded misfits in my “Never-Never Land”....The Lower East Side.  Long story short I started this business with no working capital, no clientele and no marketing.  Structural mistakes were made by myself in the beginning and now I’m looking to you my “chosen NYC family”to help give the salon a facelift.  I want to ensure my clients the best service they could possibly have.  In order to do this I need to raise $18,000.  It would be used for a new air ventilation system, new floors, additional sinks,new chairs, new store window, new equipment and some structural changes.  1/3 of funds raised will be going to the Waggytail Foundation and The Lower East Side Girls Club.  These 2 non-for profits have had a huge impact in my love for the LES.

 

Contiributers will recieve services and gifts depending on the level of donation.  All contubuters will be  invited to the reopening party with a few famous artists, musicians and of course catered by my favorites restaurants in the neighborhood .  

 

With this donation I ultimately hope to make enough income to open another location as eventually launch a line of product.  I will also have more time to dedicate doing hair for for women as children  at our mission.  I am also in the process on developing a course  for my favorite organization the Lower East Side Girls Club.

 

Thank you again for your time, consideration and friendship.  My dream wouldn’t see possible with out you in it!  

 

Love, Bri

story:
Gresham Still Reads

There isn’t one general purpose bookstore within 15 minutes of Gresham! Gresham has a strong reading community with little to bring them together. The community is lacking a space where one can discover their next favorite book, a place where they can meet fellow book nerds, and last, but definitely not least, we want this to be a community space where local writers and artists can share their work. We definitely appreciate the specialty bookstores in Gresham, our focus will be on building a general-purpose bookstore that will serve all of the community rather than a specific population. 

Who I am and why I'm doing this


Stephanie has been obsessed with and immersed in the literary world since she was very young listening to books on her mini record player. Each year she would save up her allowance to spend it all on books from the Scholastic book fair. Her early love for Roald Dahl and R.L. Stine led to reading Stephen King, Gillian Flynn, and others as an adult. Her love of books influenced her to become a librarian, and a writer. Stephanie remains an avid reader to this day. 

Stephanie works at three different libraries part-time but wanted to establish a business with roots. After watching Shop Around the Corner/You’ve Got Mail/Field of Dreams (over and over again) she thought it was about time to follow her dreams and share with the community. She has made a home in Gresham and was shocked to discover that it doesn't have ONE general-purpose bookstore within city limits.

Stephanie has a BA in Psychology, an MS in Human Services, and an MS in Information and Library Sciences. That’s right! This librarian, novelist, and former bookseller at Barnes & Noble wants to bring a bookstore to you. Her strong background in mental health, editing, library sciences, and photography will foster community opportunities at literary agencies and with publications.

After talking to community members and small business owners it became clear that there was an absence in the reading realm, one that they wanted filled. 


I’m passionate and why you should be too!

 

We do have some phenomenal libraries, and I’ve worked at three of them. But having your very own library at home is a joy and a comfort. Exacting ownership by writing your thoughts and feelings in the margins is a grand experience. These things are what personalizes books. I was lucky enough to be surrounded by books as a child, and as a teen. And now as an adult, as a writer, avid reader, bookseller, and librarian I know that not all others have that opportunity. I want to bring the opportunity and passion I have for reading and bookshops to the community members of Gresham and have it be around the block. 
 

 

If I build it will you come?

 

I want this bookshop to be the place you find your next great read, the newest bestsellers, old classics to reread or tackle for the first time, for fans of specific genres, surprise picks you may not have heard of, the place you go to meet your favorite local authors, and the place you bring your friends and family from out of town because “It’s just so lit.” 
 

I hope to provide the community:

 

→ A warm and inviting bookshop for you to discover next favorite book (until I suggest another)

→ A variety of booklists, displays, and shelf talkers that have specialized recommendations

→ A community and event space! I am a book lover and I know there are others in the community as well and I want to bring some fun events and programs to Gresham. I hope to host a series of events, from author signings and poetry readings, to book clubs and craft nights. Also, I want  offer the space to local groups and businesses for meetings for a small fee.

→ Me! A passionate librarian/owner to help you and talk books with you and provide specialized recommendations

→ Local artists showcasing their work on the walls of the bookshop changing every month

→ A community bulletin board to share events and services happening in and around Gresham being a communication station for the community.

→ The Booktalk Community Bookclub (because sometimes you want to hear what fellow community members are reading )

→ A fun and nerdy reward program
      Every dollar you spend with us gets a nerdy point, 100 nerdy points gets you a $5               coupon!    
     -15% discount for educators in Gresham and Troutdale               
     -10% discount for military/student/senior
 
→ I want to incorporate skills, knowledge, and education of my time working in libraries in this community book shop. I want this bookstore to have a library feel AND I want the community to help shape the books that I have order and feel that they are part of the collection development team. Throughout the year I will partner with local charities to bring books to children, adults, and seniors that need them, provide internship opportunities for teens and other diverse populations, and give you (our avid readers) ways to donate to your favorite literacy charities. 

 


The Best Things In Life Are Free...Well Almost:


I’m sure you all know that starting a small business takes a lot of money. I am contributing some of my own investments for rent and some of the start-up costs but it just won’t be enough. As a backer for this community bookshop, I want to reassure you and be transparent about what your money will supply for this endeavor.

$10,800 - Inventory: You will discover diverse genres including mysteries, thrillers, science fiction, fantasy, biographies/memoirs, local authors, and some booklover merchandise by local artists. I am using an estimate on the space but have my eye on one in particular
      - 5bks x 220ft of shelf space = 1100 books 
      - An additional 100 books in four different displays
      - At a $9 average wholesale price x 1200 bks

→ $4,200 - Miscellaneous: POS system/hardware, promotion, publicity, Indiegogo Fees - 5% of total funds raised. Payment processing fees: 3% + $0.30 per pledge. 

I am not asking for the full amount of what I’d like to provide to the community in regards to the inventory. Since I’m not asking for the full start-up costs it is crucial that you donate as much as you can AND share my story with others in the community and with anyone and everyone how is passionate about books, local authors, literature, and literacy. 

That total comes to: $15,000.

     *Once we reach our goal, please continue donating! Any additional amount will go towards bringing the best bookstore our community deserves!
story_txt:
Gresham Still ReadsThere isn’t one general purpose bookstore within 15 minutes of Gresham! Gresham has a strong reading community with little to bring them together. The community is lacking a space where one can discover their next favorite book, a place where they can meet fellow book nerds, and last, but definitely not least, we want this to be a community space where local writers and artists can share their work. We definitely appreciate the specialty bookstores in Gresham, our focus will be on building a general-purpose bookstore that will serve all of the community rather than a specific population. Who I am and why I'm doing thisStephanie has been obsessed with and immersed in the literary world since she was very young listening to books on her mini record player. Each year she would save up her allowance to spend it all on books from the Scholastic book fair. Her early love for Roald Dahl and R.L. Stine led to reading Stephen King, Gillian Flynn, and others as an adult. Her love of books influenced her to become a librarian, and a writer. Stephanie remains an avid reader to this day. Stephanie works at three different libraries part-time but wanted to establish a business with roots. After watching Shop Around the Corner/You’ve Got Mail/Field of Dreams (over and over again) she thought it was about time to follow her dreams and share with the community. She has made a home in Gresham and was shocked to discover that it doesn't have ONE general-purpose bookstore within city limits.Stephanie has a BA in Psychology, an MS in Human Services, and an MS in Information and Library Sciences. That’s right! This librarian, novelist, and former bookseller at Barnes & Noble wants to bring a bookstore to you. Her strong background in mental health, editing, library sciences, and photography will foster community opportunities at literary agencies and with publications.After talking to community members and small business owners it became clear that there was an absence in the reading realm, one that they wanted filled. 
I’m passionate and why you should be too! We do have some phenomenal libraries, and I’ve worked at three of them. But having your very own library at home is a joy and a comfort. Exacting ownership by writing your thoughts and feelings in the margins is a grand experience. These things are what personalizes books. I was lucky enough to be surrounded by books as a child, and as a teen. And now as an adult, as a writer, avid reader, bookseller, and librarian I know that not all others have that opportunity. I want to bring the opportunity and passion I have for reading and bookshops to the community members of Gresham and have it be around the block.   If I build it will you come? I want this bookshop to be the place you find your next great read, the newest bestsellers, old classics to reread or tackle for the first time, for fans of specific genres, surprise picks you may not have heard of, the place you go to meet your favorite local authors, and the place you bring your friends and family from out of town because “It’s just so lit.”  I hope to provide the community: → A warm and inviting bookshop for you to discover next favorite book (until I suggest another)→ A variety of booklists, displays, and shelf talkers that have specialized recommendations→ A community and event space! I am a book lover and I know there are others in the community as well and I want to bring some fun events and programs to Gresham. I hope to host a series of events, from author signings and poetry readings, to book clubs and craft nights. Also, I want  offer the space to local groups and businesses for meetings for a small fee.→ Me! A passionate librarian/owner to help you and talk books with you and provide specialized recommendations→ Local artists showcasing their work on the walls of the bookshop changing every month→ A community bulletin board to share events and services happening in and around Gresham being a communication station for the community.→ The Booktalk Community Bookclub (because sometimes you want to hear what fellow community members are reading )→ A fun and nerdy reward program      Every dollar you spend with us gets a nerdy point, 100 nerdy points gets you a $5               coupon!         -15% discount for educators in Gresham and Troutdale                    -10% discount for military/student/senior → I want to incorporate skills, knowledge, and education of my time working in libraries in this community book shop. I want this bookstore to have a library feel AND I want the community to help shape the books that I have order and feel that they are part of the collection development team. Throughout the year I will partner with local charities to bring books to children, adults, and seniors that need them, provide internship opportunities for teens and other diverse populations, and give you (our avid readers) ways to donate to your favorite literacy charities.  
The Best Things In Life Are Free...Well Almost:I’m sure you all know that starting a small business takes a lot of money. I am contributing some of my own investments for rent and some of the start-up costs but it just won’t be enough. As a backer for this community bookshop, I want to reassure you and be transparent about what your money will supply for this endeavor.$10,800 - Inventory: You will discover diverse genres including mysteries, thrillers, science fiction, fantasy, biographies/memoirs, local authors, and some booklover merchandise by local artists. I am using an estimate on the space but have my eye on one in particular      - 5bks x 220ft of shelf space = 1100 books       - An additional 100 books in four different displays      - At a $9 average wholesale price x 1200 bks
→ $4,200 - Miscellaneous: POS system/hardware, promotion, publicity, Indiegogo Fees - 5% of total funds raised. Payment processing fees: 3% + $0.30 per pledge. 
I am not asking for the full amount of what I’d like to provide to the community in regards to the inventory. Since I’m not asking for the full start-up costs it is crucial that you donate as much as you can AND share my story with others in the community and with anyone and everyone how is passionate about books, local authors, literature, and literacy. 
That total comes to: $15,000.
     *Once we reach our goal, please continue donating! Any additional amount will go towards bringing the best bookstore our community deserves!

story:
2 guys fighting massive corporations

Through the opposition of an establishment biased industry, two regular guys emerging from humble roots in Chicago's south suburbs have figured out the key to making the world's smoothest vodka.  We knew going in that there would be obstacles to selling into a competitive market, but we didn't know that the cards would actually be stacked against us.  To date, we have weathered a bumpy but drastically upward trajectory as we navigate our way through the complicated world of spirits sales and distribution.  We have survived the rigid culture of corporate corruption, entrenched distributors and predatory brokers all while penetrating a seemingly unbreakable market guarded by the deep pockets of international  conglomerates.  

Through it all we emerged on the other side.  Now, the only thing blocking our path to the national market, and bringing our superior products to the masses, is a national marketing campaign.

A quick look at the world's smoothest vodka

 

We started with a simple goal:  to create the world's smoothest vodka at a price that the masses can afford.  4 years later we have developed a gold medal winning vodka along with adding 9 flavors.  Through thousands of tastings and blind tests with national brands, CD Vodka and our flavored varieties have proven to be at the top.

The Torta Bianca difference  

It is well known that there are several vodkas on the national market, but there is only one Torta Bianca.  In 2014 we added Torta Bianca to our product lineup.  Torta Bianca is a cream liqueur flavored with white cake and chocolate truffle...and of course it is made with our CD Vodka base. The decadent yet neutral flavor profile makes Torta Bianca a perfect option for creating custom cocktails and tastes great alone.

Our new products

Popular demand by our fans has driven the creation of our newest product, Torta Rojo.  Torta Rojo is a close relative to Torta Bianca.  It shares many of the same decadent flavor qualities, but features a strawberry profile and will be produced in a red bottle with black and white decoration.  To accompany Torta Rojo, we will be releasing CD Strawberry Flavored Vodka simultaneously.  

Helping a small company never tasted so good

  • We are seeking to raise $145,000 for the filming and airing of our national television commercial along with finishing up the development of our two newest products.
  • All backing options include a voucher for at least one bottle of  Torta Rojo or CD Strawberry Flavored Vodka (or a combination with any of our existing products).  
  • Attending one of our live events will place you in our commercial; from being in the group scenes to a speaking line - we want our fans to be part of this experience.  
  • Even if we do not reach our entire goal, we will utilize any raised funds to complete the development of Torta Rojo and CD Strawberry Vodka.  Remaining capital will be utilized for a paid social marketing campaign.  

Our budget

We have spent months preparing for our national marketing campaign.  In addition to the funding we have already put into the effort and those upcoming, funds raised from the Indiegogo campaign will be utilized in the following ways.

$25,000 - commercial production

$10,000 - R&D of new products

$60,000 - fulfillment of perks

$42,000 - added to our projected commercial air time budget  

Our connection with our fans 

We plan to move to the next level in the same way that we have grown to selling in 5 states...by attracting our fans to tangible events.  On a small scale, we have introduced tens of thousands of fans to our products through "hands on" events, such as our innovative martini making classes.  Now we will expand on that effort by hosting a live music event during which we will film our first national television commercial featuring the launch of 2 new products. 

Our plan is simple, to capture the amazing response we have recognized over the last four years on film while fans and backers enjoy our cocktails at a live music show.  Don't have time to commit to an on site event?  Not a problem, chose one of our "product release options" and get the first crack at one of our limited edition new product releases.

Our connection with our community 

Along our path, we have retained focus on the responsibility of business to the community.  We have a drawer filled with thank you letters from various charitable organizations in response to the thousands of bottles we have donated for baskets, raffles, fund raising events and individuals.  In addition, our products are manufactured from American made raw goods.

In 2014 we launched Warrior Vodka (www.warriorvodka.org).  All proceeds from sales of Warrior Vodka are donated to the (501 c3) charitable organization - Cheers to The Warriors, which offers both financial and non-financial assistance to U.S. veterans in need.  Common sense might say that releasing a competing product into our own market isn't the best business decision, however we believe strongly in serving those who need help the most.   

Your support will help us compete with the mega-corporate brands

Through re-investment we have positioned our company to continue our path at the next level.  We will continue to stick to our values of supporting local communities and our philanthropic efforts.  

Risks & Challenges

We have always safeguarded and meticulously re-invested each dollar earned by our business into expansion and we will continue to do so throughout this campaign.  With that said, we know there are still stumbling blocks ahead of us as we continue to grow.      

Alternate support

If you are unable to contribute, but would still like to help our company take on the corporate giants, you can help by simply spreading the word.  Let your friends know that there are alternatives to buying products owned and produced by massive corporations.

story:
Short Summary

Top Deck Towers Cards & Games is a fun, safe, and reliable place for all your tabletop gaming needs.

  • Currently there are no shops that provide Fantasy Hobby Gaming experience on the North side of Tucson. We plan on changing this with a store dedicated to friendly customer service, knowledgeable staff, and community ties. Our owners have a very diverse and extensive knowledge of some of the most popular tabletop fantasy games. 
  • These funds will be used to pay for the first years rent, utilities, payroll, initial inventory, and emergency cash as needed.

 

What We Need & What You Get

  • We are trying to raise $5000 to help get our business operations started. Donations will help cover the costs of business from rent to payroll and everything in between.
  • All of our perks are designed to make you fell like part of the Top Deck Team. 
  • If we don't meet our goal, all funds raised will go to taking care of what they can. Every little bit helps in order to get us to the end goal.

The Impact

The Tucson, Arizona area has only a few Fantasy Tabletop Game Stores. Most are located in the Central and South-Central portion of town. This can make it difficult for people who enjoy playing fantasy games, and live on the North Side of town including Marana, Oro Valley, and North Tucson.

Currently there are no shops that provide well rounded Tabletop Fantasy Gaming experiences on the North side of Tucson. We plan on changing this with a store dedicated to friendly customer service, knowledgeable staff, and community ties.

Risks & Challenges

We are a first time business startup, we will face many challenges. 

  • Both owners have business experience managing and running someone else's store, now it's our turn to do it for ourselves.
  • We'll allways have our ears to the ground listening for what our customer's want.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Share our campaign with your friends and by word of mouth hopefully we can meet our goal
  • Use the Indiegogo share tools!
  • Remember to Like us on Facebook

story:
In short (Svensk version nedan) 

We are driving from London to Mongolia in a 1999 Renault Clio, to raise money for SOS Childrens' Villages Disaster Fund (supporting children's well being in disaster struck areas) and CoolEarth (rain forest preservation).

The purpose of this fundraiser is to cover some of our expenses (petrol, spares and basic equipment) to make it possible for us to reach the finishing line, 

Contributions start at $25, and we appreciate all the help we can get!
More info below. 

I korthet

Vi ska köra från London till Mongoliet i en 1999 Renault Clio, för att samla in pengar till SOS Barnbyars Katastroffond och den regnskogsbevarande organisationen CoolEarth.

Syftet med denna insamling är att få lite hjälp med vissa av de kostnader som är absolut nödvändiga (bensin, reservdelar och basutrustning) för att klara av att slutföra vårt äventyr.

Du kan ge ett bidrag från 25 dollar (ca 210 kronor) och vi uppskattar all hjälp vi kan få. Du kan också ge direkt till  SOS Barnbyar här.

Mer info nedan (på engelska).


An adventure of the heart

At some point in life you should embark on an adventure, something that you've always dreamed about. For us this is the Mongol Rally: an adventure that also gives us an opportunity to do good along the way. 

We are supporting a good cause by doing something that many people would label 'insane'. And it is (both a good cause and slightly insane). We’re going to take a small under-powered car, like the one our grannies used to drive, and drive it 14000 kilometers to the other side of the world - to raise money for charity and increase awareness of the importance of supporting child welfare in remote places.

This indiegogo page is to get a little support for equipment and stuff we need to have a decent chance of completing the rally, but we guarantee that at least 50% of  the support money raised on indiegogo will go to charity.

If you want to make sure that your every single cent goes straight to charity, we have a dedicated fundraiser here (unfortunately it's in Swedish but you can use Google translate or look at the translations at the bottom of this page). Whichever path you choose with your donation, we hope you'll check out the cool stuff we're giving to those who support our adventure - all listed on the right side of this page. 

If you want to support with things rather than money, check out the list of stuff we need  (further down on this page).

The rally, the car and the master plan

Organized by the Adventurists, the Mongol Rally launches teams of adventurous people crammed into tiny cars, and sends them on their way from London to Mongolia. Teams and cars have very different age, background and pedigree – but one thing they all have in common is that every single car is designed for a very very different purpose. It's not a race and it doesn't have a prize, the outcome is purely the money raised, and the adventure.

In the words of the organizers:
There’s no backup, no support and no set route; just you, your fellow adventurists and a tiny car you bought from a scrapyard for £11.50. If nothing goes wrong, everything has gone wrong. Bollocks to tarmac, ABS and gadgets that help you find your navel. The Mongol Rally is about getting lost, using your long neglected wits, raising shedloads of cash for charity and scraping into the finish line with your vehicle in tatters and a wild grin smeared across your grubby face. Neither your car, nor your life, will ever be the same again. The rules of the Rally are gloriously simple…
1. You can only take a farcically small vehicle
2. You’re completely on your own
3. You've got to raise a £1000 for charity 

Our car in its 'natural habitat'

This is our car, a '99 Renault Clio. It was designed to be an affordable city car with a minimum of extras. What we intend to do with this lovely piece of (French) equipment is the exact opposite of why it was conceived in the first place – driving it a very long distance and taking it way way way out of its' city comfort zone. 

We bought it off an old lady who only used it to church on Sundays - at least that's what the sales guy told us. It took less than a week for the first problem to arise (broken parking brake wire)  but we think our little gem will make it all the way…

The Plan

The Rally starts in London, but we will commence our journey in Stockholm, Sweden. From there we will drive to London, and onwards through France, Belgium, Germany, Austria, Croatia, Serbia, Bulgaria, Turkey, Georgia, Azerbaijan, Russia, Kazakhstan, Russia (again) and into Mongolia and Ulan Bator. From there we will do the final push up to Ulan Ude (Russia yet again). If all goes as planned (haha) we will make the journey in roughly 30 days.

Fundraising

Raising money for charity is central to us, ensuring that this adventure will be a positive force that does as much good along the way as humanly possible. Because we are both parents we have selected SOS Children's Villages as our charity of choice. As part of the Mongol Rally charity we will also donate £500 to CoolEarth, a charity that works alongside indigenous villages to halt rainforest destruction

Raising money for charity is part of the race, and we are setting our fundraiser bar high. But for that, we need your help.

SOS Children's Villages is an established global charity that engages and supports children in many of the countries on our planned route. They are active in 134 countries and territories around the world, working with a single mission: to ensure that every child grows with love, security and respect.

  - In 2013, over 82,000 children and young people worldwide were growing up with love and security in the care of an SOS Children's Villages home or youth programme.

- An additional 328,700 children and adults benefitted from the family strengthening programmes in 2013. Services include counseling, child care, vocational training and more.

- 164,000 children and young people worldwide were enrolled in SOS Children’s Villages kindergartens, schools and vocational training centres in 2013.

- SOS medical centres worldwide provided 857,000 health treatments to children and adults in 2013. In many places in the world, SOS Children's Villages is the only local provider of essential medical services.

Our commitment

We will guarantee a minimum donation of £1000, split between SOS Children’s Villages and Cool Earth - but we will do our utmost to make the total sum as high as possible by reaching out to family, friends, colleagues and personal networks. We will also do a separate donation dedicated to offset the CO2 footprint directly related to our participation in the Rally. 

We will provide continuous updates from the Rally in social media (make sure to check out https://www.facebook.com/TeamRedAdder). In these updates we will make sure to highlight the support we get from our Friends, Sponsors and Supporters. We will be generous with stories (ups and downs) and pictures (good ones and bad ones) and share the adventure with you all.

The Team

Team members Mats and Fredrik first met way North of the Arctic Circle, on the first freezing day of a 15 months long stretch in the National Military Service. It quickly became obvious (at least to us) that the combination of a laidback Northerner and a cocky Stockholmer created a very strong team. Over the years we've confirmed that our strengths complement each other and that, while we share a similar mindset, we use very different approaches to reach a similar outcome - which might come in handy when facing challenges or difficult situations. 

Our friendship has continued after the military service, and in early 2014 we decided to celebrate our quarter-century long friendship by doing something different: Some kind of adventure that would build on our longtime friendship while adding new memories and experiences to yarn about incessantly in the coming years. We selected Mongol Rally because of the sheer insanity of the idea, and because of the strong links to charity.

We chose name Team Red Adder, as a combined tribute to the main character of the book 'The Long Ships', a great story about the viking Röde Orm (Red Snake) traveling the world, and the greatest anti-hero of all times; Edmund Blackadder. 

Team members are Mats; a techie martial arts guy who lives for DIY home improvements, and Fredrik; an EBM (Electronic Body Music) fanatic who enjoys riding motorcycles, and fishing.

Why this Indiegogo campaign?

We are investing a lot of money, time and effort into this race, but we will also be dependent on sponsors and generous individuals to raise as much money for charity as possible - and to be able to complete the rally at all. Using the Indiegogo platform we can enable a larger audience to take part, all the way to Mongolia. 

Please take a look at the options on the right, or contact the Team (https://www.facebook.com/TeamRedAdder) if you have an idea for another way to support us. We appreciate every contribution - funds, gear or a friendly pat on the back are all very welcome.

Equipment & stuff we need 

An expedition like this requires quite a bit of equipment, but we won't be able to fit much in our car. Nevertheless, we will need a few things that are really critical and we would appreciate any help towards these items. If you sponsor us with items on this list, you will of course receive the rewards for the matching value! 
List (in no specific order of importance):
  • Petrol: About 1500 liters of the stuff 
  • Ferries, Tunnels & Road tolls
  • Car spare parts
  • Repair kits & tools
  • Gas & water cans
  • Camping equipment
  • Food & lodging (camping and the occasional hotel)
  • Visas & documents
  • Freight of team and car back from Siberia
  • Security items & 1st aid
  • Insurance & documents
An updated list of stuff needed and the latest sponsor news can be found on our Facebook page.

Translation help

If you're not fluent in Swedish (and wish to make a donation straight to charity) you might need some help donating on the unfortunately Swedish-only fundraising site at SOS Children's Villages. We would have liked to use a more international version, but apparently only the Swedish arm of SOS Children's Villages provide support for these personal online fundraisers...
Anyway, here are the screens you'll see with English translation. If you're still not sure how to do it, please get in touch with us and we'll help you out. 
The payment is of course secure. 
Starting point (amount is optional on this screen)

Screen 1: Setting amount and providing a message (please) and basic info

Screen 2: Entering card payment details (secure)
story_txt:
In short (Svensk version nedan) 
We are driving from London to Mongolia in a 1999 Renault Clio, to raise money for SOS Childrens' Villages Disaster Fund (supporting children's well being in disaster struck areas) and CoolEarth (rain forest preservation).



The purpose of this fundraiser is to cover some of our expenses (petrol, spares and basic equipment) to make it possible for us to reach the finishing line, 

Contributions start at $25, and we appreciate all the help we can get!
More info below. 

I korthet
Vi ska köra från London till Mongoliet i en 1999 Renault Clio, för att samla in pengar till SOS Barnbyars Katastroffond och den regnskogsbevarande organisationen CoolEarth.

Syftet med denna insamling är att få lite hjälp med vissa av de kostnader som är absolut nödvändiga (bensin, reservdelar och basutrustning) för att klara av att slutföra vårt äventyr.

Du kan ge ett bidrag från 25 dollar (ca 210 kronor) och vi uppskattar all hjälp vi kan få. Du kan också ge direkt till  SOS Barnbyar här.

Mer info nedan (på engelska).

An adventure of the heart

At some point in life
you should embark on an adventure, something that you've always dreamed about. For us this is the Mongol Rally: an adventure that also gives us an opportunity to do good along the way. 
We are supporting a good cause by
doing something that many people would label 'insane'. And it is (both a good
cause and slightly insane). We’re going to take a small under-powered car, like
the one our grannies used to drive, and drive it 14000 kilometers to the other
side of the world - to raise money for charity and increase awareness of the importance of supporting child welfare in remote places.
This indiegogo page is to get a little support for equipment and stuff we need to have a decent chance of completing the rally, but we guarantee that at least 50% of  the support money raised on indiegogo will go to charity.
If you want to make sure that your every single cent goes straight to charity, we have a dedicated fundraiser here (unfortunately it's in Swedish but you can use Google translate or look at the translations at the bottom of this page). Whichever path you choose with your donation, we hope you'll check out the cool stuff we're giving to those who support our adventure - all listed on the right side of this page. 
If you want to support with things rather than money, check out the list of stuff we need  (further down on this page).
The rally, the car and the master plan

Organized by the
Adventurists, the Mongol Rally launches teams of adventurous people
crammed into tiny cars, and sends them on their way from London to Mongolia. Teams
and cars have very different age, background and pedigree – but one thing they
all have in common is that every single car is designed for a very very
different purpose. It's not a race and it doesn't have a prize, the outcome is purely the money raised, and the adventure.
In the words of the organizers:There’s no backup, no support and no set route; just you, your fellow adventurists and a tiny car you bought from a scrapyard for £11.50. If nothing goes wrong, everything has gone wrong. Bollocks to tarmac, ABS and gadgets that help you find your navel. The Mongol Rally is about getting lost, using your long neglected wits, raising shedloads of cash for charity and scraping into the finish line with your vehicle in tatters and a wild grin smeared across your grubby face. Neither your car, nor your life, will ever be the same again. The rules of the Rally are gloriously simple…1. You can only take a farcically small vehicle2. You’re completely on your own3. You've got to raise a £1000 for charity 

Our car in its 'natural habitat'





This is our car, a '99 Renault Clio. It
was designed to be an affordable city car with a minimum of extras. What we
intend to do with this lovely piece of (French) equipment is the exact opposite of why it was conceived in the first place – driving it a very long distance and taking it way way way out of
its' city comfort zone. 
We bought it off an old lady who only used it to church on Sundays - at least that's what the sales guy told us. It took less than a week for the first problem to arise (broken parking brake wire)  but we think our little gem will make it all the way…
The Plan
The Rally starts in London, but we will commence our journey in Stockholm, Sweden. From there we will drive to London, and onwards through France, Belgium, Germany, Austria, Croatia, Serbia, Bulgaria, Turkey, Georgia, Azerbaijan, Russia, Kazakhstan, Russia (again) and into Mongolia and Ulan Bator. From there we will do the final push up to Ulan Ude (Russia yet again). If all goes as planned (haha) we will make the journey in roughly 30 days.



Fundraising

Raising money for
charity is central to us, ensuring that this adventure will be a positive force
that does as much good along the way as humanly possible. Because we are both parents we have selected SOS
Children's Villages as our charity of choice. As part of the Mongol Rally charity we will also donate £500 to CoolEarth, a charity that works alongside indigenous villages to halt rainforest destruction
Raising money for charity is part of the race, and we are setting our fundraiser bar high. But for that, we need your help.


SOS Children's Villages is an established global
charity that engages and supports children in many of the countries on our planned
route. They are active in 134 countries and territories around the world, working with a single mission: to ensure
that every child grows with love, security and respect.
 
- In 2013, over 82,000
children and young people worldwide were growing up with love and security in
the care of an SOS Children's Villages home or youth programme.
- An additional 328,700 children and adults benefitted from the family
strengthening programmes in 2013. Services include counseling, child care,
vocational training and more.
- 164,000 children and
young people worldwide were enrolled in SOS Children’s Villages kindergartens,
schools and vocational training centres in 2013.
- SOS medical centres
worldwide provided 857,000 health treatments to children and adults in 2013.
In many places in the world, SOS Children's Villages is the only local provider of
essential medical services.

Our commitment

We will guarantee a minimum donation of £1000, split between SOS Children’s Villages and Cool Earth - but we will do our utmost to make the total sum as high as possible by reaching out to family, friends, colleagues and personal networks. We will also do a separate donation dedicated to offset the CO2 footprint directly related to our participation in the Rally. 
We will provide continuous updates from the Rally in social media (make sure to check out https://www.facebook.com/TeamRedAdder). In these updates we will make sure to highlight the support we get from our Friends, Sponsors and Supporters. We will be generous with stories (ups and downs) and pictures (good ones and bad ones) and share the adventure with you all.


The Team

Team members Mats and Fredrik first met way North of the Arctic Circle, on the first freezing day of a 15 months long stretch in the National Military Service. It quickly became obvious (at least to us) that the combination of a laidback Northerner and a cocky Stockholmer created a very strong team. Over the years we've confirmed that our strengths complement each other and that, while we share a similar mindset, we use very different approaches to reach a similar outcome - which might come in handy when facing challenges or difficult situations. 
Our friendship has continued after the military service, and in early 2014 we decided to celebrate our quarter-century long friendship by doing something different: Some kind of adventure
that would build on our longtime friendship while adding new memories and
experiences to yarn about incessantly in the coming years. We selected Mongol
Rally because of the sheer insanity of the idea, and because of the strong links to charity.
We chose name Team Red Adder, as a combined tribute to the main character of the book 'The Long Ships', a great story about the viking Röde Orm (Red Snake) traveling the world, and the greatest anti-hero of all times; Edmund Blackadder. 
Team members are Mats; a techie martial arts guy who lives for DIY home improvements, and Fredrik; an EBM (Electronic Body Music) fanatic who enjoys riding motorcycles, and fishing.
Why this Indiegogo campaign?
We are investing a lot of money, time and effort into this race, but we will also be dependent on sponsors and generous individuals to raise as much money for charity as possible - and to be able to complete the rally at all. Using the Indiegogo platform we can enable a larger audience to take part, all the way to Mongolia. 
Please take a look at the options on the right, or contact the Team (https://www.facebook.com/TeamRedAdder) if you have an idea for another way to support us. We appreciate every contribution - funds, gear or a friendly pat on the back are all very welcome.


Equipment & stuff we need 

An expedition like this requires quite a bit of equipment, but we won't be able to fit much in our car. Nevertheless, we will need a few things that are really critical and we would appreciate any help towards these items. If you sponsor us with items on this list, you will of course receive the rewards for the matching value! List (in no specific order of importance):

Petrol: About 1500 liters of the stuff 

Ferries, Tunnels & Road tolls
Car spare parts
Repair kits & tools
Gas & water cans
Camping equipment

Food & lodging (camping and the occasional hotel)


Visas & documents

Freight of team and car back from Siberia
Security items & 1st aid
Insurance & documents

An updated list of stuff needed and the latest sponsor news can be found on our Facebook page.


Translation help

If you're not fluent in Swedish (and wish to make a donation straight to charity) you might need some help donating on the unfortunately Swedish-only fundraising site at SOS Children's Villages. We would have liked to use a more international version, but apparently only the Swedish arm of SOS Children's Villages provide support for these personal online fundraisers...

Anyway, here are the screens you'll see with English translation. If you're still not sure how to do it, please get in touch with us and we'll help you out. 
The payment is of course secure. 
Starting point (amount is optional on this screen)



Screen 1: Setting amount and providing a message (please) and basic info


Screen 2: Entering card payment details (secure)

story:
Dear Reader, 

On the morning of September 11, 2001, I woke up at 4 a.m., not knowing that this day would forever change my life. As a member of the National Guard, it was customary for me to wake up early in the morning to protect our country. I arose that day thanking God, the Almighty Creator, for allowing me to see another day. What happened – the falling of the dear Twin Towers that were a symbol of New York City for my entire life – will never be forgotten. From travels through the five boroughs, seeing the Channel 11 news logo, looking at every screen shot of the Empire State building and Statue of Liberty, I just kept thinking, “What great history New York holds in building this whole nation of America that we hold so dear.” 

The lives lost that day left an indelible mark on my life, health and physical well being. I witnessed the gruesome fragmented carnage of human life from my post at the Financial Center, which was turned into the morgue, I could feel the spirits of all those victims, whose children, mothers, fathers, brothers, sisters, grandchildren, and loved ones came with personal items pleading with us to find their lost family and friends. 

That day, I swore to myself that I would do something to help all the victims who remain captured from the 9/11 World Trade Center atrocity. My solution was to create a renewing solar farm dedicated to benefit 9/11 First Responder families. 

Please donate, share, and like this page so we can finalize this project, together.

Thank you,
 
Azriel Alleyne
Founder        
 

The Problems

 

Climate Change:  Because of global warming, there has been concern in the United States and internationally, that the U.S. should reduce total greenhouse gas emissions, which are relatively high per capita.  In New York State the Clean Energy Standard has been adopted, allowing for advancement in renewable and clean technologies to help mitigate climate change.  According to national research and scientist we may be the last generation to be able to make a difference.

 

9-11 First Responders have multiple diseases and injuries that are not covered by federal health programs.  With your help we want to provide benefits and extra health coverage.

How we plan to solve these problems?

 

 

 

The Jockey Hill Solar Farm will be solving these problems by creating renewable energy to lower Carbon Dioxide emissions.

The Jockey Hill Solar Farm will give profits from electricity produced to injured heroes to help take care of their families and medical bills not covered. 

The Jockey Hill Solar Farm is a Triple bottom line value based business model that focuses on supporting people, planet, and profit; creating sustainable communities.

Paradigm Shift

The implementation of our Solar project on a grand scale would change the world as we know it in significant ways. Imagine the possibilities of a  Solar Powered World: This will save the lives of countless animals and keep people living healthier too.  If you have a home or business in the Central Hudson Gas and Electric territory, you can stop using fossil fuel energy to power your home or office, appliances and electrical devices. Solar energy will power you while you work, shop or eat, using clean energy from the sun. Eventually, you'll be able to charge your Batteries and your life through panels from our site. The Jockey Hill Solar Farm will provide the infrastructure to make this possible.

 

 

 

What We Need & What You Get

We have already purchased a reclaimed landfill of almost 50 acres which will be the site of the solar farm. The land is unsuitable for homes, but is already largely cleared of trees and is shovel-ready. Now we need  to finish the engineering planning and logistics that are needed for us to get final approvals. This process is expensive, and we need your help. Once the approvals are ready, we will be able to obtain the financing required to create the farm and start producing solar energy. Below is a photo of the future site of the Jockey Hill Solar Farm.

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

The Impact

Taking care of 9/11 First Responders will give them a very real boost in terms of their finances and medical care, and psychologically it will remind them that their sacrifices are not forgotten.  The Clean Renewable Electricity produced from your donations will provide sustainable benefits that will be shared via a designated fund for 9/11 non-profit organizations.

The Challenges

Building a solar power installation is complex, but we are well on the way. We have a great deal of community support for our project. We are launching a community solar program under new New York State regulations which will synergize with the 9/11 First Responders' effort. We have a great team and with your help we can do it!
 
Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you can't contribute financially, you can still be involved and make a difference:

  • Please help us get the word out and make some noise about this campaign!
  • Don't forget to use the Indiegogo share tools and whatever social media platforms you use. Spread it out with your network!

On September 12, 2001, Private First Class Azriel Alleyne, who was a member of the National Guard, was ordered to the World Trade Center site of the fallen Twin Towers to provide help to survivors and other First Responders. The experiences he had that day changed his life forever.

 

Those first days at the site of the fallen towers were traumatic, and in fact toxic to the health of everyone who breathed in the airborne pollution. Like many others, Azriel worked at the site and did what he could. The result was a massive change in his physical health that has required a ten year recovery.

Unfortunately, the number of 9/11 First Responders who are sick is growing every day, and the financial support offered by the government is not fully covering their health costs. 9/11 First Responders stood up when they were nèeded and have paid the price: They are suffering, and so are their families. Frankly, many are in a difficult financial situation, and they need help.

Azriel was determined to help these First Responders and so he created Freedom Solar Alliances, an opportunity for the rest of us to heal the planet. Please join with us to help provide a brighter future for 9/11 First Responders and their families.

story: This project isn't quite what it seems. Yes, I am asking for funding to purchase a 1986-1992 Ford Bronco, but I'd like to offer the contributors something as well. Here's the deal, I've created this awesome Indiegogo campaign in order to raise money to purchase my very own Ford Bronco! My intention is to raise enough money to purchase the vehicle, pay the taxes on it, get a license plate, registration and inspection on it then pay for any repairs it might need as it is an old truck. I know what you're thinking, who cares if I want to buy a truck, well... YOU WILL! Just check out my list of awesome perks!

story:
Our Background and Overview – Campaign Description

Heavenly Sweets Bake Shop and Café is a traditional bakery serving the most delectable baked goods and savory soups, salads, and sandwiches.  Our products are made with the highest quality ingredients and baked with love.

Hi…I'm Francine and I started Heavenly Sweets Bake Shop a little over a year ago when my prayers were answered for God to show me my purpose.  I have always cooked and baked for as long as I can remember.  I come from a long line of excellent cooks including my mom Florida and my grandmas Mary and Sally.  They are all from the south, were raised on a farm, and possess some of the “meanest” recipes around.  Well it’s a blessing because I too inherited the cooking bug.

After many years of working in corporate America as an IT Software Developer and Project Manager, I knew that there had to be more for me.  Although I am thankful for the opportunities, my passion lied elsewhere.  Then almost 2 years ago, I began baking regularly again.  I always enjoyed baking, cooking, and serving, so this became my safe haven…bringing solace for me.  So I baked, and baked, and baked.  Everyone loved being my guinea pigs of course and I have always received positive feedback on my baked goods.  I had a few family and friends who worked for various corporations, so I sent some of my treats to their corporate meetings.  To my surprise, I received rave reviews…along with a few orders.  However, I wasn’t in business yet!  Both my parents and I have owned businesses before, so it didn’t shock me that my entrepreneurial spirit kicked in.  I needed a name for the business.  I always keep God in the midst of everything that I do and I knew that the next time I owned a business; I wanted to make sure it helped others.  So Heavenly Sweets Bake Shop was born and now here we are determined to open its first location.

Heavenly Sweets Bake Shop intends on helping the community in several ways.  First, we will source the ingredients for our products from local vendors as much as possible.  We will also provide additional jobs, which we hope will also help the economy.  Additionally, we want to be a help in the fight against hunger.  Our plan is to daily provide perfectly good food, such as soups and sandwiches that would otherwise go to waste to various shelters and the homeless in need.  Eventually, we plan on procuring an “Angel Truck”, which will make deliveries to these locations and individuals.

I feel so blessed and want to be a blessing to others.  God bless and thank you for all of your help!!!  We truly appreciate it.

How can you be an Angel for us?

When the concept of Heavenly Sweets Bake Shop was born, it was always my initial intentions to keep debt to a minimum, so that focus can remain on running the business instead of the stress of paying back debt.  I have put a great deal of my own money into this venture, however, as a single mom, it has become increasingly tougher to fund both a start up and run a household.  This is why I am requesting your help.

We are asking for $5,000.  The funds raised will go towards some minor renovations and décor of the bakery/café space, purchase of various equipment needed to operate (convection oven, display cases, commercial sink, and refrigerator), supplies needed for operation (boxes, packaging), and some of the licenses and fees that may result from opening a food establishment. 

If you choose to donate, you will be able to select one of our delectable perks listed in this campaign.  Among our perks are a dozen of our signature cupcakes, a t-shirt displaying our new logo, or your chance to create your very own cupcake! We are sure that whatever perk you select, you will surely enjoy it.

Risks & Challenges, but our Angels are watching over us!

Some of life’s greatest achievements came with risk.  Risk isn’t necessarily always negative.  For me, increases my faith and make me stronger and more hopeful.  It is known that the restaurant business can be risky.  However, with a solid plan in place and once again, lots of faith and support, we have the tools to mitigate almost any risk that should arise.  The knowledge I gained while earning my MBA, as a previous business owner, and my knowledge and over 12 years of experience as a Project Manager, gives me the proper training to handle the risks and challenges while successfully organizing and running a business.  Additionally, I have multiple years of experience in the food industry in various roles, including 3 years of managing the bakery my family owned.  Being in the restaurant business can be stressful and risky in various aspects, but with the support of our Angels, that’s you and our community, and especially God, all things are possible!

Other Ways You Can Help

If you are unable to contribute at this time, don’t worry, you are still an Angel to us!  There are other ways you can help:

  • Use the Indiegogo share tools to spread the news about our campaign to your family and friends.
  • Follow us on Instagram @heavenly_sweetsss and spread the love

Thank you kindly for your support, whatever that may be and God bless!!!

How
can you be an Angel for us?
When the concept of Heavenly Sweets
Bake Shop was born, it was always my initial intentions to keep debt to a
minimum, so that focus can remain on running the business instead of the stress
of paying back debt.  I have put a great deal of my own money into this
venture, however, as a single mom, it has become increasingly tougher to fund
both a start up and run a household.  This is why I am requesting your
help.
We are asking for $5,000.  The
funds raised will go towards some minor renovations and décor of the
bakery/café space, purchase of various equipment needed to operate (convection
oven, display cases, commercial sink, and refrigerator), supplies needed for
operation (boxes, packaging), and some of the licenses and fees that may result
from opening a food establishment. 
If
you choose to donate, you will be able to select one of our delectable perks
listed in this campaign.  Among our perks are a dozen of our signature cupcakes,
a t-shirt displaying our new logo, or your chance to create your very own
cupcake! We are sure that whatever perk you select, you will surely enjoy it.
Risks
& Challenges, but our Angels are watching over us!
Some of life’s greatest achievements
came with risk.  Risk isn’t necessarily
always negative.  For me, increases my
faith and make me stronger and more hopeful. 
It is known that the restaurant business can be risky.  However, with a solid plan in place and once
again, lots of faith and support, we have the tools to mitigate almost any risk
that should arise.  The knowledge I gained
while earning my MBA, as a previous business owner, and my knowledge and over
12 years of experience as a Project Manager, gives me the proper training to
handle the risks and challenges while successfully organizing and running a
business.  Additionally, I have multiple
years of experience in the food industry in various roles, including 3 years of
managing the bakery my family owned. 
Being in the restaurant business can be stressful and risky in various
aspects, but with the support of our Angels, that’s you and our community, and
especially God, all things are possible!
Other
Ways You Can Help
If you are unable to contribute at
this time, don’t worry, you are still an Angel to us!  There are other ways you can help:

Use the Indiegogo share tools to spread the news about
     our campaign to your family and friends.
Follow us on Instagram @heavenly_sweetsss and spread
     the love

Thank you kindly for your support, whatever that may be and
God bless!!!

story:
Short Summary

The Story - an uplifting community project.

The Sharing Shed - a place for the local community to get together, have a space in which to create, sell and promote themselves and their art. Ideally we would like to have the whole building be eco-friendly with using only solar and wind energy. The bistro will only use produce grown on the property with a re-usable energy system. The whole property will be a waste-free environment where all materials get's re-used into either art, furniture or to sustain growth of produce. 

Local artists/carpenters/health specialists will share a space where everything they create or build will be displayed and put up for sale to establish a supporting community. We've got the perfect location, now we just need to raise the funds to buy the building, do a make over and get all of the artists participating a decent spot to exhibit and sell their goods. A self-sustaining coffee shop/bistro as well as a carpentry shop, artists studios, secondhand furniture and antique finds shops. Local crafters will be able to display and sell their goods without having to pay a fee towards the space they use for displaying. Photography courses will be on offer as well as art classes and basic carpentry classes. Many more possibilities for all creatives to have the chance to put back into the community and for the community to support local talent. 

What We Need & What You Get

All funding will go towards buying a building, setting up a workspace for all artists and contributors, marketing and buying stock.

The Impact

A permanent art-market in the area would help local artists to earn an income without having to over-price their stock as it would be a self-sustaining income. If we can buy the building and do all the necessary building and set-up upfront the artists won't need to be paying out a monthly amount to have their art on display. Many local artists have to display their art on street corners or alongside the road and do not have the funds to have a permanent place to display their works to tourists etc. The Sharing Shed is intended to uplift the local art community and draw tourists. All furniture etc within the bistro would be made by local carpenters and be up for sale - everything within the Sharing Shed would be for sale and artists and creators will have a space to teach their skills to others interested in doing the same. A lifestyle area for health and fitness enthusiasts will be available as well as a Photography School. The local bistro would be self-sustaining with growing their own vegetables on the land and supplying vegetable to be sold to the community. The goal is to have all produce needed to run the bistro grown on site, except of course any meat produce.

story:
Bring the first E-Sports Gaming Bar to South Florida

Help us raise the money necessary to secure a location and equipment to open an innovative new e-gaming bar.

Our Story

My name is Matt, and my business partner is John. We are looking to use indiegogo to bring gamers of all types to South Florida's first E-sports Gaming Bar.

As part of the gamer's generation ourselves, we have been actively involved in the gaming community for a number of years. We have combined our love for gaming with our experience in the service industry to start our own business.

John and I have been working to bring this dream to reality for some time now, and have come to the realization that we need additional funding to make it happen. We are passionate about opening our E-Sports Gaming Bar and know that it will be a unique establishment for the Southern Florida area.

An e-sports bar is similar to a traditional sports bar, but instead of broadcasting sports like football, basketball, etc., internet-based video games are broadcasted. In addition, the bar can offer events where players and spectators to come watch and compete.

OPENING EARLY 2016!!!


The Impact:

Our campaign is important because we will use every penny donated to go to the business, and provide the very best place to play, drink, or watch an e-sports stream. (Such as WOW, Street Fighter, LOL, StarCraft, and more!).

As entrepreneurs familiar with the gaming community, we have seen that there is an opportunity in the area for this kind of gaming bar. In the past, E-Sports has mostly been an at-home activity. Our goal is to bring the concept of a sports bar with Video Games, so the gaming community has a place to network, play their favorite games, and hone their skills against their peers.

The bar will be a great place for gamers to drink, play a game with a friend, or even to just watch people play. Video games and "e-sports" are quickly gaining in popularity, and the fact that so many gamers will leave the house to watch OTHER gamers play video games is astonishing. Just like regular sports, there are many gamers that have huge fans and followers. These popular gamers are also signing autographs, so it just shows how big e-sports really is!

Some Examples:

At Chicago's Ignite Gaming Lounge, crowds lined up before midnight, not to play video games, but to watch e-sports such as the League of Legends world championship being played half-a-world away, in South Korea.

And in Seoul more than 40,000 people packed into a stadium to watch the video game competitions live. It was in South Korea where the video game competition phenomenon was coined as "e-Sports".


Our bar will provide a great atmosphere and an environment that encourages gamers to be gamers. In addition, we will be able to create an atmosphere that welcomes spectators to come and watch their favorite gamers fight against their competitors. We want to break into this market and be the first to provide this innovative entertainment to our area!

What we Need & What You Get:

We've already put in thousands of our own money, but we need help raising our last $50,000 so we can make our dream a reality. The money will go towards securing our location, game consoles, opening inventory, and equipment needed for the bar to operate. While this may seem like a lot, with the power of crowd funding we can easily make this a reality for just the investment of one night out with friends!

We want our potential donors to know that we take their investment in our business seriously. We know there are many projects to donate to, and we appreciate your support. To show that we appreciate your generosity, all contributors are invited to our pre-launch party after we hit our goal. We can't wait to meet you all!

Donations to our project will not just be giving us the funds to open our business but to keep us going in the crucial first months after opening the doors.  

Other Ways To Help

If you can't donate at this time, there are still many ways you can help! Please share our story via social media, email and word of mouth to tell your friends about our campaign. If you live in the Southern Florida area, spread the word that the first E-Sports Gaming Bar is coming soon! Thank you in advance!
