story:
Who We Are

As a Michigan nonprofit, A Few Good Men iden­ti­fies local needs and calls men and women to action to meet those needs. Agree­ing with Edmund Burke “all that is nec­es­sary for the tri­umph of evil is that good men do noth­ing,” A Few Good Men chal­lenges cit­i­zens to embrace their respon­si­bil­ity to serve and pro­tect the defense­less. In response to Jesus Christ’s entreaty to “love the Lord your God…and love your neigh­bor as your­self,” A Few Good Men seeks to equip ser­vant lead­ers to plead the cause of the afflicted and needy, break down walls of iso­la­tion, and affirm the intrin­sic worth of human life by serv­ing those who can give noth­ing in return. Part­ner­ing with indi­vid­u­als, churches, busi­nesses, local gov­ern­ment, and non-profit orga­ni­za­tions, A Few Good Men estab­lishes a true safety net of rela­tion­ships, fos­ter­ing com­mu­nity independence.

What We Need 

And with that said, A Few Good Men Inc. is looking for your help! As we approach the summer of 2015, we want to take AFGM to the next level.  But what does "the next level" mean? It means we would like to bring on our first full time staff member.  Let's break it down. 
  • The majority of more than 75 volunteers are college students, often balancing part-time work, studying for class, and volunteering for AFGM. During the school year, about a dozen crews complete projects on a consistent basis, investing 180 hours a week to meet needs in the community. 
  • However, when a large percentage of our volunteer "workforce" departs every May, our ability to meet needs is dramatically reduced in the summer months. 
  • Hiring a full-time operations officer would benefit the vision and mission of AFGM. Our goal of $10,000.00 would allow us to provide reliable, 'round the clock service through the summer and into the coming fall months. 
  • Ultimately, we'd like to see AFGM take root in other counties around Michigan to equip community members to see their own needs and meet them. This fundraising campaign is a small step to grow AFGM inside of its current community, and a big step toward growing into a new community.
  • With the success of this fundraising campaign, the leadership of our first full-time staff member, and the guidance of our board of directors, we will be more fully equipped to create exponentially greater impact on the lives of those in need. We look forward to this opportunity with great eagerness.

The Impact

Since 2012, A Few Good Men Inc. has been meeting the needs of those in the community every day. From shoveling sidewalks or placing new roofs to just being somebody’s friend, together our team has made a difference in the Hillsdale County community and we plan to continue that as consistently as possible. Check out the graph below. 

With the systems we've developed, we've created a way for needs to be met in an ever-increasingly efficient and organized manner. And every year we've increased that efficiency and organization. With the trend found within the above chart moving in a positive direction, we believe that the impact of a full-time Operations Officer, we will continue to refine our system and expand our capacity to meet more and more needs effectively. 

Additionally, the statistics listed above are needs that we've met and can be physically counted. But these projects are just the physical aspect of needs that AFGM meets in the community. Making regular calls, follow-ups with those who are in ill spirits, and maintaining friendships, are difficult to measure but make just as much of a difference as installing a new roof (if not more!). These intangible needs we strive to meet as well. For more information, please visit our website: www.afewgoodmen.org 

The impact A Few Good Men has had and could have on future communities, we believe, is priceless and we need your help to create this impact in as many people's lives as we can.

Risks & Challenges

With all the demands in peoples' lives these days, we realize that volunteering is not easy and takes time away from other responsibilities. This is probably one of our biggest hurdles.  But the team at AFGM has worked hard to build a system that allows streamlined volunteering (please see website under "Serve" for more details.) With a two year track record in Hillsdale County, we believe that the "next step" will be successful. 

Other Ways You Can Help

Join A Few Good Men Inc. and become part of a crew! If you don't have time or energy to serve, there are other opportunities for you to join us in meeting needs. Please do not hesitate to contact us at: info@afewgoodmen.org and we'll find a way to use your talents and resources to help meet the needs. 

  • PS. Don't forget to share this link!

story:
Our Story

We’re Scott and Felicia Holtz, serial entrepreneurs and lovers of Skokie, Illinois. We are on a quest to bring yoga to our hometown and the surrounding area by opening North Branch Yoga. This is an independent yoga studio located in beautiful downtown Skokie which will provide classes for men, women and children of all ages and abilities.

Our love for Skokie is at the heart of this project and our mission is to improve the overall well-being of our community through yoga. Skokie is a unique place made up of a diverse group of citizens. Over the last decade we have proudly been a part of a renaissance in the downtown area. We have worked hand-in-hand with fellow business owners, Village leaders and community members for many community efforts. The opening of North Branch Yoga will add to the lively atmosphere of our village.

We are connected to our community. Scott is the vice-president for the Downtown Skokie Merchants Group (I.M.O.D.S.) and a long-time board member of the Chamber of Commerce. He is also the creator and producer of Wednesdays on the Green and lead designer at the website development firm, The Holtz Group – 5207 Inc. Felicia is a local school board member and the assistant director at a massage clinic on the North Shore. She is also certified to teach children’s yoga. Scott and Felicia have a son  who is a Boy Scout and student at Lincoln Junior High School.

The idea for North Branch Yoga was born last fall when we organized yoga classes during our Farmer’s Market. Attendance was outstanding with more than 45 fellow yogis joining the event and demonstrated a need and love in our community for yoga. We then started a month long Sunday morning series of classes at Skokie Theatre. The seed was now planted for North Branch Yoga and a permanent home for yoga in our community is now becoming a reality.

What We Need

Here’s how you can help. We have searched long and hard and found our home for North Branch Yoga.  The space we settled on was a long empty storefront that had ample parking and a bus stop. It will be a wonderful home but it was in  rough shape and needed a lot work such as patching, painting, electrical work, lighting, signage, and eventually a new floor

We need help supporting the studio in its early days. You can help offset the purchase of props and assist us with funds to improve the conditions of the studio. The support you provide will help us purchase the following:

  • $2,000 will help offset the purchase of blocks, straps, bolsters and blankets.
  • $3,000 for signage, electrical work, lighting and paint.
  • $500 for new fans and floor repairs.

We have chosen the Flexible campaign option and every penny raised will go directly to the studio.

Check out www.northbranchyoga.com and our Facebook page to follow our progress. We won’t hesitate to roll up our sleeves and contribute the elbow grease and sweat to make this studio great.

What You Get

North Branch Yoga is for our community and by our community. We plan to incorporate community giving into our programming. It is who we are, and what we do.

Any new business carries an element of uncertainty. Our first goal is to get people through our doors to discover the profound benefits that yoga offers. Scott has excellent  marketing, social media and event planning skills. Felicia speaks with clarity about the physical, mental and emotional benefits of yoga as a trained massage therapist and bodyworker. We have 35 years of combined retail experience and can create an environment that instantly induces peace and relaxation.

Most of all, we love our community and with grit and determination we will thrive.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you are not able to help us out financially, we still appreciate your support! Please use social media or pass this link along to someone who may have interest in our work. Every positive word and action counts! If you live in the Skokie area and can provide services we may need, we appreciate that type of support as well.

We are infinitely grateful for everyone who contributes and we intend to freely express our thanks with:

  • The opportunity to sign our tree of gratitude or a class dedication.
  • A North Branch t-shirt or gift cards to a local restaurant to show your community spirit.
  • One lucky donor will receive one-of-a-kind artwork from Franco, of Aw Yeah comics.
  • Select donors can celebrate with a yoga party in our beautiful space. 

We look forward to building an oasis of calm, where people of all levels of activity feel they can find balance, unwind or be challenged.

Please join us as we promote peace one breath, one pose at a time!

Attendance was outstanding with more than 45 fellow yogis joining the event and demonstrated a need and love in our community for yoga. We then started a month long Sunday morning series of classes at Skokie Theatre. The seed was now planted for North Branch Yoga and a permanent home for yoga in our community is now becoming a reality.
   What We Need 
Here’s
how you can help. We have searched long and hard and found our home for North
Branch Yoga.  The space we settled on was a long empty storefront
that had ample parking and a bus stop. It will be a wonderful home but it was in  rough shape and needed a lot work such as patching, painting, electrical work,
lighting, signage, and eventually a new floor
We
need help supporting the studio in its early days. You can help offset the purchase of props and assist us with funds to improve
the conditions of the studio. The support you provide will help us purchase the following: 


$2,000 will help offset the purchase of blocks, straps, bolsters and blankets.
$3,000 for signage,
electrical work, lighting and paint.
$500 for new fans and floor repairs.

We
have chosen the Flexible campaign option and every penny raised will go
directly to the studio. 
Check
out www.northbranchyoga.com and our Facebook page to follow our progress. We
won’t hesitate to roll up our sleeves and contribute the elbow grease and sweat
to make this studio great.


What You Get

North
Branch Yoga is for our community and by our community. We plan to incorporate
community giving into our programming. It is who we are, and what we
do.
Any
new business carries an element of uncertainty. Our first goal is to get people
through our doors to discover the profound benefits that yoga offers. Scott has
excellent  marketing, social media and
event planning skills. Felicia speaks with clarity about the physical, mental
and emotional benefits of yoga as a trained massage therapist and bodyworker.
We have 35 years of combined retail experience and can create an environment
that instantly induces peace and relaxation.
Most
of all, we love our community and with grit and determination we will thrive.
Other Ways You Can Help
If
you are not able to help us out financially, we still appreciate your support!
Please use social media or pass this link along to someone who may have
interest in our work. Every positive word and action counts! If you live
in the Skokie area and can provide services we may need, we appreciate that type of support as well.
We are infinitely grateful for
everyone who contributes and we intend to freely express our thanks with:


The opportunity to sign our tree of gratitude or a class dedication.
A North Branch t-shirt or gift cards to a local
restaurant to show your community spirit.
One lucky donor will receive one-of-a-kind artwork from
Franco, of Aw Yeah comics.
Select donors can celebrate with a yoga party in our
beautiful space. 

We look forward to building an oasis
of calm, where people of all levels of activity feel they can find balance,
unwind or be challenged. 
Please join us as we promote peace one
breath, one pose at a time!

story:
Our Goal: to build a new place for IE students to meet and relax

Where: Up the steps across from the refectory

Why: A group of architecture students have been designing a pavilion for the last couple of months, and now it's time to build it! Trouble is, there is only enough money from the Uni and our personal contributions for (maybe) half a model, and we want to build a real pavilion for everyone to enjoy! 

We are ready to build the cell pavilion and will be around the Uni fundraising and spreading the word, so please help us make the Uni a more beautiful place with a small contribution! We will also be having a BAKE SALE within the coming weeks as well as some other games where you can win prizes! 

This is something we want everyone at IE to enjoy for years to come and something we are committed to constructing. The more money we get, the higher quality materials we will use, and the more joy you will get out of this beautiful structure!

Thank You from the Cell Pavilion team!

story:
Join Squrry and help make Toronto the friendliest city in Canada!

Ask any foreigner who has met a Canadian abroad and they’ll tell you, Canadians are some of the friendliest people on the planet. But ask any Canadian about a Torontonian and you’ll get an entirely different answer. Come on, you know it’s true.

Whether we deserve it or not, we all know Toronto gets a bad rap amongst Canadians. We are seen as financially focused, concrete loving, high-rise dwelling, smart phone addicts, who really aren’t connected to the rest of Canada, let alone our very own neighbours. But those of us who proudly call the city home, know Toronto is, and can be, so much more than that.  

At Squrry we have a big dream. We want to make Toronto - a city known more for it’s tall buildings, great lakes, and stock exchanges, than it’s warm, welcoming, people - the friendliest place in Canada. Sound like a lofty goal? You bet it is. That’s why we launched the Campaign for Real Friends. Because we can’t do it alone.

With your help, we can create more community, and more real friendships, by using Squrry’s platform to introduce, foster, and build connections amongst like-minded Torontonians. Today, while there’s dating sites aplenty, and meeting sites that will leave you with many business cards but not many true friends, no single website is focused on building real friendships – the offline, old fashioned kind. No one until Squrry.

At Squrry, we use our technology to facilitate in-person connections with people we know you’ll have something in common with, at places and times that suit you best, for meetings in smaller, intimate groups (or Squrries as we like to call them). We are truly committed to helping you find real, lasting friendships in this city because "Facebookships," quite frankly, are falling a little short.

So...how can you help?

Currently, Squrry is being solely funded by our two co-founders, but our dreams of a friendlier Toronto are much bigger than our RRSPs. So rather than go to investors, we wanted to first go to the very people for whom we want to grow and enhance our service. Squrry is a site built for Torontonians, and we hope, by Torontonians.

For every dollar you contribute, not only can you feel good about your contribution to make Toronto a friendlier place, but also, you can win a chance at a ticket to Squrry’s “White Squirrel” summer rooftop party, being held on Thursday, July 30th – the UN’s official International Day of Friendship. The Party will be held on the Spoke Club's downtown Toronto rooftop patio, Thursday before the long weekend. It will be an intimate affair as far as party goes. Only 80 people all dressed in white, a DJ, an open bar with cocktails and canapés, an open roof and open minds.

How can you get to this party?

There are 3 ways you can contribute and get a chance to attend the summer party:

1. Buy one of 5 guaranteed, 6 ticket packages in our Perk Campaign below

30 tickets will be reserved for 5, $1000 perk packages. In the event that not all tickets are sold through this perk, those tickets will then be distributed in pairs to the top contributors, starting with the largest contributions.

2. Be one of the top 10 overall contributors

Every dollar you contribute increases your chances to be one of the top 10 contributors and win 2 tickets to Squrry’s White Squirrel party. In the event of a tie (eg: two individuals who contribute the same amount) the person who contributed first shall receive the tickets. Each contributor will receive a “save the date” email with link to the Squrry campaign page and confirmation of their contribution, with an option to opt-in for campaign updates. Check Squrry.com regularly to see where you are in the contribution standings.

3. Win a pair of tickets by signing up for Squrries

Each time you create or attend a Squrry you will receive an entry into a draw for one pair of 20 tickets.

Final winners and top contributors will be announced on Saturday July 25 after the campaign officially closes at midnight July 24th.  Announcements will be made on Squrry.com, Indiegogo, and winners will be notified by email. Please be sure to “save the date” the evening of Thursday, July 30.

Other perks and incentives

In addition, we are holding a little friendly competition to see which Toronto neighbourhoods are indeed the friendliest! We will track the number of Squrry registrants during the campaign to see which is the most open, friendly neighbourhood in Toronto. Check Squrry.com for more info.

Not feeling competitive but just want to contribute to a better Toronto and a better Squrry? We also have limited edition, Campaign for Real Friends perks, for everything from buttons to bags to t-shirts, with our limited edition, "I heart TO" logo, specially designed for the campaign.

What we will do with your donations

Squrry was launched March 1, 2015 to a lot of positive and friendly feedback. People loved the site so much they wanted to see improvements – and we wanted to see even more people using it to foster new friendships. Here’s a brief snapshot of where your money is going:

· Adding new, critical team members (ie: developers, designers, and community managers) 

· Enhancing the website to add new functionality and features

· Development of iOS and Android Apps

· Local advertising and Public Relations

· Online, geo-targeted advertising to grow our user base

· Holding a summer patio party to remember!

Other ways you can help

Are you a little tight on cash but still want to help?

We understand that sometimes, you just can’t swing a donation but it doesn’t mean you still can’t contribute to make Toronto the friendliest city in Canada in other ways. If a donation is not in the budget you can help us by sharing this campaign with your network. Or if you are interested in helping us spread the word, we are always looking for volunteers to help us with small, outdoor campaigns. Finally, if time and money are both tight, you can always just sign up for Squrry and join a Squrry when your schedule frees up. We hope to see all of you at a Squrry soon! :)

Thank you for your interest in the Campaign for Real Friends!

Stephanie & Nicolas

The Fine Print

*Please note we can at this time only send Perks to Contributors with a valid mailing address in Canada.
**The White Squirrel Party location and time will be confirmed on July 25th. If we have not reached a minimum of $10,000 in contributions at that time, the party will be cancelled.

story:
Communication via PLC

(Power Line Communication)

The majority of home automation systems works via radio, Wi-Fi, or Bluetooth, which generates a generous quantity of electromagnetic waves in the home.
domomob transmits the information via PLC. This system uses the preexisting electrical cables of the house, so it doesn’t emit any radiation into the home's atmosphere.
Experts says that extreme precautions need to be taken with electromagnetic radiations.

Smart Home

domomob brings intelligence and full automation to your home, or office, from anywhere in the world. Make your life easier!

  • Program to open the blinds to see the sunlight in the morning or close them in the evening for total privacy
  • Set the temperature of your home remotely
  • Connect all your devices into a power strip and turn it off at night (not "standby" consum)
  • Open the front door without moving from the sofa
  • Assistance bracelet will send a signal to your mobile phone in case any minor emergency befalls your loved ones
  • Surveillance cameras will alert you on your mobile phone of any suspicious activity, no matter where you are
  • and so on...

Everything is possible with domomob,
wherever you are

Easy to configure

Insert the product and security codes, plug it in, and it works.

All devices are Plug&Play. The settings can be installed in a few seconds, even by people without any technical knowledge.

From PC

Control all the devices instantly from the domomob website. You can also add users, program devices, groups, scenes, etc.


From Tablet or Mobile

Download the app, open it and control all the devices right away.


It works without an Internet connection

The majority of the home automation systems does not work without having constant access to the Internet. domomob maintains the existing settings, so it keep working even if there is no access to the internet.
Even with the miniserver disconnected, the old previously installed settings keeps working.

domomob: proprietary technology

PLC technology (Power Line Communication)

Our unique PLC technology was created by our own engineers with the primary purpose of achieving the highest security: hardware, electronic devices, software, operative systems, appliance’s assemblage codes, and streaming from owners.
Our system functions with the home automation devices that we have designed only, ensuring a closed system provided with inviolable codes and total security. Involving other brand’s devices means insecurity. That is why domomob is a reliable, secure system.
Proprietary communication system that creates its own network of points of repetition between floors and devices for maximum range and security, isolated from external control devices.
Proper mechanisms controlled by the mini server from user’s web, apps and cloud’s server.


domomob’s adaptable features

Have an idea for additional purposes? If requested, auxiliary systems can be programmed for a particular purpose. These devices will be prepared to suit the customer’s demands.

domomob assistance

The assistance bracelet emits a signal which reaches the mobile phone connected to it, and the indoor camera is immediately shown.

Controlling mechanisms

domomob is the only system which allows the use of the home installation. In case of system disconnection, all devices will continue running manually.
The hardware and software systems are developed and tested, and are ready to be made in scale.

Devices that can be seen

Miniserver Plug Automatic entryphone
Indoor camera Outdoor camera Assistance bracelet

Hidden devices

Blinds
Switch
Switched
Regulable light
Automatic door
Garage door


domomob provides security

deters

If you won’t be home, program a scene that turns on the lights, or raises the blinds, as if the house was occupied.

detects

The external and internal cameras, as well as the door and window sensors, will warn you if they detect movement or openings.
You can connect to cameras from anywhere in the world to check if all is in order and notify the police if otherwise.

alerts

domomob will alert you of any activity taking place in your home while you are away.
domomob also monitors for any unwanted occurrences, including flood, fire, unnecessary power consumption, etc.

Security is important

domomob is a technological innovation product and a proprietary development system, tested and technologically advanced: no risks in its use are expected.


  • Anti-copy security system of emission-reception codes changing for every use.
  • 128 bits encryption system of all communications.
  • Live status monitoring of each device (lamps, sockets, switches, blinds, etc...)
  • Blocks system intrusion or interference to the system.
  • Monitoring system, control of all modules and “feedback” system without the user’s help: self-sufficient system.
  • Warning system controlled from the web and App's.
  • Administration and auto-edition system of the graphical environment from the web, and control panel and adjustable parameters edition of the system.
  • Mobile control App system: using 3G, 4G or ADSL compatible with smartphones, mobiles and tablets for the Apple iOS, Android or Windows Phone systems.
  • One user’s account can control different houses, second residences, buildings, floors, industrial premises, businesses or any place to control and monitor.
  • Easy to share the use of any device with others users (family members for example)

Privacy is important

Our cameras have protection to avoid prying eyes. It can only be operated remotely using a special code administrator.
The indoor camera is also provided with a switch to disconnect it manually. We use 128-bit encryption for all communication.

Packs

Timeline

Our team

We are a multidisciplinary team dedicated to create a home automation system that is easy to install (Plug&Play).
We are very interested in providing users with a simple, secure, usable, and comfortable system.
We are very concerned about the amount of electromagnetic waves to which we are exposed. For that reason, we operate on our own communication system, PLC (Power Line Communications). The communication travels through the electrical wires of the house and do not emit electromagnetic waves.

Xavier Bellatriu
Co-founder		 Rafel Duran
Co-founder		 Xavi Bellatriu Jr
Software Architect
Borja Villanueva
Telecommunication engineer		 Alberto Pueyo
Marketing and sales		 Joana Mons
Marketing and sales
Albert Bellatriu
Accounting & Finance		 Aaron Santos
Developer of computer apps		 Rafa Duran
Transport & Logistics
Maria Magrià
Community manager

FAQ's

1. General questions

Is it very difficult to install domomob home automation system?
No. domomob is very easy and doesn’t require any technical knowledge.

What accessories do I need?
The only indispensable product is the miniserver, the brain of the entire system.

How many accessories do I need?
As many as your desired system requires.

Can I add accessories later?
Yes. To add new devices to your system, you only have to copy the security code in your online profile of domomob.

How can I buy additional accessories?
You can buy accessories during the indiegogo campaign, or later in the online shop www.domomob.com. Our sponsors will have the same price as the indiegogo campaign.

Can I buy two miniservers, one for the house and one for the office?
Yes. You can buy one miniserver for each location, house, second residence, office, etc. and control everything from the same user.

I want to be up to date of your innovations. How can I participate?
Being sponsor with a 5€ contribution, we will inform you by email of all the news and innovations about domomob.


2. Questions concerning the purchase

Will I receive an order confirmation?
Once the indiegogo campaign is finished, you will receive a confirmation email with the requested order.

I have not received my confirmation email, should I worry?
If you don’t receive the email within 96 hours since the campaign finished (be sure the email has not been considered as spam), you should send us an email to db@domomob.com, so that we can review the incidence.

How can I enlarge devices to my indiegogo kit?
After the campaign you will receive an email with the description of your indiegogo kit and a link if you want to expand the devices.

When will I receive my reward?
Our sponsors’ rewards will be sent from December 2015 onwards.

Do the products have warranty?
Yes, they have. The warranty covers any production defect during 1 year. Any problem that might ocurr will be solved as soon as possible, just contact us at db@domomob.com.


3. Privacy and security

Can I switch the camera off?
The indoor camera has a button which, when pressed, sends a message to the mobile which domomob is connected to, alerting that the indoor camera has been disconnected.
The camera has also a remote device which allows to disconnect the camera through a special user code.


4. Technical issues

Does domomob use other producer devices?
No, it does not. domomob only usesour own products which have been previously tested and proved by our experts to avoid having any security and reliability problems.

Do the apps have any cost?
All apps are entirely free.

What happens if internet goes off?
If the internet or the mini server stopped working, domomob devices would still work.

What happens if electricity goes off?
If the electricity goes off all the systems stops working, and as soon as it returns, the system resets itself and starts working again normally.

Is there any device that work with a battery?
All our accessories work connected directly to the net, except a small range of items, such as the assistance bracelet, which for obvious reasons need to use small batteries.

FAQ's
1. General questions

Is it very difficult to install domomob home automation system?No. domomob is very easy and doesn’t require any technical knowledge.
What accessories do I need?The only indispensable product is the miniserver, the brain of the entire system.
How many accessories do I need?As many as your desired system requires.
Can I add accessories later?Yes. To add new devices to your system, you only have to copy the security code in your online profile of domomob.
How can I buy additional accessories?You can buy accessories during the indiegogo campaign, or later in the online shop www.domomob.com. Our sponsors will have the same price as the indiegogo campaign.
Can I buy two miniservers, one for the house and one for the office?Yes. You can buy one miniserver for each location, house, second residence, office, etc. and control everything from the same user.
I want to be up to date of your innovations. How can I participate?Being sponsor with a 5€ contribution, we will inform you by email of all the news and innovations about domomob.

2. Questions concerning the purchase

Will I receive an order confirmation?Once the indiegogo campaign is finished, you will receive a confirmation email with the requested order.
I have not received my confirmation email, should I worry?If you don’t receive the email within 96 hours since the campaign finished (be sure the email has not been considered as spam), you should send us an email to db@domomob.com, so that we can review the incidence.
How can I enlarge devices to my indiegogo kit?After the campaign you will receive an email with the description of your indiegogo kit and a link if you want to expand the devices.
When will I receive my reward?Our sponsors’ rewards will be sent from December 2015 onwards.
Do the products have warranty?Yes, they have. The warranty covers any production defect during 1 year. Any problem that might ocurr will be solved as soon as possible, just contact us at db@domomob.com.

3. Privacy and security

Can I switch the camera off?The indoor camera has a button which, when pressed, sends a message to the mobile which domomob is connected to, alerting that the indoor camera has been disconnected.The camera has also a remote device which allows to disconnect the camera through a special user code.

4. Technical issues

Does domomob use other producer devices?No, it does not. domomob only usesour own products which have been previously tested and proved by our experts to avoid having any security and reliability problems.
Do the apps have any cost?All apps are entirely free.
What happens if internet goes off?If the internet or the mini server stopped working, domomob devices would still work.
What happens if electricity goes off?If the electricity goes off all the systems stops working, and as soon as it returns, the system resets itself and starts working again normally.
Is there any device that work with a battery?All our accessories work connected directly to the net, except a small range of items, such as the assistance bracelet, which for obvious reasons need to use small batteries.

story:
Experience Asia in 2 exciting days in Secaucus, NJ

Fiesta in America, hopes to bring together all Asian consumers and businesses in what has never been attempted before--the largest gathering of Asians in northeast USA. It will showcase the best of Asian products, services, culture and entertainment in the tri-state area.

Now on its 17th year, Fiesta in America (previously Philippine Fiesta Inc. now  a 501 (c) (3) not-for-profit company), has been successful in holding Filipino events for mainstream America. This year, we've invited other Asians to join us.  Since we're starting it this year, we really need your support. If you're in business, the right amount can get you a booth. If you're an attendee, you can simply buy tickets for you, your friends and your family.  

Everyone is welcome to  enjoy this exciting, one-of-a-kind two-day event in August 15 & 16, 2015 at the Meadowlands Exposition Center in Secaucus, New Jersey, a 20-minute drive from Port Authority in New York. 

What to Expect:

  • Enjoy diverse entertainment programming, various Asian cuisine and amazing travel deals to Asia
  • Connect with Asian and mainstream busineses at their booths
  • Talk to our exhibitors consisting of both small-medium sized businesses and FORTUNE 500 companies
  • Attend seminars geared toward capturing mainstream America and Asian American market, now with a buying power of $769B

Why We Are Doing This

  • We at Fiesta in America have been doing events for the Filipino market for the past 17 years, but with Asians now the fastest-growing racial group in America, we thought it was time to come together as a group, a group with the highest household income in the US
  • We're only asking for funding now, because we're doing more than just a Filipino event, we're doing a large Asian event that presents many challenges. Each segment has a distinct culture and different languages that require a different set of logistics and needs.  
  • We look forward to offering more services that will benefit the Asian American community, either for marketing or goodwill purposes, especially with the Asean integration in Asia this year.  
  • We are also looking to expand the businesses of companies targeting mainly mainstream America. The event should give us more insights into how best to create in-language messaging  aimed at the fastest-growing racial group.

The Impact of an Asian and ASEAN Expo

The Asian American market is a huge market, but not many companies know how to target them. This event will help you understand this largely ignored market.

  • The Asian American market is considered the highest-income, best-educated and fastest-growing racial group in the US with a buying power of $760B; median household income is 32% higher than US households at $55,000
  • Asian Americans spend 33 percent of their dollars on deals, compared to 27 percent of non-Asians. About 78 percent of Asian American say they like to shop around before making a purchase, and two-thirds say they are willing to pay more for quality
  • 86 percent of Asian American households have some sort of savings account, compared to 76 percent of the general US population. In addition, nearly one-third of Asian Americans surveyed keep money in certificate of deposits, a rate 86 percent higher compared to 17 percent of the general US population.
  • The integration of the Association of Southeast Asian Nations (ASEAN) in 2015 is expected to create a single market where goods, capital and skilled labor will be allowed to move freely across borders within 11 ASEAN countries: Brunei Darussalam, Cambodia, Indonesia, Lao PDR, Malaysia, Myanmar, the Philippines, Singapore, Thailand, Viet Nam and Timor-Leste
  • Many FORTUNE 500 companies in automobile, banking, cable, hospitality, insurance, money transfer and telecommunications have created and benefited from its a strong presence among Indians, Fiilipinos, Chinese and Koreans in the US.

The Challenges & Opportunities For Us

  • We are asking for funds to get this rolling, because we aim to produce extensive studies, insights and reports on how best to capture the Asian American market. 
  • These studies will help us present business and job opportunities all across the Asian segments relative also to the needs of mainstream America. It will also help many companies address the Asian American market properly.
  • Holding a multicultural event of this magnitude is not easy. We are raising the amount stated above, partly also because of the logistical challenge for us with the different ethnicities, different cultures and different generations of Asian Americans that we will have to manage before, during and after the event. 

Other Ways You Can Help

Let us know how you want to help make this a successful event.

  • Share this event with your friends and family and non-Asian friends.
  • Donate or volunteer to work with us. 
  • If you're based in the States, your donation is tax-deductible
  • Visit us at fiestainamerica.com or email info@fiestainamerica.com to learn more. We will create a new site for Asians with your donation.

story:
Magnetic Sail
By – Dark Sea Industries and the University of New Mexico

Illustration 1: Magnetic Sail

Join the first crowd sourced mission to see if we can reach space without using a traditional rocket - and use it to travel to Mars.

UPDATE!-- KOAT-TV Action News coverage! (http://www.koat.com/news/earth-to-mars-in-less-...)

UPDATE! -- Daily Lobo covers our related research! (http://www.dailylobo.com/article/2015/10/28-unm...)

UPDATE! -- Space Daily covers our project! (http://www.spacedaily.com/reports/Magnetic_Sail...)

 

In 1610, the astronomer Johannes Kepler wrote, in a letter to Galileo:


“Let us create vessels and sails adjusted to the heavenly ether, and there will be plenty of people unafraid of the empty wastes. In the meantime, we shall prepare, for the brave sky-travellers, maps of the celestial bodies...”


The colonization of Mars means getting there in less than six months. Day trips are possible with a magnetic sail. But before you can go to Mars you have to get out of the gravity well.

Going to Mars will require an impossible balancing act between minimizing the weight and figuring out how to use the least amount of fuel possible, using traditional rockets. Mars Direct proposes a system using engines similar to the Blue Origins BE-4, harvesting the fuel from the Martian environment. It could cost as much as 450 Billion dollars, given that it requires low-thrust heavy lift capability in addition to unique spacecraft designs, plus habitats. Some believe that is a low cost for access to a new world. But the reality is that it takes more time and more expense than is required to accomplish the mission. It is said that Generals always try to re-fight the last war, and aerospace engineers always try to rebuild the last successful spacecraft. The only manned spacecraft to ever reach another world was the Apollo program, incredibly successful in repeatedly reaching the Moon with no loss of life in orbit. But the success of the mission has brought a half century of trying to reinvent "Apollo to Mars", such as using the Shuttle's forty year old RS-25 engines for the "new" Orion rocket, instead of truly adopting the "living off the land" principle behind Mars Direct. Everyone is so focused on low thrust heavy lift being the only way to get there, that they ignore the way things go to Mars every day.

The Big Idea: Magnetic Sails
We asked ourselves a simple question, could we come up with another way to get to space without using a traditional rocket? We came up with yes, we just haven’t tried it yet. The big question was how. The answer is by using the electro-magnetic fields already in the space around the Heliosphere (the Sun) or the Magnetosphere (the Earth) to power the sails, just like an electric motor.


Illustration 2: The wind sail conquered the oceans, a magnetic sail conquers the skies

We will use superconducting coils to be the magnets of the motor, since they are in a steady state and don't require additional power. In experiments magnets accelerate in electromagnetic fields and that force creates the motion to propel the spacecraft. The initial energy to power the coil is only needed once to set up the magnet. In technical terms, the ionized plasma provides a JxB reaction to the magnetic field provided by the superconducting coils, causing its electromagnetic energy to be spent by traversing the field. All the rest of the energy is provided by the exterior fields that are constantly in motion like weather patterns we can follow right now.

...and a magnet in an electric field experiences that same force

Illustration 3: Electrical Field encountering a Magnetic Field produces a force

Illustration 4: Our Magnetic Sail is a Coil

The problem for ground based magnetic propulsion is that the field strength, unless there is a thunderstorm, can be measured in micro-amps, and provides no effective propulsion. At altitudes above 100,000 feet, there is a current in the atmosphere called the Birkeland Current, which has values up to 100,000 amps, and routinely peaks above a million amps (near noon and midnight). The current doesn't reach its full value until it reaches the bottom layer of the Ionosphere, which varies between night and day. At night the E layer and F layer are present, starting at about 290,000 feet. During the day, a D layer forms at as low an altitude as 180,000 feet, and the E and F layers become much stronger. Often during the day the F layer, which starts at about 475,00 feet, will differentiate into F1 and F2 layers.

Illustration 5: Ionosphere Layers

The Birkeland current is a ribbon about 285 miles wide by 1500 miles long, stretching from a circle around the magnetic pole (north or south), centered on the noon and midnight axis, one ribbon on each side of the globe. The ring is where we see the Aurora Borealis or Aurora Australis.

Illustration 6: Magnetic Poles and the Birkeland Current Sheet

Unfortunately, this leaves us like the people in the alley who want to use the fire escape to get back into the building, it is too far above our heads to grab easily. Just like the fire escape, Birkeland Current Sheets go both upward and downward on each side of the building (dayside or nightside), but the nightside fire escape is another floor higher out of reach.

Illustration 7: Aurora Australis from the International Space Station

One low cost craft that routinely journeys to the 25 mile altitudes and as high as 35 miles altitude is a weather balloon. So our first prototype is based around a balloon, but somewhat smaller – a chimney balloon.

Illustration 8: Prototype 1, balloon with coil wrapped around it

Our prototype uses aerogel tape to insulate the superconductive wire that forms the coil. To be able to reach the 35 mile altitude, the balloon may have to be filled with hydrogen. The tubes could also be filled with liquid helium, the idea being to leave the expensive (and heavy) cryocooler on the ground, with enough coolant and insulation to complete the mission. Cubesat compatible avionics, combined with a DeLorme inReach SE or equivalent, will provide continuous GPS position updates. Note that while the cubesat shown is 1U (small), there is no reason (other that weight) that it couldn't be 6U (3x2 i.e. large).

Illustration 9: Prototype 1, balloon with coil wrapped around it End View

Such a small balloon has no hope of completing the mission by itself. Like many times in life, just as we are asking the Indiegogo community for help, we need an assist with the heavy lifting. We propose using a standard weather balloon, forty feet in diameter, to get us to the bottom of the ionosphere.

Illustration 10: 40' weather balloon

This prototype assumes the coil will be able to “steer” the balloon by following the magnetic field lines, which will drive it towards the maximum field intensity – the center of the Birkeland Current Sheet. The launch will see the balloon pair rise at 2,000 to 5,000 feet per minute reaching 100,000 feet in 40 to 50 minutes after launch. Shortly thereafter, the large balloon will reach “crush depth” (or "burst altitude") and explode. If the coil does not have sufficient current it will fall back to the ground. If the balloon is not “steered” sufficiently to reach the sheet, it will also fall back to the ground. If the balloon doesn't have enough altitude to encounter the current, even though it is in the right spot, it will drift until reaching crush depth or loss of gas. We can compensate for this by picking the right day when we know the current will be at its maximum of a million amps, so even if we get 1000 times less, it is still a thousand amps. Our coil can produce substantial thrust even with a hundred amps.

Illustration 11: Prototype 1 flight configuration

The second prototype corrects some of the deficiencies of the first prototype. It changes the model from a balloon to a spacecraft. This gives us the ability to change the shape of the magnetic fields in three dimensions, for greater stability. Standard aircraft control surfaces give us greater ability to “steer” the balloon.
Our choice for the plane is the F-104G StarFighter, aptly named for our purposes. There is a possibility that if the test goes well, the craft will follow the current sheet out into the Magnetotail, and then off into the heliosphere, and then eventually out of the solar system.

Illustration 12: Magnetic Sail Prototype plane

There is one other advantage the F-104G scale model gives us. In place of the jet engine, we can provide a rocket engine, to get us the additional altitude to solidly place the coil inside the current. Other methods of reaching these locations at these altitudes are solely within the control of the military and government. Launching a sounding rocket, which can reach anywhere in the ionosphere, costs between 3.5M$ and 4.5M$, if NASA will let you do so. The weather balloon and rocket engine powered model airplane should be able to do almost as well for our purposes at a fraction of the price. A second advantage of this method is that moving the coil through the current increases the acceleration that the coil provides, providing another boost to the thrust generated.

Illustration 13: Lockheed F-104G "StarFighter"

Illustration 14: Prototype 2 flight configuration

The Cubesat electronics will be located inside the body of the model aircraft, with the antenna following behind the plane. The DeLorme (inReach SE or equivalent) provides satellite communications, location, and altitude information throughout the mission. It sends and receives 160 character free-form text messages with GPS coordinates to emails or cell numbers anywhere in the world. It provides 100% global coverage through the Iridium satellite network, important in the remote arctic areas where these missions will take place. It provides delivery confirmation for all text messages and SOS signals. The embedded controller can take the commands received through the DeLorme and manipulate the servos of the aircraft. Two servos are especially important, the one that cuts the tie to the weather balloon, and the one that lights the solid rocket motor. The rocket motor will be launched at 45°, to escape the collapsing skin of the weather balloon, then pulled into a 90° vertical to get as much altitude as possible. Once the coil is powered by the current, the acceleration it provides will far exceed the contribution of the rocket.

Funding— Why Indiegogo and where does the money go?
Traditional research funding is a difficult field with only a small pool to share among a large group of interested individuals all trying to get the same grant money for their projects. We wanted to try to start with Indiegogo to go for the idea of people explorers, bringing the wonder back into space exploration. This helps all projects with ideas of space being right up front, something tangible for the in the moment. This project will help our time table come down from sometime in the next few years to sometime in the next year. We would like to have our first test project launch in 2016 where our backers can follow it through the website and track its GPS live, or if they have sufficient resources, join us and experience it firsthand.

Even with some angel funding or venture funding and our own funds, it would take us years to realize this dream without your help. We want to get this technology ready and available for people before the decade is through instead of still mucking through the red tape of funding for the next five years. With help, we can get the first launch done since the first balloon is ready to be built, and we can get it into orbit to see if our theory is sound. We want to test all the components and theory in a real life trial where everyone wants see it: live, in real life, in real time. If we reach our stretch goals we can continue testing, and see how far we can go. Perhaps even as far as Mars.

The project funding request is for 200,000$US. Almost 75,000$US of that goes to Indiegogo perks, leaving a basic funding level of 125,000$US. About 40,500$US of that goes for constructing the prototypes, buying the balloons, model aircraft, radios, servos, GPS, embedded controller, superconducting wire, aerogel insulation, custom solid rocket motor construction, and gas to fill the balloons. 27,000$US of the funding request goes for data logging and prototype construction labor. 40,000$US of the funding request goes for consulting from the University of New Mexico, to calculate coil effects, calculate weather effects, plus exploit the brightest, least expensive resource in the Universe – graduate students. The remaining 1,750$US is held as a contingency for unforeseen expenses.

Illustration 15: Proposed Use of Requested Funds


The first mission is to launch two prototypes from Sydney, Australia (or Hobart, Tasmania) towards Antarctica and the South Magnetic Pole. A three person crew will perform the mission, one technical representative from the University of New Mexico, and two assistants from Dark Sea Industries.

The mission crew may be joined by backers who have contributed to the effort, at their own expense. Additional backers who have contributed to the effort can join the UNM and Dark Sea Industries team at mission control in Albuquerque, New Mexico, USA.

Illustration 16: First Mission Launches two prototypes

The mission crew will have to assemble the shipped components, verify the electronics are working properly, make sure all government requirements are fulfilled, assemble the prototypes, fill the balloons with gas, launch the prototypes and monitor their progress. While the distance of 2328 miles would take many days for a normal weather balloon, the coil will provide an acceleration of up to 15,000mph (to reach orbit) and a lower acceleration of a few hundred mph after it reaches the lower border of the ionosphere. Fortunately, the Birkeland current extends 1500 miles from the pole, and the Hobart site is practically right under the edge of it. If either prototype does reach orbit, it will almost certainly exceed escape velocity as it exits the magnetotail.

Illustration 17: Map of first mission


Illustration 18: First Mission Profile

The second mission is designed to be chosen between two alternatives, another mission to the South Magnetic Pole, using Rio De Janeiro, Brazil or Buenos Aires, Argentina; or a mission to the North Magnetic Pole, from Seattle.

Rio de Janeiro is very far from the South Magnetic Pole. It is not as far from the Aurora Australis arc (roughly half the distance). It would be very useful to know if any boundary on the auroral arcs works just as well for the purposes of going to space, as indicated by the Birkeland Current Maps derived by AMPERE and the Iridium satellite network. The auroral arc roughly follows the outline of Antartica.

Illustration 19: Second Mission Southern Option

The location of Buenos Aires is several thousand miles closer to the auroral arc, making it almost as good as Sydney as a launch site. It has the disadvantage of being even further from the South Magnetic Pole itself. It also is much less convenient for people in Albuquerque than Seattle is, a disadvantage the other two sites share.

Illustration 20: Second mission Rio de Janeiro Map

Seattle is about 400 miles further away from the North Magnetic Pole than Sydney is from the South Magnetic Pole. The possibility of Fairbanks, Alaska, which is 700 miles closer than Seattle to the North Magnetic Pole is saved for a Stretch Goal contingency. The Fairbanks Mission 2B would use a small general aviation aircraft to tow the prototype 2 with weather balloon several hundred miles closer, to the edge of the Birkeland Current Sheet, releasing it at 10,000+ feet. This reduces the error margin for access to the current. Combined with the solid rocket motor in the F-104G model aircraft, we should be able to know exactly where in the current sheet the prototype will be placed.

Illustration 21: Second Mission Northern Option

Illustration 22: Second mission Seattle Map


Stretch Goal Ideas
If contributions reach 350,000$US or more -
We will complete all the listed missions, Sydney, Rio de Janeiro, Buenos Aires, Seattle, Fairbanks.

If contributions reach 800,000$US or more -
We will complete all the listed missions, Sydney, Rio de Janeiro, Buenos Aires, Seattle, Fairbanks. We will also use the technology to create a spacecraft to use the next Earth-Mars opposition (July 2018) to send a craft to orbit Mars in less than a week after leaving Earth.

If contributions reach 1,500,000$US or more -
We will complete all the listed missions, Sydney, Rio de Janeiro, Buenos Aires, Seattle, Fairbanks. We will also use the technology to create a spacecraft to use the next Earth-Mars opposition (July 2018) to send a craft to orbit Mars in less than a week after leaving Earth. We will also complete the design for a spacecraft that can launch on its own from the surface of the Earth, launch to Mars, land on Mars, launch from the surface of Mars, and return to Earth, all in less than two weeks at any time of the year. We call this robotic utility craft Hannapral-R.

Such spacecraft do not travel on the straight lines we see during opposition missions but instead travel on parabolic courses, towards the Sun, then away from the Sun.

Illustration 23: Hannapral robotic utility craft with SharkFin embedded in skin

If contributions reach 2.5 Million $US or more -
We will complete all the listed missions, Sydney, Rio de Janeiro, Buenos Aires, Seattle, Fairbanks. We will also use the technology to create a spacecraft to use the next Earth-Mars opposition (July 2018) to send a craft to orbit Mars in less than a week after leaving Earth. We will also complete the construction of a spacecraft that can launch on its own from the surface of the Earth, launch to Mars, land on Mars, launch from the surface of Mars, and return to Earth, all in less than two weeks at any time of the year. We call this robotic utility craft Hannapral-R.

Risks and Challenges
Like any project or research, there are issues that can result from technical difficulties that we cannot foresee resulting in launch delays. These are some of the known risks that may lie ahead. We are prepared to tackle all of the foreseen and unknown challenges ahead of use and our backers hopefully will understand that we could be delayed for reasons outside of our control and that we will do everything in our power to move forward to get our project off the ground and into space. We will keep everyone updated regularly regarding our progress towards the launch and future endeavors.

Illustration 24: Parabolic heliosphere course from Earth to Mars

Links

http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Heliosphere
http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sun#Magnetic_field
http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Magnetosphere_of_Jupiter
http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ionosphere

http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Birkeland_current
http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Weather_balloon
http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/High-altitude_balloon
http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lorentz_force
http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Electromotive_force
http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Magnetoplasmadynamic_thruster
http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sounding_rocket
