But the success of the mission has brought a half century of trying to reinvent "Apollo to Mars", such as using the Shuttle's forty year old RS-25 engines for the "new" Orion rocket, instead of truly adopting the "living off the land" principle behind Mars Direct. Everyone is so focused on low thrust heavy lift being the only way to get there, that they ignore the way things go to Mars every day.The Big Idea: Magnetic SailsWe asked ourselves a simple question, could we come up with another way to get to space without using a traditional rocket? We came up with yes, we just haven’t tried it yet. The big question was how. The answer is by using the electro-magnetic fields already in the space around the Heliosphere (the Sun) or the Magnetosphere (the Earth) to power the sails, just like an electric motor. Illustration 2: The wind sail conquered the oceans, a magnetic sail conquers the skiesWe will use superconducting coils to be the magnets of the motor, since they are in a steady state and don't require additional power. In experiments magnets accelerate in electromagnetic fields and that force creates the motion to propel the spacecraft. The initial energy to power the coil is only needed once to set up the magnet. In technical terms, the ionized plasma provides a JxB reaction to the magnetic field provided by the superconducting coils, causing its electromagnetic energy to be spent by traversing the field. All the rest of the energy is provided by the exterior fields that are constantly in motion like weather patterns we can follow right now....and a magnet in an electric field experiences that same forceIllustration 3: Electrical Field encountering a Magnetic Field produces a forceIllustration 4: Our Magnetic Sail is a CoilThe problem for ground based magnetic propulsion is that the field 
strength, unless there is a thunderstorm, can be measured in micro-amps,
 and provides no effective propulsion. At altitudes above 100,000 feet, 
there is a current in the atmosphere called the Birkeland Current, which
 has values up to 100,000 amps, and routinely peaks above a million amps
 (near noon and midnight). The current doesn't reach its full value 
until it reaches the bottom layer of the Ionosphere, which varies 
between night and day. At night the E layer and F layer are present, 
starting at about 290,000 feet. During the day, a D layer forms at as 
low an altitude as 180,000 feet, and the E and F layers become much 
stronger. Often during the day the F layer, which starts at about 475,00
 feet, will differentiate into F1 and F2 layers.Illustration 5: Ionosphere Layers The 
Birkeland current is a ribbon about 285 miles wide by 1500 miles long, 
stretching from a circle around the magnetic pole (north or south), 
centered on the noon and midnight axis, one ribbon on each side of the 
globe. The ring is where we see the Aurora Borealis or Aurora Australis.Illustration 6: Magnetic Poles and the Birkeland Current SheetUnfortunately, this leaves us like the people in the alley who want to use the fire escape to get back into the building, it is too far above our heads to grab easily. Just like the fire escape, Birkeland Current Sheets go both upward and downward on each side of the building (dayside or nightside), but the nightside fire escape is another floor higher out of reach.Illustration 7: Aurora Australis from the International Space StationOne low cost craft that routinely journeys to the 25 mile altitudes and as high as 35 miles altitude is a weather balloon. So our first prototype is based around a balloon, but somewhat smaller – a chimney balloon.Illustration 8: Prototype 1, balloon with coil wrapped around itOur prototype uses aerogel tape to insulate the superconductive wire that forms the coil. To be able to reach the 35 mile altitude, the balloon may have to be filled with hydrogen. The tubes could also be filled with liquid helium, the idea being to leave the expensive (and heavy) cryocooler on the ground, with enough coolant and insulation to complete the mission. Cubesat compatible avionics, combined with a DeLorme inReach SE or equivalent, will provide continuous GPS position updates. Note that while the cubesat shown is 1U (small), there is no reason (other that weight) that it couldn't be 6U (3x2 i.e. large).Illustration 9: Prototype 1, balloon with coil wrapped around it End ViewSuch a small balloon has no hope of completing the mission by itself. Like many times in life, just as we are asking the Indiegogo community for help, we need an assist with the heavy lifting. We propose using a standard weather balloon, forty feet in diameter, to get us to the bottom of the ionosphere.Illustration 10: 40' weather balloonThis prototype assumes the coil will be able to “steer” the balloon by following the magnetic field lines, which will drive it towards the maximum field intensity – the center of the Birkeland Current Sheet. The launch will see the balloon pair rise at 2,000 to 5,000 feet per minute reaching 100,000 feet in 40 to 50 minutes after launch. Shortly thereafter, the large balloon will reach “crush depth” (or "burst altitude") and explode. If the coil does not have sufficient current it will fall back to the ground. If the balloon is not “steered” sufficiently to reach the sheet, it will also fall back to the ground. If the balloon doesn't have enough altitude to encounter the current, even though it is in the right spot, it will drift until reaching crush depth or loss of gas. We can compensate for this by picking the right day when we know the current will be at its maximum of a million amps, so even if we get 1000 times less, it is still a thousand amps. Our coil can produce substantial thrust even with a hundred amps.Illustration 11: Prototype 1 flight configurationThe second prototype corrects some of the deficiencies of the first prototype. It changes the model from a balloon to a spacecraft. This gives us the ability to change the shape of the magnetic fields in three dimensions, for greater stability. Standard aircraft control surfaces give us greater ability to “steer” the balloon.Our choice for the plane is the F-104G StarFighter, aptly named for our purposes. There is a possibility that if the test goes well, the craft will follow the current sheet out into the Magnetotail, and then off into the heliosphere, and then eventually out of the solar system.Illustration 12: Magnetic Sail Prototype planeThere is one other advantage the F-104G scale model gives us. In place of the jet engine, we can provide a rocket engine, to get us the additional altitude to solidly place the coil inside the current. Other methods of reaching these locations at these altitudes are solely within the control of the military and government. Launching a sounding rocket, which can reach anywhere in the ionosphere, costs between 3.5M$ and 4.5M$, if NASA will let you do so. The weather balloon and rocket engine powered model airplane should be able to do almost as well for our purposes at a fraction of the price. A second advantage of this method is that moving the coil through the current increases the acceleration that the coil provides, providing another boost to the thrust generated.Illustration 13: Lockheed F-104G "StarFighter"Illustration 14: Prototype 2 flight configurationThe Cubesat electronics will be located inside the body of the model aircraft, with the antenna following behind the plane. The DeLorme (inReach SE or equivalent) provides satellite communications, location, and altitude information throughout the mission. It sends and receives 160 character free-form text messages with GPS coordinates to emails or cell numbers anywhere in the world. It provides 100% global coverage through the Iridium satellite network, important in the remote arctic areas where these missions will take place. It provides delivery confirmation for all text messages and SOS signals. The embedded controller can take the commands received through the DeLorme and manipulate the servos of the aircraft. Two servos are especially important, the one that cuts the tie to the weather balloon, and the one that lights the solid rocket motor. The rocket motor will be launched at 45°, to escape the collapsing skin of the weather balloon, then pulled into a 90° vertical to get as much altitude as possible. Once the coil is powered by the current, the acceleration it provides will far exceed the contribution of the rocket.Funding— Why Indiegogo and where does the money go?Traditional research funding is a difficult field with only a small pool to share among a large group of interested individuals all trying to get the same grant money for their projects. We wanted to try to start with Indiegogo to go for the idea of people explorers, bringing the wonder back into space exploration. This helps all projects with ideas of space being right up front, something tangible for the in the moment. This project will help our time table come down from sometime in the next few years to sometime in the next year. We would like to have our first test project launch in 2016 where our backers can follow it through the website and track its GPS live, or if they have sufficient resources, join us and experience it firsthand.Even with some angel funding or venture funding and our own funds, it would take us years to realize this dream without your help. We want to get this technology ready and available for people before the decade is through instead of still mucking through the red tape of funding for the next five years. With help, we can get the first launch done since the first balloon is ready to be built, and we can get it into orbit to see if our theory is sound. We want to test all the components and theory in a real life trial where everyone wants see it: live, in real life, in real time. If we reach our stretch goals we can continue testing, and see how far we can go. Perhaps even as far as Mars.The project funding request is for 200,000$US. Almost 75,000$US of that goes to Indiegogo perks, leaving a basic funding level of 125,000$US. About 40,500$US of that goes for constructing the prototypes, buying the balloons, model aircraft, radios, servos, GPS, embedded controller, superconducting wire, aerogel insulation, custom solid rocket motor construction, and gas to fill the balloons. 27,000$US of the funding request goes for data logging and prototype construction labor. 40,000$US of the funding request goes for consulting from the University of New Mexico, to calculate coil effects, calculate weather effects, plus exploit the brightest, least expensive resource in the Universe – graduate students. The remaining 1,750$US is held as a contingency for unforeseen expenses.Illustration 15: Proposed Use of Requested FundsThe first mission is to launch two prototypes from Sydney, Australia (or Hobart, Tasmania) towards Antarctica and the South Magnetic Pole. A three person crew will perform the mission, one technical representative from the University of New Mexico, and two assistants from Dark Sea Industries.The mission crew may be joined by backers who have contributed to the effort, at their own expense. Additional backers who have contributed to the effort can join the UNM and Dark Sea Industries team at mission control in Albuquerque, New Mexico, USA.Illustration 16: First Mission Launches two prototypesThe mission crew will have to assemble the shipped components, verify the electronics are working properly, make sure all government requirements are fulfilled, assemble the prototypes, fill the balloons with gas, launch the prototypes and monitor their progress. While the distance of 2328 miles would take many days for a normal weather balloon, the coil will provide an acceleration of up to 15,000mph (to reach orbit) and a lower acceleration of a few hundred mph after it reaches the lower border of the ionosphere. Fortunately, the Birkeland current extends 1500 miles from the pole, and the Hobart site is practically right under the edge of it. If either prototype does reach orbit, it will almost certainly exceed escape velocity as it exits the magnetotail.Illustration 17: Map of first missionIllustration 18: First Mission ProfileThe second mission is designed to be chosen between two alternatives, 
another mission to the South Magnetic Pole, using Rio De Janeiro, Brazil
 or Buenos Aires, Argentina; or a mission to the North Magnetic Pole, 
from Seattle.Rio de Janeiro is very far from the South Magnetic Pole. It is not as far from the Aurora Australis arc (roughly half the distance). It would be very useful to know if any boundary on the auroral arcs works just as well for the purposes of going to space, as indicated by the Birkeland Current Maps derived by AMPERE and the Iridium satellite network. The auroral arc roughly follows the outline of Antartica.Illustration 19: Second Mission Southern OptionThe location of Buenos Aires is several thousand miles closer to the auroral arc, making it almost as good as Sydney as a launch site. It has the disadvantage of being even further from the South Magnetic Pole itself. It also is much less convenient for people in Albuquerque than Seattle is, a disadvantage the other two sites share.Illustration 20: Second mission Rio de Janeiro MapSeattle is about 400 miles further away from the North Magnetic Pole than Sydney is from the South Magnetic Pole. The possibility of Fairbanks, Alaska, which is 700 miles closer than Seattle to the North Magnetic Pole is saved for a Stretch Goal contingency. The Fairbanks Mission 2B would use a small general aviation aircraft to tow the prototype 2 with weather balloon several hundred miles closer, to the edge of the Birkeland Current Sheet, releasing it at 10,000+ feet. This reduces the error margin for access to the current. Combined with the solid rocket motor in the F-104G model aircraft, we should be able to know exactly where in the current sheet the prototype will be placed.Illustration 21: Second Mission Northern OptionIllustration 22: Second mission Seattle MapStretch Goal IdeasIf contributions reach 350,000$US or more -We will complete all the listed missions, Sydney, Rio de Janeiro, Buenos Aires, Seattle, Fairbanks.If contributions reach 800,000$US or more -We will complete all the listed missions, Sydney, Rio de Janeiro, Buenos Aires, Seattle, Fairbanks. We will also use the technology to create a spacecraft to use the next Earth-Mars opposition (July 2018) to send a craft to orbit Mars in less than a week after leaving Earth.If contributions reach 1,500,000$US or more -We will complete all the listed missions, Sydney, Rio de Janeiro, Buenos Aires, Seattle, Fairbanks. We will also use the technology to create a spacecraft to use the next Earth-Mars opposition (July 2018) to send a craft to orbit Mars in less than a week after leaving Earth. We will also complete the design for a spacecraft that can launch on its own from the surface of the Earth, launch to Mars, land on Mars, launch from the surface of Mars, and return to Earth, all in less than two weeks at any time of the year. We call this robotic utility craft Hannapral-R.Such spacecraft do not travel on the straight lines we see during opposition missions but instead travel on parabolic courses, towards the Sun, then away from the Sun.Illustration 23: Hannapral robotic utility craft with SharkFin embedded in skinIf contributions reach 2.5 Million $US or more -We will complete all the listed missions, Sydney, Rio de Janeiro, Buenos Aires, Seattle, Fairbanks. We will also use the technology to create a spacecraft to use the next Earth-Mars opposition (July 2018) to send a craft to orbit Mars in less than a week after leaving Earth. We will also complete the construction of a spacecraft that can launch on its own from the surface of the Earth, launch to Mars, land on Mars, launch from the surface of Mars, and return to Earth, all in less than two weeks at any time of the year. We call this robotic utility craft Hannapral-R.Risks and ChallengesLike any project or research, there are issues that can result from technical difficulties that we cannot foresee resulting in launch delays. These are some of the known risks that may lie ahead. We are prepared to tackle all of the foreseen and unknown challenges ahead of use and our backers hopefully will understand that we could be delayed for reasons outside of our control and that we will do everything in our power to move forward to get our project off the ground and into space. We will keep everyone updated regularly regarding our progress towards the launch and future endeavors.Illustration 24: Parabolic heliosphere course from Earth to MarsLinkshttp://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Interplanetary_magnetic_fieldhttp://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Heliospherehttp://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sun#Magnetic_fieldhttp://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Magnetosphere_of_Jupiterhttp://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ionospherehttp://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Magnetospherehttp://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Birkeland_currenthttp://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Weather_balloonhttp://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/High-altitude_balloonhttp://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lorentz_forcehttp://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Electromotive_forcehttp://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Magnetoplasmadynamic_thrusterhttp://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sounding_rocketSWAGProject StickerProject PatchMission Patches (dependent upon funding)Project Plaque

story:
Short Summary

Who we are

We are two expats living in Prague, holding regular jobs and trying to maintain a rich creative side. We are actively involved in cultural activities, such as photography, dance, music, yoga and other sports. We enjoy sharing our experiences and we have organized a number of workshops, international cultural meetings and XIX century styled balls in several countries. Thus, we completely understand both the needs of the creative communities in our city for a suitable space for self-expression, and the optimal ways to fulfill those needs.

What the project is about

Do you ever wish you could express yourself, connect and create like you probably did before? You are full of energy and ideas.. But WHERE can YOU do it? Most available spaces are either too specialized, or too expensive, or have complex scheduling or/and conditions and rent policies, take too long to find, often require external help.

That's exactly what we plan to create:

  1. One welcoming art space, big, flexible and available for creative and social activities, short-term or long-term, for the younger and the elder, educational and entertaining. For example: exhibitions, concerts, dance events, thematic workshops.
  2. A space where anyone can participate in ongoing activities, in choosing the program, suggesting or conducting projects.
  3. A space to discover and support unknown/new talents and artists.
  4. The space that is cozy and pleasant for meeting friends and colleagues over a cup of good tea or coffee.
  5. The one you can enjoy until late night – unlike others that close early.
  6. To make the space affordable for all, we will run as a a time-café, where everyone will only pay for the time spent in the space!

What We Need & What You Get

What we have done and what we need for success

We found an ideal venue – it is just the right size, in a lively location right next to major public transport lines, in a spot near a business center and a theater, with a lot of pedestrian traffic that will increase once a nearby shopping center and new residencies are completed.

  1. To secure the space, we need to pay a three-month rent deposit + first month's rent. That's 300 000 CZK in total.
  2. We also need to buy furniture, equipment, including the essentials like, for example,  fast internet connection, a credit card terminal or good coffee machines(!) speakers, lights, severeal musical instruments (piano, guitar, percussion), projector. Aiming for quality that will last adds up to a 350 000 CZK price tag.
  3. Finally, we need to make sure our staff gets paid timely and our guests are happy. This means having a secure wages reserve. This also means buying enough high-quality tea, coffee and snacks. To ensure that for the first three months before the space gains enough clients and begins to self-sustain, we need 450 000CZK.

In total, it's 1 100 000CZK or approximately 50 000 USD/EUR.

What's in it for YOU

We invite you to our art-space cafe where you can receive free art production items (postcards, photographs, posters etc.), and conduct your own art/ social/ educational webinars and events! With a little donation, YOU can help make this amazing project reality! When your contribution, you will support dreams, communities and creativity. Who knows, maybe your donation will help the next great artist or activist make an impact on the world!

Besides a great feeling, what else can you get by supporting this project? You can become a part of our art-space cafe. Receive free passes to all our events or our art production (postcards, photographs, posters and so on). You can also conduct your art/ social/ educational webinars online or visit Prague and do it onsight! Maybe you are an unknown artist? We can introduce your name to both Czech and international public. You decide what works best for you - we make it happen!

What if we wouldn't reach the goal

In case we wouldn't get the full amount we will start it step by step with smaller capacity, e.g. without spending money on instruments, having less opening hours and therefore less people in the team, smaller space for the beginning and other possible solutions. We're supposing to fulfill all our perks during at least 3 months in any case. 

Risks & Challenges

As everybody we have some main risks to manage with:

Development Risk

Problem: 
Lack of customers/ non-returning customers 
Solution: 
  • Advertisement, promotion activities;
  • Cooperation with related institutions such as art schools/ studios/ clubs/ other related social spacesand institutions
  • Conducting social services at the start to collect customer feedback andtotimely apply needed measures

Facility & Location

Problem: 
  • Finding a licensable building, easily accessible by public transportation, with appropriate area and space planning, and the corresponding use permissions. 
  • Probability of delays in processing and higher fees than expected. 
 Solution: 
  • Carry out preliminay research, including professional consultations upon current situation and predicted developement of the city area. 
  • Familiarize ourselves with the processes for attaining City permits and follow-up on our initial contacts to ensure smooth working relationships.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't support us with contribution you can help us sharing this project and video with your friends!

story:
About Us:
I have been passionate about artificial intelligence for 16 years. In that time I have developed my own neural networks, proposed my own theories of awareness, studied natural language processing, created context addressable memory, emergent systems, written programming languages as well as writing data referencing systems.

My lifetime objective is to create distributed consciousness capable of reasoning, empathy, feeling, conversing and solving problems. I want to make this freely and publicly available for people to use and study because I believe that powerful technologies like these should be made as accessible and transparent as possible. I think that privatization of information about important nascent technologies, like artificial intelligence, raise a number of ethical concerns and would be hinder the development and understanding of the technology itself.

The State of ENiX Now:
ENiX is a derivation from first principles approach to strong artificial intelligence. The proof of concept prototype is freely available on Sourceforge as ENiX 3 and is published under the legal protection of GNU Public Licensing agreement version 2 or later. The system is highly portable and can be compiled and run under Linux, Unix, OS X or Windows (in a Cygwin environment).

http://sourceforge.net/projects/enixdev/?source=directory

Although the prototype is not yet finished, it already demonstrates the ability to communicate and solve problems in basic English, store and retrieve information, learn logical data, explain the logic behind the data, detect and correct errors in the data, and be able to determine a metric for understanding the data. At the core of ENiX's operation is a 5th generation language, coupled with a neural network that provides the processing power to solve non-trivial problems.

It would be irresponsible of us to develop complex software like this without providing documentation. Unfortunately, due to the complexity of system, the user guide and description of operation currently span over 200 pages, and the Doxygen documentation is over 2000 pages. To make the documentation more accessible, we try and document things in video so that users can get started quickly without spending days reading.

The video documentation, so far, are short videos (about 10-15minutes each) that demonstrate a few basics of ENiX functionality.

Demo 1: Installation and System Control:



Demo 2: Programming Language:


Demo 3: Natural Language Processing:


Demo 4: Neural Networks:

Demo 5: Music Composition:


We also have video documentation explaining how the system works. This 85 minute video is a technical overview of how the ENiX neural network works, why it's aware, how it solves problems, how it can be applied to language and how to apply this awareness.

ENiX 3: Core Technologies (Machine Awareness) Parts 1 & 2:


We hope with funding to improve this video, so it's clearer and publish similar videos for data storage systems, natural language processing and other areas of our research that we haven't yet documented.

What differentiates ENiX from other systems is that it knows if it understands data; it can formulate models from very small amounts of data, and it can explain the occurrance of data. Very few AI systems can do these things, and even fewer are freely available, public and Open Source.

The Future of ENiX:
We have plans to take ENiX out of the proof of concept stage into something useful. We want to improve the scalability of ENiX processing across all CPU cores, all hyperthreads, for all ENiX users across the internet so that we can solve difficult problems quickly. We also want to create a distributed repository so that large quantities of information can be accumulated on the network so that ENiX systems are prepared with knowledge and training to solve problems and communicate effectively with users.

We also want to make the system a lot more accessible. We want to do this by providing even more video documentation to help users understand how the system works quickly. There are a number of improvements we want to make to the programming language to make system control more intuitive and natural for veteran users, as well as newcomers. Users of ENiX benefit everyone because the more exposure users have to ENiX, the more ENiX learns; if the user chooses information to be distributed, then this benefits all users.

Our main research focus right now is to move from the basic features, onto the more high level things people expect from general AI, such as deductive and reductive reasoning. This will be useful for communicating with the system. Additionally, we are particularly interested in emotional and empathetic features.

We have approach strategies for doing all of these things, and we believe every one of these problems is solvable.

We would like to see better quality free voice synthesis and voice dictation software, because these would integrate easily into our system. Unfortunately, some of the best products are commercial, copyrighted or licenced to companies - meaning that we cannot use them if we want to keep our software free. We do intermittently check the status of these technologies, but we haven't found anything ideal yet.

We would also like to see our neural networks implemented in hardware, such a field programmable gate arrays using VHDL. We believe there is a future for hardware neural network processors.

Why We Need Funding:
Because we are trying to develop a holistic solution to AI that works out of the box, our research has taken us into areas that as AI developers, we aren't specialist in. There are some things that we want to do, such develop interfaces, websites and video information resources but we would be better off outsourcing some of these development activities to experts in these things.

Additionally, we need equipment, software and dedicated hosting to give us the infrastructure we need to take our research out of a proof of concept stage and into a more accessible and useful system.

Your sponsorship would help us to mature the project and allow us to provide more information resources, and we would really appreciate all donations and support!

Unfortunately, due to the complexity of system, the user guide and description of operation currently span over 200 pages, and the Doxygen documentation is over 2000 pages. To make the documentation more accessible, we try and document things in video so that users can get started quickly without spending days reading. The video documentation, so far, are short videos (about 10-15minutes each) that demonstrate a few basics of ENiX functionality. Demo 1: Installation and System Control:Demo 2: Programming Language:Demo 3: Natural Language Processing:Demo 4: Neural Networks:Demo 5: Music Composition:We also have video documentation explaining how the system works. This 85 minute video is a technical overview of how the ENiX neural network works, why it's aware, how it solves problems, how it can be applied to language and how to apply this awareness. ENiX 3: Core Technologies (Machine Awareness) Parts 1 & 2:We hope with funding to improve this video, so it's clearer and publish similar videos for data storage systems, natural language processing and other areas of our research that we haven't yet documented.What differentiates ENiX from other systems is that it knows if it understands data; it can formulate models from very small amounts of data, and it can explain the occurrance of data. Very few AI systems can do these things, and even fewer are freely available, public and Open Source.The Future of ENiX:We have plans to take ENiX out of the proof of concept stage into something useful. We want to improve the scalability of ENiX processing across all CPU cores, all hyperthreads, for all ENiX users across the internet so that we can solve difficult problems quickly. We also want to create a distributed repository so that large quantities of information can be accumulated on the network so that ENiX systems are prepared with knowledge and training to solve problems and communicate effectively with users. We also want to make the system a lot more accessible. We want to do this by providing even more video documentation to help users understand how the system works quickly. There are a number of improvements we want to make to the programming language to make system control more intuitive and natural for veteran users, as well as newcomers. Users of ENiX benefit everyone because the more exposure users have to ENiX, the more ENiX learns; if the user chooses information to be distributed, then this benefits all users. Our main research focus right now is to move from the basic features, onto the more high level things people expect from general AI, such as deductive and reductive reasoning. This will be useful for communicating with the system. Additionally, we are particularly interested in emotional and empathetic features. We have approach strategies for doing all of these things, and we believe every one of these problems is solvable. We would like to see better quality free voice synthesis and voice dictation software, because these would integrate easily into our system. Unfortunately, some of the best products are commercial, copyrighted or licenced to companies - meaning that we cannot use them if we want to keep our software free. We do intermittently check the status of these technologies, but we haven't found anything ideal yet.We would also like to see our neural networks implemented in hardware, such a field programmable gate arrays using VHDL. We believe there is a future for hardware neural network processors.Why We Need Funding:Because we are trying to develop a holistic solution to AI that works out of the box, our research has taken us into areas that as AI developers, we aren't specialist in. There are some things that we want to do, such develop interfaces, websites and video information resources but we would be better off outsourcing some of these development activities to experts in these things.Additionally, we need equipment, software and dedicated hosting to give us the infrastructure we need to take our research out of a proof of concept stage and into a more accessible and useful system.Your sponsorship would help us to mature the project and allow us to provide more information resources, and we would really appreciate all donations and support!

story:
Hello. We are Max Konstanty and Josh Sommer. We are co-authoring a riveting new book called God and Country.

We met at the Purchase Area Walk to Emmaus in September of 2014. We both come from a Christian background. Both of us feel that the United States is in dire need of a strong voice to re-ignite forgotten or misplaced Conservative principals because that voice has been lost. Therefore, this book is being written as the catalyst to re-ignite these principals.

Max was born in Florida and his family, after moving around a bit, settled down north of Bowling Green, Kentucky. After graduation from Crittenden County High School in Marion, Kentucky, Max attended Murray State University where he obtained a Bachelors of Science degree with an emphasis on telecommunications. Max then moved to Charlotte, North Carolina and attended the University of North Carolina at Charlotte. Max became involved in the Church of Christ and is thoroughly familiar with their teachings and traditions.

Halfway through obtaining his degree, Max became concerned about the health of his father. He thought about dropping his classes, but his family urged him to finish his degree. Max obtained a Master's Degree in Information Technology in December of 2008 and moved to Paducah, Kentucky the next month where he had been offered a position as a risk management analyst. Max became interested in Conservative politics after listening to Rush Limbaugh's Institute for Advanced Conservative Studies.

Josh was born in Paducah, Kentucky and grew up in Massac County, Illinois. Josh attended Joppa High School. After graduation, Josh attended Shawnee Community College in Ullin, Illinois where he obtained an Associates of the Arts Degree. Thereafter, Josh went to Murray State University, where he graduated in December of 2003 with a Bachelors of Science Degree in Geography.

After graduation, Josh began working at the City of Oak Grove, Kentucky. Josh then came back to the City of Paducah in November of 2008 when he was offered a planning position. Josh was raised in a Conservative family and has held true to those values. Josh had grown up in the Southern Baptist Church most of his life. He became non-denominational in late 2008.

Max felt the call on his life to write God and Country in 2012. Max had written down many ideas, including the topics for this book. After meeting at the Purchase Area Walk to Emmaus in September of 2014, Max and Josh had a discussion in Calloway County, Kentucky that began the process of this book being written. Topics began to be compiled in October of 2014. Max and Josh began in earnest in the Summer of 2015, contacting a publisher and setting aside at least one day a week to work on God and Country.

Our hope is to raise $4,350.00 in order to pay for publishing and other related expenses. We have decided to publish with WestBow Press, a division of Thomas Nelson and Zondervan, which has a superb track record of publishing Christian authors. WestBow will assist us in getting God and Country in stores around the World and with an online presence in retailers such as Amazon and Barnes & Noble. Our agreement with them will account for publishing the book in both tangible and digital format. Together, with your help, we can begin the process of restoring Conservatism and help guide this nation back to our Christian roots.

Both of us have strong Christian backgrounds to draw from, have a deep sense of patriotism and are deeply concerned about the direction of America. This nation has turned against the Lord and our moral compass has been denigrated. America has become a nation where anything goes, from homosexual marriage to rampant abortion to selling baby parts to actively prosecuting and jailing Christians. We feel there is a majority of Americans ready to rise up and take our country back, both on our knees and at the ballot box. We know that America can be saved! Our hope is that Americans, coast to coast and north to south, will read God and Country and, through our common bond of patriotism and God-instilled values, rise up as one people.

Sadly, in the event we do not reach our goal of $4,350.00, we will not be able to purchase the package of our choice with WestBow, however; it is our intent to get this book published. We will then chose an alternate, less-expensive package to get God and Country published in some format.

God and Country is important to us because we see it not as just a conservative handbook, but as a catalyst for a Christian revolution. We hope that God and Country becomes a household name around the World, rooted in Christian love as Jesus himself showed. Neither of us wish to take credit for any positive impacts this book has, but rather give glory to God and kudos to hard-working Americans that have so selflessly sacrificed to help fund this book and get it off the ground.

This book will stand as justification for Christian principals, however; it only stands as opinion or argument for non-believers that will not fully understand the claims made, as some knowledge of the word is derived only through faith. We believe in some basic tenants of what God and Country is based on:

  1. We believe God and Country to be Holy Spirit guided.

  2. It is intended to show love, mercy and compassion for people while making them aware how the enemy is using the powers that be to come against God the Father.

  3. God and Country is Biblically-based and exercises a Christian world-view.

  4. God and Country will provide a foundation and blue print to return America back to our moral, ethical and God-given principals.

  5. We do not condemn anyone or any group in this book, as we realize our struggle is with principalities and powers, not against flesh and blood.

  6. We are fully aware of our society's moral decay and intend to combat it forcefully through God and Country and with the power of prayer.

  7. We are aware, and believe, this society is in the end times. Jesus said in Revelation that the Saints would war against the beast. We hope that God and Country serves to prepare spiritual warriors.

  8. We sincerely hope that salvation follows to many who read God and Country as well as showing them how to take a stand against the tyranny that has befallen us.

  9. God and Country is intended to empower people and educate them how to show love through Jesus Christ. We hope to see an army of Christians that love people in word and deed and are steadfast when society tries to oppress and force unjust laws upon the silent majority.

  10. We know Jesus Christ is coming back. Time is of the essence to publish God and Country. Our hope is that all Christians will be prepared for His return.

Both of us have spent countless hours in prayer for this book. We have sought the Holy Spirit, which has helped and qualified us, as with any Christian, to write God and Country. Much time has been taken to analyze and use current events to illustrate how Americans have, by-and-large, become pacifists that need to have a greater revelation of God and his love. Thereby, through that love, to be a force for good to encourage people and show love how God loves. We intent to use our right, through this representative Government, to be heard.

The main hurdle we face is monetary, as we hope to publish in as many formats as possible in order to reach as many people as possible. Therefore, with your help, we hope to overcome this hurdle. Also, many people skeptical of Christianity say that the Bible is polarizing which serves to divide people. God and Country is not meant to divide, but to unite all people transcending race, culture, age, wealth, gender, politics and any other spectrum of humanity.

In conclusion, we sincerely hope and ask for your help in getting this book published. For everyone that donates $30 or more, we will give you an honorable mention in God and Country as an appendix! We understand that some people may wish to donate anonymously. Knowing that people have found solace, direction and steadfastness in this book will bless us greater than we could ever imagine. We hope this book serves to address both the Great Commission and the Great Commandment. Both of us offer sincere blessings to the reader of this plea and hope you will consider helping us publish God and Country!

God Bless.

story:
Farmers Need Better Market Access 

Markit Opportunity is a social enterprise based in Kenya, working to improve the lives of famers and traders in East Africa. We offer a holistic approach to empowering rural farmers by offering its customers opportunities to access information about the markets they buy and sell in, exchange high-quality produce through an auction platform, and procure transportation services.

Our Mobile Platform

We need your help to improve the incomes of women smallholder farmers in the East African Community and incentivize regional trade by leveraging mobile technology and logistics innovation to create trusted, transparent and efficient supply chains that allow the EAC to feed and export high-quality goods internationally.

This multi-pronged approach allows the regional supply chain to connect with existing and new suppliers in their chain. With the advancement of mobile money technology and smartphone penetration, Markit sees the potential for EAC farmers to connect with the best prices in international trade.

For Markit Opportunity to help famers increase their prices and sell more, we provide three services:


The Pilot Details

Our Pilot will run from October 2015 through February 2016. We will offer onion trades in major markets direct access to high quality produce from the farmers we sign up on our platform. From Nyeri in the center of Kenya, to Bungoma in the West, we will have two groups of 100 farmers on our platform selling to dozens of traders in cities like Eldoret, Nakuru and Nairobi. 
The funds raised from this campaign will go strictly towards the direct costs of these pilots. Costs include transportation, IT, rent, staff salaries in the field, as well as SMS and call center fees.
Each month we anticipate expenses of $1,500. After 5 months, that totals to our campaign goal of $7,500.  Very simple, very transparent. Through your help we will be able to connect farmer to markets they have never been able to reach before!

Experience our Pilot with Us

After contributing today, we want you to share in our success!

  • $10 for a huge digital Thank You!
  • $25 sends you a post card with picture of our customer and a note from us.
  • $100 earns an original tote bag with materials from Kenyan farmers markets. We will also record a fresh cartwheel performed literally in the field. 
  • $200 offers a Skype call with our team in Kenya. We can show you an urban market hustle or a quiet farmer's farm. 
  • $500 puts you in the "Inner Circle." Membership includes opportunities to stay up to date on the pilot and future developments of the organization. We will arrange a meet-and-greet in Nairobi or San Francisco for any member. 
  • $3500 awards you with a flight to Nairobi and a visit with team members on the ground. Experience the pilot first hand and see the impact you've helped create!

Here is an example mockup of our unique farmer's market bag! 


Team Markit

Our team is comprised of passionate individuals who believe we can create a better market for farmers and traders in East Africa. The Founder, Ashley, has a demonstrable passion for women's empowerment, and has recently earned an MBA to help solve this social problem with a market-based solution. We are joined by volunteers and a full-time staff in Kenya that has helped get this business off the ground! 

Thank You! 

Thank you for your support! 

Please don't forget to share our campaign with your friends and family!  

You don't have to be on the farm to make a difference with us, a simple share can make a big impact! 

(Special thanks to http://www.bensound.com for the music tracks.)

story:
The Purpose of Raindance Weather 

My name is Jacob Mazel. I am trying to create crowd-sourced seasonal weather forecasts by turning my current website Raindance Weather which is little more than an Indiegogo demonstration currently, into a weather prediction market. For daily forecasts, weather prediction markets are already a proven concept (Weather Prediction Market). My goal is develop a seasonal weather forecasting market for US cities - i.e is the winter going to be snowier than usual in Albuquerque? How about in Chicago or in your city?

It is my belief that over time strong opinions about the weather from amateurs would produce a very reliable seasonal weather forecast.

I have some evidence to back up my belief. Before Albuquerque's snow season of 2014-2015, I had my co-workers guess how much snow Albuquerque would get each month. Winners, in terms of forecasts matching observed conditions, received free pizza. With the exception of February when we had very rare heavy snow, the overall predictions were quite accurate. You can see the results for yourself below (original hand written guesses follow the Excel summary).


With more people betting, a way for betters to indicate confidence in their bet, and knowledge of who had good foresight from previous forecasting contests, the results would have been even better. Users on Raindance Weather would also be given more information that my co-workers were - I only gave out snow averages by month, using the winter of 1931-1932 to 2013-2014 for my base period.

Most weather data can be easily verified too.

Right now, all I have is a very basic template I built, and I can not afford to hire people to help me develop it properly without funding.

I am interested in doing this because I would like accurate seasonal forecasts for my city, Albuquerque, New Mexico, and I am sure people in other places, particularly in the West where mountains and topography make seasonal forecasting difficult would be interested in good, place specific, long range forecasts, 

More generally, I have a long standing interest in predictions and what makes them work or not, and this project allows me to explore that interest further. I've made some bold predictions in the video game industry in the past (Five year prediction) which essentially verified (Forecast Verification). 

I would like to give people not just the opportunity to prove they can predict long range weather trends well, but the wisdom of a forecast generated by the masses. 


What We Need & What You Get

Raindance Weather currently does not allow for users to register and as it stands now you can't use it for forecasting. This crowdfunding pitch is to try to raise $65,000 to develop out that functionality. For that much money I can:

  • Hire web development help ($20,000 - $60,000). The full $60,000 would cover tying the fake betting scheme to user accounts while $20,000 covers a much more basic site.
  • Provide custom tools and visualizations to analyze forecasts and forecasters.
  • Pay for servers 
  • Hire researchers to help with collecting data for various cities. These people would also help with forecast verification. Forecasts will be verified with NOW Data, and Weather Warehouse data for the USA. Both NOW and the Weather Warehouse archive data from the National Weather Service (NWS).
  • Reimburse some of my personal costs - my logo, time, web video, domain, legal research, new laptop ($600).
  • Advertise / convince people to participate and stay on the site.
  • Produce custom, big data research.
If I don't reach my goal fully, the website will become less sophisticated, but there are other approaches. One approach would be Survey Monkey. Even with less money it would be possible to buy "survey takers" from Survey Monkey, and then use their insights to generate forecasts.

Why Should I Contribute?
Contributing to this project puts you on your way to seeing how people from vastly different backgrounds think seasonal weather will play out in your backyard. If you think the weatherman on TV making long-range forecasts is an idiot, you also have a way to prove that you're right, or that he is wrong. I certainly can't stop you from entering in predictions from your TV weatherman to see how they verify...you can be the curmudgeon here!

More generally, by contributing to this campaign, you are helping me undergo a grand experiment that should yield some interesting results:

  • Can a crowd produce an accurate seasonal weather forecast?
  • Can the crowd match or beat individual expert forecasters?
  • We can answer these questions with user interest and ongoing participation.
  • Overtime, the results may become good enough to save lives and dollars.
  • There are a hand full of brilliant long range forecasters out there now - Joe Bastardi, Dave Tolleris, Joe D'Aleo - but they are aging. One of the benefits of contributing to this campaign would be to help discover the next wave of brilliant long-range forecasters.
One of the reasons I want web development help is to collect basic user information. We can collect and analyze this information in all sorts of ways.
Do men make better forecasters? How about older people? In our snow experiment, the older folks in the office won the individual months each time, but I, at the age of 27, had the closest seasonal call. Do people living in the area they are forecasting predict differently than people outside the area? 

I am curious to see if studying the weather actually makes you a good forecaster. We could ask people to rate their knowledge of the weather when they sign up and then see if the people who rated themselves highly actually forecast well.

Risks & Challenges

There are many challenges to this project. One is interest. This campaign is designed not just to raise money, but to see if interest in this project exists on a large enough scale. For forecasts to be possible, users will need to continue to bet their fake currency over time, which means...we need users.

I am hoping the possibility of being known as the best forecaster for something like snowfall outlooks, will keep users interested. I would like to offer some kind of prize, beyond additional fake currency for the winners, but this gets a little bit tricky legally. Still researching how to do this.

To promote interest, I will reach out to various weather forums, weather forecasters with many twitter followers, and use Fiverr favors for promotion. 

In the future, I will also ask users what types of forecasting they would like to see. 
  • Will Florida get hit by a hurricane this year? 
  • Will sea ice reach record lows?
  • Is there really a Maunder Minimum coming? 
  • Perhaps we could even look at global warming issues. Anything verifiable would be doable with user interest.
One possible final way to keep users interested would be to allow proven users to post forecasts of their choice. The users would be able to sell their forecasts, and keep most of the money (Raindance would keep some of it too.)

I used to work for a video game website, we were never super-popular, but we had steady, reliable users, so I believe once a base of users is established, the site could become quite useful and interesting. 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute financially, please pitch the site.

  • If you are in a sports league - pitch this idea there. This is essentially fantasy weather.
  • Use the Indiegogo share tools.
  • Promote this campaign with Facebook, Twitter, Linkedin, Pinterest, Etsy, Tumblr, Snapchat, Kik, Email, Texts, Conversation, whatever it takes - it all helps!

Thanks everybody!
story_txt:
The Purpose of Raindance Weather 
 My name is Jacob Mazel. I am trying to create crowd-sourced seasonal weather forecasts by turning my current website Raindance Weather which is little more than an Indiegogo demonstration currently, into a weather prediction market. For daily forecasts, weather prediction markets are already a proven concept (Weather Prediction Market). My goal is develop a seasonal weather forecasting market for US cities - i.e is the winter going to be snowier than usual in Albuquerque? How about in Chicago or in your city?
It is my belief that over time strong opinions about the weather from amateurs would produce a very reliable seasonal weather forecast.
I have some evidence to back up my belief. Before Albuquerque's snow season of 2014-2015, I had my co-workers guess how much snow Albuquerque would get each month. Winners, in terms of forecasts matching observed conditions, received free pizza. With the exception of February when we had very rare heavy snow, the overall predictions were quite accurate. You can see the results for yourself below (original hand written guesses follow the Excel summary).



With more people betting, a way for betters to indicate confidence in their bet, and knowledge of who had good foresight from previous forecasting contests, the results would have been even better. Users on Raindance Weather would also be given more information that my co-workers were - I only gave out snow averages by month, using the winter of 1931-1932 to 2013-2014 for my base period.
Most weather data can be easily verified too.


Right now, all I have is a very basic template I built, and I can not afford to hire people to help me develop it properly without funding.



I am interested in doing this because I would like accurate seasonal forecasts for my city, Albuquerque, New Mexico, and I am sure people in other places, particularly in the West where mountains and topography make seasonal forecasting difficult would be interested in good, place specific, long range forecasts, 
More generally, I have a long standing interest in predictions and what makes them work or not, and this project allows me to explore that interest further. I've made some bold predictions in the video game industry in the past (Five year prediction) which essentially verified (Forecast Verification). 
I would like to give people not just the opportunity to prove they can predict long range weather trends well, but the wisdom of a forecast generated by the masses. 
   What We Need & What You Get Raindance Weather currently does not allow for users to register and as it stands now you can't use it for forecasting. This crowdfunding pitch is to try to raise $65,000 to develop out that functionality. For that much money I can:  Hire web development help ($20,000 - $60,000). The full $60,000 would cover tying the fake betting scheme to user accounts while $20,000 covers a much more basic site.
Provide custom tools and visualizations to analyze forecasts and forecasters. Pay for servers  Hire researchers to help with collecting data for various cities. These people would also help with forecast verification. Forecasts will be verified with NOW Data, and Weather Warehouse data for the USA. Both NOW and the Weather Warehouse archive data from the National Weather Service (NWS).
Reimburse some of my personal costs - my logo, time, web video, domain, legal research, new laptop ($600).
Advertise / convince people to participate and stay on the site.
Produce custom, big data research.

If I don't reach my goal fully, the website will become less sophisticated, but there are other approaches. One approach would be Survey Monkey. Even with less money it would be possible to buy "survey takers" from Survey Monkey, and then use their insights to generate forecasts.



Why Should I Contribute?


Contributing to this project puts you on your way to seeing how people from vastly different backgrounds think seasonal weather will play out in your backyard. If you think the weatherman on TV making long-range forecasts is an idiot, you also have a way to prove that you're right, or that he is wrong. I certainly can't stop you from entering in predictions from your TV weatherman to see how they verify...you can be the curmudgeon here!



More generally, by contributing to this campaign, you are helping me undergo a grand experiment that should yield some interesting results:  Can a crowd produce an accurate seasonal weather forecast? Can the crowd match or beat individual expert forecasters?
We can answer these questions with user interest and ongoing participation.
Overtime, the results may become good enough to save lives and dollars.
There are a hand full of brilliant long range forecasters out there now - Joe Bastardi, Dave Tolleris, Joe D'Aleo - but they are aging. One of the benefits of contributing to this campaign would be to help discover the next wave of brilliant long-range forecasters. 
One of the reasons I want web development help is to collect basic user information. We can collect and analyze this information in all sorts of ways.
Do men make better forecasters? How about older people? In our snow experiment, the older folks in the office won the individual months each time, but I, at the age of 27, had the closest seasonal call. Do people living in the area they are forecasting predict differently than people outside the area? 


I am curious to see if studying the weather actually makes you a good forecaster. We could ask people to rate their knowledge of the weather when they sign up and then see if the people who rated themselves highly actually forecast well.
   Risks & Challenges
There are many challenges to this project. One is interest. This campaign is designed not just to raise money, but to see if interest in this project exists on a large enough scale. For forecasts to be possible, users will need to continue to bet their fake currency over time, which means...we need users.


I am hoping the possibility of being known as the best forecaster for something like snowfall outlooks, will keep users interested. I would like to offer some kind of prize, beyond additional fake currency for the winners, but this gets a little bit tricky legally. Still researching how to do this.

To promote interest, I will reach out to various weather forums, weather forecasters with many twitter followers, and use Fiverr favors for promotion. 



In the future, I will also ask users what types of forecasting they would like to see. 




Will Florida get hit by a hurricane this year? 


Will sea ice reach record lows?


Is there really a Maunder Minimum coming? 


Perhaps we could even look at global warming issues. Anything verifiable would be doable with user interest.



One possible final way to keep users interested would be to allow proven users to post forecasts of their choice. The users would be able to sell their forecasts, and keep most of the money (Raindance would keep some of it too.)




I used to work for a video game website, we were never super-popular, but we had steady, reliable users, so I believe once a base of users is established, the site could become quite useful and interesting. 

    Other Ways You Can Help If you can't contribute financially, please pitch the site.  If you are in a sports league - pitch this idea there. This is essentially fantasy weather.
 Use the Indiegogo share tools.
Promote this campaign with Facebook, Twitter, Linkedin, Pinterest, Etsy, Tumblr, Snapchat, Kik, Email, Texts, Conversation, whatever it takes - it all helps!   Thanks everybody!

story:
Hey there, 

Thanks for visiting White Tiger's Indiegogo page! 

My name is Shree and I founded White Tiger Herbals with just one goal in mind: Making great skincare products from all-natural ingredients. As a woman, having smooth and soft skin is an essential, but due to my dry skin and eczema, this was never a possibility. I spent years looking for the perfect product that did not use harsh chemicals, yet when my forays failed, I decided to create it myself!

The all-natural products on the market cost a fortune. The affordable skin products from the major cosmetic brands contain crazy chemicals. We didn't want to put Phenoxyethenol on our skin and we're guessing you probably don't either.

Our artisan scrubs are hand-blended with the freshest ingredients. We start off with a base made from Organic Cane Sugar and Extra Virgin Coconut Oil, and then mix in home-powdered fruits and vegetables with great anti-aging and antioxidant properties. We then finish off our scrubs with all-natural plant oils, herbs, and natural preservatives purchased from trustworthy suppliers. 

The result? Skin products that both look and feel great to use. Carrots, limes, potatoes, beets, and turmeric are just a few of our "secret" ingredients!

So hop on board! We've got all the basic groundwork and the product recipes done. All we request is your funding to help package and ship the product. With your generosity (and some cool perks!) we know we can make a big dent in the multi-billion dollar skincare industry.

Our products are targeted towards anyone who wants their skin to be replenished with all natural vegetable powders and oils, and to be left silky smooth!It's time to abandon harmful chemicals once and for all! Join our fight to produce skincare products that are great for our skin...and our wallets :)

Best Wishes,

Shree, and the White Tiger Team :)

story:
Notre site Internet : www.zone360.fr


Visitez aussi notre page Facebook !


Et n'hésitez pas à nous contacter !


Zone 360 - 63 Av Jean Jaurès 12100 Millau

Mail : contact@zone360.fr

Mobile : 06 07 17 48 65                                                      

Téléphone fixe : 05 65 97 79 18



ZONE 360

UN ESPACE UNIQUE ET INCROYABLE !!!


Nous allons ouvrir une salle de jeux de 680 m² à Millau pour tous les fans de jeux vidéos et de lasergame, jeunes et moins jeunes, mais aussi pour tous ceux qui aiment les mangas, les comics, les B.D., les jeux de société, bref, pour tous les geeks et les geeks qui s'ignorent ! Nous espérons créer un lieu convivial et dynamique au cœur de la ville, avec de nombreuses activités et la possibilité d'expérimenter les dernières nouveautés technologiques. Toutes ces activités seront réparties en 3 zones.
Vous pouvez aller voir l'avancée des travaux et notre devanture avenue Jean Jaurès, qui ne passe pas inaperçue ;)


VR ZONE

ZONE DE RÉALITÉ VIRTUELLE

VENEZ DÉCOUVRIR LA RÉALITÉ VIRTUELLE avec les casques virtuels qui révolutionnent les jeux vidéos et ouvrent des perspectives dans de nombreux domaines.

UN ÉQUIPEMENT A LA POINTE DE LA TECHNOLOGIE AVEC TOUS LES ACCESSOIRES COMPATIBLES VR (Virtual Reality)

Les possibilités offertes par la réalité virtuelle sont infinies. De nombreux projets sont en cours pour développer des équipements qui enrichissent l'expérience virtuelle. Nous suivons l'actualité dans ce domaine et nous participons régulièrement à des campagnes de financement pour rester à la pointe de la technologie.

Nous avons par exemple participé au financement de capteurs de mouvements, de vestes à  retour haptique, de bases pour vous déplacer dans le monde virtuel : marcher, courir, sauter, s'accroupir, sera possible et rendra l'immersion plus intense.

Nous pourrons vous proposer tous ces équipements au fur et à mesure de leur disponibilité, pour la plupart début 2016.


Vous aurez aussi accès à des simulateurs de conduite ou de pilotage de qualité professionnelle pour des expériences époustouflantes !


LASER ZONE

UNE ZONE DE JEU GRANDEUR NATURE


Venez découvrir une nouvelle approche entre LASER GAME et PAINTBALL : un tout nouvel équipement qui permet de jouer en intérieur et en extérieur avec un maximum de personnalisation des parties : capture de drapeaux, désamorçage de bombes, prisonniers... Nous pourrons également vous offrir la possibilité de participer à des séances scénarisées et soirées à thème type Star Wars, Zombies, Swat et bien d'autres !!!

QUE L'AVENTURE COMMENCE !




INFINITY ZONE 

ZONE MULTI-ACTIVITÉS

Vous y trouverez de nombreuses autres façons de vous divertir et vous détendre. Dans un cadre totalement geek, venez lire vos mangas, comics ou B.D. préférés et en découvrir des milliers d'autres. Vous pourrez aussi jouer aux anciens et moins anciens jeux vidéos (rétrogaming), sur des bornes d'arcade et des consoles, ou tout simplement vous lancer avec vos amis dans une partie de jeux de société, avec un choix très varié, dans une ambiance vraiment sympa !


RÉTRO GAMING


JEUX DE SOCIÉTÉ


DES MILLIERS DE COMICS


DES MILLIERS DE MANGAS


SNACKS
Deux consos - boissons et popcorn - seront offertes avec votre entrée.
Et vous pourrez également vous rassasier avec des sandwichs, barres chocolatées et autres friandises...




ZEN ZONE

UN COIN DÉTENTE AVEC LE SUMMUM DES SIÈGES MASSANT

Profitez d'un petit moment de Zen attitude en venant vous faire masser de la tête jusqu'aux pieds.



ÉVÈNEMENTIELS ET SOIRÉES A THÈMES

Nous organiserons des évènementiels avec des scénarios thématiques dans le lasergame, des tournois de jeux et des soirées spéciales costumées complètement délirantes !!!



En clair, l’amusement à 360° !


Zone 360 est une petite entreprise locale du sud-Aveyron. Son fondateur, Florian Jauffret, est spécialisé dans l'informatique et il a créé son entreprise à Saint-Affrique, SID, il y a dix ans. Nous croyons beaucoup en ce projet pour Millau et y travaillons depuis plus de deux ans avec un grand enthousiasme.

Le projet est bien avancé : les travaux sont en cours et nous pensons ouvrir en novembre. Pour en finaliser la réalisation au mieux, nous vous proposons de nous soutenir en achetant vos places à tarif réduit au moyen d'Indiegogo.

Plan de la salle :



REJOIGNEZ NOTRE COMMUNAUTÉ !!!


L’ÉQUIPE :

-  Florian JAUFFRET - Fondateur

- Leïla Rozan - Co-Fondateur

- Franck Jauffret - Designer

- Frédéric Jauffret - Software

- Mona Moret - Web Designer

- Christophe Adant - Dessinateur

- Max Loubaresse - Dessinateur

Un grand Merci !!! A toutes les personnes ayant participé ou soutenu ce projet.


Musique de la Vidéo d'intro:  Ason - Welcome to my house

story: It has been a little over a year since we served our first sandwich and we are ready for brick and mortar! Since we opened we have served close to 5,000 falafel sandwiches and plates, each one hand crafted at our mobile food experience or our pop-up cafe. The number one request we get is more availability. Either folks can't make it to our weekly pop-up on Thursdays or the events are just not regular enough. This is a good problem to have and one that we can fix-with your help. We have found the perfect little building on High St. in Holyoke where we want to open the Holyoke Hummus Cafe. They have accepted an offer of $45,000 (yes that is for a whole building!) and we need help to get there and beyond. Over the last year we have felt an amazing amount of community support for what we are doing. Our High Street location will join several other iconic Holyoke establishments and add to the diversity of downtown restaurants. With your support we can get this restaurant open and be another positive piece in the great and growing community of Holyoke.

story:
Electric Guitar Uses 3-D printed Technology to Change Sounds On the Fly

Background: If you play electric guitar, you know that the reason a guitar sounds the way it does is because of the pickups–the electronics underneath the strings–that detect the vibrations of the guitar’s strings. Traditionally, if you want a different guitar sound, you have to buy a completely new guitar or rip your guitar apart, rewire it and put it back together.

Invention: Strassell Guitars is different. Thanks to 3-D printing, the bridge pickups on an electric guitar can be swapped in and out like batteries or video game cartridges–a process that takes literally 3 seconds–and it completely changes the guitar's sound. Here is a video of the 3-D printing model (patent pending).
https://youtu.be/9IISNh4YeOc
Company's Mission & Goals: Founded by Andrew Strassell, Strassell Guitar's mission is to bring low-cost, custom-built guitars to musicians who what to get the most out of one instrument.
Presently, Strassell Guitars is a small business that is run out of a small NYC apartment. The company is looking to grow–hiring employees to meet demand and relocating to larger workspace. Strassell Guitars is in the process of applying for its first patent to secure ownership of the break-through technology.
With this Indigogo campaign, I hope to raise $50,000. This amount of money will be used to pay for a larger workshop, a staff, any necessary legal fees, and wider-reaching press.
Website: Visit www.strassellguitars.com for more information.
Recent Work: Strassell Guitar's most recent project was a custom Flying V-style guitar for Josh Shabtai of the NYC synth/punk band Controller. The guitar was built to custom specifications and designed to accommodate Shabtai's need for a massive low-end blended with sharp, post-punky bite. Here is a video of the guitar being played by Shabtai at a Controller event in NYC.
https://youtu.be/JguPIAYw0X0
Recent Press: This invention was recently featured in a Mic.com article written by Tom Barnes. A link to the article is below.
http://mic.com/articles/124917/this-invention-could-revolutionize-the-way-we-play-guitar
It was also featured in an article written by the NY Observer. A link is below.
http://observer.com/2015/09/how-3d-printing-is-changing-the-guitar-forever/
Thanks for visiting!

story:
En México cada 4 horas muere un niño con cáncer.


En México los tipos de cáncer en niños que se presentan con mayor frecuencia son: leucemia, linfomas y tumores malignos cerebrales.

Cada año a causa de cáncer, mueren 2,300 niños en la República Mexicana (CONAPO).

El 49.3% de los casos de cáncer infantil, son de niños menores de 6 años (SECRETARÍA DE SALUD/SEGURO POPULAR).

El cáncer es la primer causa de muerte entre los 1 y 15 años de edad.


¿Cómo ayudamos a los niños?


"Agentes de Esperanza" es un movimiento donde jóvenes mexicanos nos comprometemos a brindar ayuda a niños con cáncer a través de la donación de un complemento alimenticio natural que les provee de una gran fuente de nutrientes necesarios para mantener sus células sanas y soportar la duración de todos sus tratamientos los cuales muchas veces duran años.


Los beneficios que viven los niños:


El complemento alimenticio natural que consumen permite brindarles suficientes nutrientes que les ayudan a:
  • Que no se les caiga el cabello
  • No sentirse tan débiles después o durante sus quimioterapias
  • Fortalecer su sistema inmunológico
  • Fortalecer sus defensas
  • Evitar resfriados y complicaciones respiratorias
  • Aumentar energía
  • Disminuye los efectos secundarios de las quimioterapias
  • Protege las células sanas mientras ayuda a combatir a las células cancerígenas durante las quimioterapias
  • Reducir el tamaño de los tumores
  • Reducir en muchos casos el dolor que experimentan durante sus tratamientos
  • Algunos niños están en estado de remisión
  • Previene el daño en el hígado durante las quimioterapias
El complemento alimenticio provee de una gran cantidad de nutrientes que actúan a nivel celular protegiendo los órganos y sistemas durante los tratamientos invasivos a los que es sometido un niño.
Está demostrado científicamente que el cáncer es una enfermedad que tiene origen en la inflamación celular. El complemento ayuda a desinflamar las células de manera natural y disminuir en algunos casos tumores.
Tenemos casos de niños en estado de remisión después del consumo constante y a largo plazo del complemento.
El consumo del complemento no sustituye los tratamientos médicos, sino que es dado como una fuente adicional abundante en nutrientes para su cuerpo.
El complemento no cura el cáncer, pero la cantidad de nutrientes que provee al organismo ayuda a tener más y mejores oportunidades sobrevivir el cáncer.

Los resultados hasta hoy:


A partir del 2014 hemos ayudado con el complemento a 50 niños cada mes en la Asociación Luz de Vida en México D.F.

Los niños que tienen la oportunidad de consumir el complemento por un mínimo de 12 meses viven una calidad de vida mucho mejor que los niños que no lo consumen y pueden tener una recuperación más rápida durante sus tratamientos.

Algunos niños que han consumido el complemento por un lapso mínimo de 12 meses se encuentran en remisión.


Los desafíos:


Existen alrededor de 200 niños en la Asociación Luz de Vida en espera de algún donador constante. Sin mencionar los 7,000 nuevos casos que se presentan cada año en México.

Mientras más tiempo consuman los niños este nutriente y lleven a cabo todos sus tratamientos médicos al pie de la letra, mejores son sus probabilidades de sobrevivir.

El desafío más grande al que nos enfrentamos es lograr la donación recurrente del complemento. Necesitamos ayudarlos por un lapso mínimo de 12 meses para que tengan mejores oportunidades de sobrevivir.

Es importante que los niños consuman el complemento de manera diaria y constante para que su cuerpo mantenga altas defensas durante toda la duración de su tratamiento. Muchos tratamientos duran más de 2 años y requieren hasta 30 quimioterapias. Por esto, donar una sola vez ayuda, pero sólo corresponde a la dosis de un mes para un niño. Por esto, lo mínimo que se necesita es que cada niño tenga su dosis de complemento por mínimo 12 meses.


Nuestra meta:


Aunque nuestro objetivo a largo plazo es lograr donaciones durante un periodo de 12 meses para los 200 niños que se encuentran en Luz de Vida y que tengan una mejor oportunidad de vencer el cáncer, la primer meta es ayudar a 50 niños más este mes.

Para poder ayudar a 50 niños cada mes necesitamos recaudar $6,000 dólares.

La totalidad de las donaciones recaudadas serán utilizadas para comprar y entregar el complemento alimenticio a la Asociación Luz de Vida.


¿Cuándo se hace entrega del complemento?


Una vez que haya terminado la recaudación de las donaciones, se hará la entrega del complemento el día jueves 1 de octubre de Septiembre del 2015 directamente en la Asociación Luz de Vida y se enviarán las fotos de la entrega a todos los donadores.


Recompensas:


Si donas $20 dólares recibe: 

Un libro impreso enviado a tu domicilio de los grandes beneficios del complemento alimenticio.

Si donas $40 dólares recibe: 

Una artesanía mexicana de una calaverita directamente en tu casa. Las artesanías son todas distintas en diseño.


Si donas $80 dólares recibe: 

Recibe un alebrije pequeño. Una de las artesanías más destacadas que te regalaremos por tu generosa contribución a ayudar a los niños con cáncer.


Si donas $150 dólares recibe: 

Un cuadro artesanal de vidrio de forma circular con arena de sílice de colores para decorar tu casa.


Si donas $200 dólares o más recibe: 

Una Catrina pequeña. Es una artesanía mexicana muy tradicional. Todos los diseños son distintos y originales.


Si donas $300 dólares o más recibe: 

Recibe un alebrije mediano. Una de las artesanías más destacadas que te regalaremos por tu generosa contribución a ayudar a los niños con cáncer.


Si donas $400 dólares o más recibe: 

Recibe un Catrina de tamaño mediano.



Otras formas en las que puedes ayudar:


Ayudar a personas que lo necesitan, en este caso a los niños, para nosotros es una obligación y un compromiso. Creemos que existen muchísimas personas bondadosas y conscientes de lo importante que es ayudar a alcanzar esta meta.

Si todos ponemos un granito de arena podemos lograr resultados increíbles y nos encantaría que formes parte de este movimiento.

Si hoy cuentas con los recursos, ayúdanos donando para darles a los niños más oportunidades de sobrevivir.

¡Ayúdanos a pasar la voz! Vivimos en una época en la que hay mucha gente que quiere ayudar pero no sabe cómo. Si no tienes dinero para donar, ¡no te preocupes! Ayúdanos compartiendo con tus amigos y dando like a nuestra página de Facebook.

Entre todos podemos hacer una diferencia enorme. México nos necesita y los niños también.
story_txt:
En México cada 4 horas muere un niño con cáncer.


En México los tipos de cáncer en niños que se presentan con mayor frecuencia son: leucemia, linfomas y tumores malignos cerebrales.Cada año a causa de cáncer, mueren 2,300 niños en la República Mexicana (CONAPO).El 49.3% de los casos de cáncer infantil, son de niños menores de 6 años (SECRETARÍA DE SALUD/SEGURO POPULAR).El cáncer es la primer causa de muerte entre los 1 y 15 años de edad.

¿Cómo ayudamos a los niños?

"Agentes de Esperanza" es un movimiento donde jóvenes mexicanos nos comprometemos a brindar ayuda a niños con cáncer a través de la donación de un complemento alimenticio natural que les provee de una gran fuente de nutrientes necesarios para mantener sus células sanas y soportar la duración de todos sus tratamientos los cuales muchas veces duran años.


Los beneficios que viven los niños:


El complemento alimenticio natural que consumen permite brindarles suficientes nutrientes que les ayudan a:


Que no se les caiga el cabello
No sentirse tan débiles después o durante sus quimioterapias
Fortalecer su sistema inmunológico
Fortalecer sus defensas
Evitar resfriados y complicaciones respiratorias
Aumentar energía
Disminuye los efectos secundarios de las quimioterapias
Protege las células sanas mientras ayuda a combatir a las células cancerígenas durante las quimioterapias
Reducir el tamaño de los tumores
Reducir en muchos casos el dolor que experimentan durante sus tratamientos
Algunos niños están en estado de remisión
Previene el daño en el hígado durante las quimioterapias

story:
Save the Syrian People

My name is Stavros and I live in Athens, Greece.

All these days I watch the tragedy of Syrian refugees and decided to do something about it. Something as simple as starting such a campaign online to raise some funds that could at least aliviate a bit of the pain for these people.
