Something as simple as starting such a campaign online to raise some funds that could at least aliviate a bit of the pain for these people.

story:
Short Summary

About FLOATZ:

A CNC router normally has a rigid z-axis where the drive motors control the motion of the z-axis to cut a part. But for processes like engraving: rigid Z-axis is unsuitable, as it won’t accommodate variation in sheet height. The FLOATZ as the name suggests will float/glide on the sheet surface (self-adjust to sheet surface) thus maintaining uniform engraving depth and also prevent tool jamming due to increased depth of cut. The FLOATZ will expand the capability of your CNC machine to various processes like pen-plotting, pencil-plotting, vinyl sticker cutting, engraving, PCB engraving etc.

About us: We are  passionate users and designers of CNC machines. We are also passionate about spreading the use of automation in manufacturing to support the MAKER movement and MAKE IN INDIA movement.

What We Need & What You Get

We are excited to have conceptualised and designed the FLOATZ.

We are excited about the multi-purpose value-added utility of FLOATZ to an existing CNC machine owner and happy to share our invention to the MAKERS of this world.

What we need: We need your enthusiastic support to buy and use our invention.

The Impact

Existing CNC machine owners can increase the capability of their machines to

  • Pen plotting
  • Pencil plotting
  • Vinyl Sticker cutting
  • Drag engraving
  • Vibro engraving ( using Dremel 290 tool etc. )
  • Roto engraving ( using Dremel 3000 tool etc.)
  • PCB engraving, granite engraving, jewellery engraving etc.
  • Etc.

Compatible with wide range of CNC machines like CNC milling, CNC router, CNC plasma, CNC oxy-fuel cutters, CNC Laser, CNC WaterJet etc.

Compatible with wide range of CNC machine brands like ShopBot, Roland, MultiCNC, AXYZ, Sherline, Shapeoko, X-carve etc.


Compatible tools with floatZ:

  • Any size pencil, pen, OHP marker pen, CD marker pen, paint brush etc.
    Dremel 9924 carbide tip ( for drag engraving )
    Dremel 9929 diamond tip ( for drag engraving )
    Vinyl cutter blade assembly
    (http://www.ebay.com/itm/Gold-Blade-Holder-for-Laser-Point-2-Vinyl-Plotter-Cutter-Blade-UsCutter-Roland-/201121960005)
    Dremel 290 engraver
    Dremel 3000/4000 spindle
More MAKING capabilities, more fun & value for the MAKERS.


Risks & Challenges

We have already tested the FloatZ for various processes. It works great. On vinyl sticker cutting alone: because of the extra cutting pressure, speeds possible are lesser compared to dedicated Vinyl Sticker cutting machines.

Other Ways You Can Help

More details available at our website : MultiCNC.in/FloatZ

Do forward to your friends.

story:
Short Summary

SustainSpace strives to enhance sustainability by publicizing the use of space life support technologies that can be used for sustainability purposes on Earth. Many of these technologies can improve sustainability by increasing efficiency or "closing the loop".

This campaign will provide funding to new writers and seed grants to students and others who are working on related products.


What We Need & What You Get

  • We need $300 to encourage external writers to write about space life support technologies and opportunities for re-use on Earth. We plan to pay $50 each for six articles by external writers, such as college students or activists.  While this isn't very much, it covers a several hours of work to explore an area of technology and write a concise piece. We give writers who are passionate about space and sustainability a platform for their work, as well as recognition, validation and a little money. Your donation will go a long way in this regard.
  • We need $200 for seed micro-grants ($50 to $100) to support relevant projects, primarily for university students and possibly space analog stations. The money will help them cover parts and supplies, and provide encouragement and recognition. Any extra money will go towards seed grants and/or a future competition. More would be better, but even this amount can help kick-off 2 to 4 projects.
  • We need additional money to do more of the above, cover website expenses, and improve the quality of the site.
  • About 10% of any gross donations will cover payment processing fees and overhead expenses.
  • Even if the campaign amount goal is not reached, your donations will help support the above activities.

What You Get

  • $5 will earn you our appreciation and your name will be listed on the SustainSpace website as a contributor.
  • $10 will earn you the above plus a 1-year subscription which will give you access to a small amount of restricted content.
  • $50  will earn you the above, plus you will be names as a sponsor of a SustainSpace article.
  • $100 will earn you the above (except article sponsorship), but you will be listed as a sponsor of a seed grant.

The Impact

This project will provide several forms of impact, and your contribution will make a difference. By helping to get students and others enthusiastic about sustainability as well as space technology, you will be helping to advance both.

  • You will help promote space technologies for sustainability.
  • You will encourage students and other writers to think more about space technology for sustainability.
  • The seed fund will encourage students and others to conduct projects related to space and technology.
  • The SustainSpace model will encourage the application of space technology for Earth use and then using profits from such to help drive space development.

Other Ways You Can Help

Just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help:

  • Help get the word out about SustainSpace and this campaign.
  • Consider becoming a writer for SustainSpace or applying for a seed grant.

story:
Welcome to the "TUBE" swimming club

Our club is engaged in initial training, and the training of professional swimmers. Through our programs and our coaching staff, we will help all achieve excellent results and performance in sport. Since 2008, we have collected more than 1,000 swimmers - winners and laureates of international and local tournaments and competitions in swimming.

In 2014 we opened the first swim laboratory in Kazakhstan, equipped with a Endless Pools®

We provide training in the 25M pool, gym and Endless Pools®. But our gym has no specialized simulators and equipment for swimmers. We love our sport and we want to swim faster than anyone.




Kazakhstan is hard to find a sponsor for the children's sports clubs. We ask you to help get young swimmers equipped gym.

story:
Short Summary

I am a cultural critic committed to creating context shifts and upward spirals. 

Since 2001, I have been been consulting, coaching and training with an amazing ability in aiding people to assess and access what is important to them and fulfilling on their goals.

To take it one step further, I am attending a Coaches Training program to hone in my skills and obtain certification;  however, the costs of starting a new business, even one with low overhead, are providing some barriers.  So I am creating my own upward spiral offering my services at a discounted rate.  
After months of working 30-40 hours a week as a server while writing and building my business, my goal is to earn a living, a decent one, soley through writing and coaching by January, 2016.   


What We Need & What You Get

I need to cover the costs associated with starting a business including training, legal and insurance.  

I am so thankful to be able to have a life-altering conversation with you.  

$25.00 will buy you a half hour mini-coaching session. 

$50.00 will buy you an hour session (valued at $75.00). 

$100.00 will buy you two hour-long sessions (valued at $150.00).

My goal is $5000 and for every thousand earned I will offer my services to battered women. 


About

What is an Upward Spiral? 

In life we all know about the downward spiral. It starts with frustration/anxiety (I'm screwed) then declines into anger (Screw You) then descends in resignation (Screw it).  I take people from wherever they are in that spiral and work with them to breakthrough to the other side to experience things like joy and aliveness. 

What are my clients saying?

"I first met Alyssa in 2009 when we were both involved in a leadership program. The one thing that has always stood out for me about Alyssa is her ability to cut through the BS (with humor and sarcasm, of course) and get to the heart of what's really important, what matters. Have you ever been in your car and you know something smells off but because it's your car you kind of can't smell it any more, but you know there's something off that needs to get cleaned out, but can't find it because you're so used to the smell? Well that was my life. And I needed help finding that smell. So I hired Alyssa to help me sniff out and clean out the BS to make room for the things I really want. Since hiring Alyssa, all the clutter and BS is being cleared away and space is opening up for me to begin to start new projects (living where I live) and pick up forgotten dreams (more theatre please!). I can always count on Alyssa to bring her unique sense of humor, sarcasm and compassion to whatever is happening in my life. No topic is off limits. I would highly recommend Alyssa to anyone looking for a stand out coach."  Jerah Y

"Alyssa is an expert coach, highly effective in getting her clients to produce the results they are committed to. She is direct, to the point, pulls no punches, and knows exactly what needs to be done. "  Alexandra L. 

Risks & Challenges

Allowing for assistance and contribution is uncomfortable for me; yet, I must be willing to do things I ask of my clients.   If this campaign is sluggish I will want to pitch a tent in the campground of resignation.  I can promise I have tools, and a team. that will prevent that from happening. 


Other Ways You Can Help

Maybe you cannot make a monetary contribution but there are other ways you can support me .  

You can share about my business.  I am available for phone consultations. 

You can share this campaign.

After months of working 30-40 hours a week as a server while writing and building my business, my goal is to earn a living, a decent one, soley through writing and coaching by January, 2016.   



What We Need & What You Get


I need to cover the costs associated with starting a business including training, legal and insurance.  I am so thankful to be able to have a life-altering conversation with you.  
$25.00 will buy you a half hour mini-coaching session. 
$50.00 will buy you an hour session (valued at $75.00). 
$100.00 will buy you two hour-long sessions (valued at $150.00).
My goal is $5000 and for every thousand earned I will offer my services to battered women. 


About
What is an Upward Spiral? 
In life we all know about the downward spiral. It starts with frustration/anxiety (I'm screwed) then declines into anger (Screw You) then descends in resignation (Screw it).  I take people from wherever they are in that spiral and work with them to breakthrough to the other side to experience things like joy and aliveness. 
What are my clients saying?
 "I first met Alyssa in 2009 when we were both involved in a leadership program. The one thing that has always stood out for me about Alyssa is her ability to cut through the BS (with humor and sarcasm, of course) and get to the heart of what's really important, what matters. Have you ever been in your car and you know something smells off but because it's your car you kind of can't smell it any more, but you know there's something off that needs to get cleaned out, but can't find it because you're so used to the smell? Well that was my life. And I needed help finding that smell. So I hired Alyssa to help me sniff out and clean out the BS to make room for the things I really want. Since hiring Alyssa, all the clutter and BS is being cleared away and space is opening up for me to begin to start new projects (living where I live) and pick up forgotten dreams (more theatre please!). I can always count on Alyssa to bring her unique sense of humor, sarcasm and compassion to whatever is happening in my life. No topic is off limits. I would highly recommend Alyssa to anyone looking for a stand out coach."  Jerah Y
"Alyssa is an expert coach, highly effective in getting her clients to produce the results they are committed to. She is direct, to the point, pulls no punches, and knows exactly what needs to be done. "  Alexandra L. 
Risks & Challenges
 Allowing for assistance and contribution is uncomfortable for me; yet, I must be willing to do things I ask of my clients.   If this campaign is sluggish I will want to pitch a tent in the campground of resignation.  I can promise I have tools, and a team. that will prevent that from happening. 
    
Other Ways You Can Help Maybe you cannot make a monetary contribution but there are other ways you can support me .  
You can share about my business.  I am available for phone consultations. 
You can share this campaign.

story:
Someone once said, "If you do what you love, you never work a day in your life." I feel this is very true for my life. To me it is not so simple to call me a hair stylist; often times I feel more like a sculptor when I'm using my shears, or a painter with my brushes. Tailoring each piece of art to an individual's cowlick, or creating his or her perfect shade of caramel. 
With so many people choosing to live a healthier, greener life I am happy to be able to offer natural hair services with beautiful results. No longer compromising health for beauty!
I, along with my partner Sarah Neckyfarow, am excited to bring these services to Boone, North Carolina, a forward thinking community that is yearning for a healthier way to be beautiful.

We are launching this campaign because we need a little boost in order to bring our organic services to Boone.  We are planning on expanding this salon to greater heights than ever before.  This means we will have more stylists, more seminars and learning programs, and the best quality organic, fair trade, non-GMO products on the market. 

                                            

The funds we will raise will go towards salon equipment, the cost of renting a building and a start up supply of organic hair color and products, and we plan to open in December 2015!  

We will be offering many different perks during the course of this campaign, including free services, unlimited discounts, and tickets to our classes and events, so be sure to check back in often.We will also be keeping you updated on our progress.

All the proceeds from this campaign will be paid forward to the Western Youth Network (http://www.westernyouthnetwork.org/)  over a period of 5 years, regardless of whether we meet our goal or not. So when you donate, you will be contributing to two great causes instead of just one!

So, Boone and the surrounding area: spread the word!  Even if you can't donate, the best contribution you can make is telling a friend, or sharing this to your Facebook page.

We look forward to seeing you all at our Grand Opening!!

story:
Thank you for your support! We are continuing to raise funds for this important campaign at Anywaa Survival Organisation. Please click here to contribute.

Three Ethiopians are facing trial after trying to attend a workshop on food security in Kenya. The move is part of the Ethiopian government's effort to silence critical voices using a draconian counterterrorism law. 

Indigenous and rural people in Ethiopia are one of the main targets in the current global farmland grab. Around one million hectares (roughly 2.5 million acres) have already been leased to investors, primarily in the fertile Southwestern province of Gambela, home of the Anuak indigenous people.

While supporting organizations have raised funds to cover the detainees' legal fees, additional funds are urgently needed to support their families while international human rights groups work to secure their release. 

CLICK HERE TO DONATE

The families of Omot, Ashinie, and Jamal are struggling to get by and provide food for their children after the loss of their primary income-earners. At this time, further details about the families' living conditions cannot be made public since they fear they will also be arrested or face other reprisals. More details will be available on this page if and when the families' safety can be assured.

BACKGROUND:

On September 7, 2015, the authorities charged Pastor Omot Agwa, Ashinie Astin, and Jamal Oumar Hojele under the counterterrorism law after detaining them for nearly six months without charge. The charge sheet refers to a food security workshop held in March 2015, which was organized by Anywaa Survival Organisation (ASO) with support from the international organizations Bread for All and GRAIN. 

The objective of the workshop was to exchange “experience and information among different indigenous communities from Ethiopia and experts from international groups around food security challenges.” Participants from Ethiopia were selected by ASO based on their experience in supporting local communities to ensure their food security and access to land. “Trying to give indigenous people a voice about their most precious resources – their land and their food – is not terrorism, it’s a critical part of any sustainable development strategy,” says Nyikaw Ochalla, Executive Director of ASO.

CLICK HERE TO DONATE

All three detainees were recently moved to Kalinto prison, on the outskirts of the Ethiopian capital, Addis Ababa, after spending more than five months at Maekelawi police station. Human Rights Watch and other organizations have documented torture and other ill-treatment at Maekelawi. “These three men are the latest victims of the Ethiopian government’s crackdown on independent activists,” said Leslie Lefkow, deputy Africa director at Human Rights Watch. “The arrests, lengthy detentions, and spurious terrorism charges bear all the hallmarks of Ethiopia’s effort to silence critical voices.”

ABOUT THE DETAINEES:

Omot Agwa Okwoy is a pastor at the evangelical Mekane Yesus church in Ethiopia’s Gambella region. Pastor Omot was also an interpreter for the World Bank Inspection Panel during its 2014 investigation of a complaint by Anuak indigenous people alleging widespread forced displacement and other serious human rights violations related to a World Bank project in Gambela. Before being arrested, Omot was filmed as part of a forthcoming documentary film about land grabbing in Ethiopia ("Dead Donkeys Fear No Hyenas" WG Films, 2016) in which he discusses his fear of being detained and tortured because of his activism to protect indigenous rights. See a clip from the film in the video above or by clicking here. 

Jamal Oumar Hojele works for the Assosa Environmental Protection Association in support of environmental conservation in the Benishangul-Gumuz region. Jamal is accused of being a participant of a “terrorist group” and of organizing recruits to attend the Nairobi workshop. 

Ashinie Astin is a member of Majangier, an ethnic indigenous minority from the Gambela region. Ashinie is accused of participating in terrorist activities, including preparing a research document entitled “Deforestation, dispossession and displacement of Gambella in general and Majang people in particular.”

CLICK HERE TO DONATE

The campaign for the release of the Ethiopian activists is supported by Anywaa Survival Organization, Human Rights Watch, Bread for All, GRAIN, Oakland Institute, and Inclusive Development International.

Please contact Nyikaw with any questions at ethiopia.landrights@gmail.com

Please help support Omot, Ashinie, Jamal, and their families as human rights organizations work to pressure for their release.

You can follow the campaign on Twitter at @AnywaaSurvival #FreeOmot

story:
For about 17 years I have been a working Chef; hustling to satisfy my unwavering passion.  Over the years I have worked with some of the industry's finest talent, created beautiful memories, happened upon a ton of culinary and scientific knowledge and served as the personal chef to extremely wonderful clients! I have always been a sharer, sharing my experience and the knowledge bestowed upon me to hungry learners. It is time to give a home to that experience.

Studio B is that home; a start-up venture as a "brick & mortar" business. Studio B is where my passion for culinary, the answer to Trenton's limited options for delicious (and consistent) hand baked goods, and a team vision of a great meetup spot join hands. Our menu offers daily old fashioned baked breads and treats, specialty items tailor-made for gluten-free and vegan patrons, light fare with a Louisiana flare and a hint of New Jersey coolness, and beverages for the discerning tastebuds. At Studio B I can share a taste of everything I offer with everyone. At Studio B you are, without a doubt, a guest at my dinner table everyday.

There's much 'a brewing' in Studio B. We have our eyes set on a vacant building in Trenton, NJ. Trenton is welcoming small businesses with open arms and the building is in a NICE location. Lots of foot traffic, a common route home for commuters, and located directly across the street from the Sun Center (Trenton's "convention" center). It will be seen by many people and definitely become an everyday eatery for many!



The plan is for this lovely building to be converted into a venue of culinary mastery. The main floor will house the Bakery, Bistro & Bar. Patrons will be able to walk in and order breakfast, lunch, and/or whatever baked good tickles their fancy for the moment. There will be seating for 20-30 patrons, free Wi-Fi, coffee, a stage for music, local art on the walls, and a Tea Bar for those that want to indulge in my obsession with tea. 



The Bakery...a.k.a. "the Studio" will be dedicated to baking and sharing. Chefs from around the globe will share their talents and experience with hungry learners in our in-bakery classroom. And in the same place ALL of the bread and desserts will be created and baked IN HOUSE. The Studio is ultimately our "creation station". Would you expect anything else from THIS bakery?? Buttery croissants, crispy po-boy loaves, warm cookies...What! Consultations for celebratory cakes and orders will take place right outside the Studio walls. The smells it will create will make anyone wanna grab a cup of joe or tea and relax for a while.

The Lagniappe (or the 'lil something extra) is that each of the floors' exhausts will be routed to vent through the building making the statement that Studio B is open! Fresh bread and delicious cakes baking...WOW...Its' free sensory marketing!


Over the years, friends and family have lovingly supported us to the degree they are able. However, as we are a small enterprise without investors, we are now extending to the community for support. This is a two step funding project.

Step 1: Our first goal for funding is $25,000 to cover procurement of the building and to start renovations. We look to you for as much support as we can gather. Additionally, we will use this funding to host tastings to raise awareness of our venue and our mission; Educating consumers about what it's like to Smile, Eat, & Live. Studio B is all about that life! Experiential marketing to the local community and surrounding area is a crucial process for Studio B, and for the health of our business overall!

In addition to the building and renovation costs, here is a list of some of the business expenses we are going to tackle:

  • Purchasing ovens,

  • Kitchen rental time (for recipe testing) & food costs,

  • Food handling license, 

  • Insurance & a business licenses,

  • Uniforms (Shirts, Aprons, Chef Coats and Hats),

  • Marketing material (business cards, menus, flyers, website hosting).


Step 2: Raise the remaining $55,000...Whew! We know that's a lot of pocket change but we are committed and in this to win this. We are not picky and very appreciative so we will definitely take what we can get but we're putting it out there...juuuust in case. We will update later with specifics on how the money is being allocated; but know it is going towards finishing this project and getting Studio B OPEN!

Baked goods baked well are a rare delicacy. We want food to provide the sense of nostalgia. It should get the recognition it deserves and reach as many mouths as possible, one bite at a time!  We understand some people just can't contribute financially, but we still need your help:

  • Please share this with your friends! Crowdfunding Campaigns have a 90% chance of FAILURE. That means out of our core 100 FB friends, only 10 will actually donate. If all 100 friends shared with their 100 friends (or even 50), we can reach between 5,000 and 10,000 people. Just by sharing the news you have effectively increased our chances of reaching our goal.

  • Your donation will help bring the dream of a "brick & mortar" Bakery to fruition! Every donation, big or small, will help us get one step closer to fulfilling our ultimate goal--launching our business and helping people live through food.

  • Cooking great food is meant to be shared and eaten. Whether it's raising money or sitting down and reconnecting over a hot meal, we need people to join us.

  • Share via Facebook, Twitter, LinkedIn, EMAIL! Contact us directly if you have any questions. We will be happy to address any early concerns.


                                                         What You'll get: 

All of our Perks are tailored for each level of contribution and each is named for a crucial tool or person within the kitchen (at least in our kitchen). Check 'em out to the right, and for those new to the kitchen, here's some explanations/definitions of the tools used to describe our contribution levels...Welcome!


Let's talk about that big 'ole elephant in the room...Restaurants are the riskiest businesses to start. High overhead, fluctuating food cost, labor, and changing trends. Bakeries, however, are steadily climbing and succeeding - especially those catering to the special dietary needs of this day and age. 

We minimize our risks and challenges by:

  • Having a spectacular team in place that have experience and knowledge about the journey we are embarking upon. We also have a wealth of consultants ready to give advice if we need (or don't need...) it. 

  • Keeping ourselves honest. Our team holds each other accountable for our actions and we discuss matters together before deciding.

  • Necessity first, desires only if we can. Debt is the number one reason most small businesses fail. We are committed to making sound decisions and sticking to a modest budget to ensure success.

  • Steadily building a solid following. We need you! If you share we increase our chances of success.







Above all, Thank you to everyone for all your support. We can not do this without your help. No matter if you donate or mention us to a friend please stay tuned to what's happening with Studio B - We appreciate You!

'Till Dinner,

Studio B Team

story:
Help preserve

                  VOUDUN

We are seeking funding to build a Vodoun Castle center where we will help preserve West African traditions that have been around for centuries. Vodoun is an empowering and universal spiritual tradition that faces constant challenges to survival, including popular misconceptions and damaging stereotypes such as  zombies that flourish due to lack of factual information. 

Your donation will go directly toward the creation of our center. As a token of our gratitude, you’ll receive a documentary about Afa, the Oracle of Destiny. Larger donors will also receive a documentary that delves into the story of the Mami Wata cult of the mermaids. We are of course deeply grateful for any level of support you are able to offer for this important project.

This is Legba messenger and gate keeper of all the spiritual realms. Help us to keep these ancient traditions preserved. 



                                   Mami Wata 


  The Mami Wata deities, commonly referred to as mermaids, are another frequently misunderstood aspect of Voudon. Even though priests have been communicating with the Mami Wata for centuries and they constantly interact with and possess followers even in the present day, a lot of people still picture Disney mermaids.

 A project like this is important to educate, help, preserve. African traditions not just for Ghana but for all.

   Vodoun charm for luck one of our lucky perks !


Afa "Ifa" "Fa"
Afa, also known as Ifa or Fa, is a sacred divination system that can reveal a person’s destiny, even how a child’s life will unfold all the way through adulthood. Afa is widely practiced in Ghana, Togo, Benin, Nigeria, Cuba, and Brazil and is spreading across the globe. By supporting our Afa project, you will allow us to conduct studies and produce educational documentaries following the spiritual experiences of initiates. Our first study will be an extensive comparison of Cuban Ifa and West African (Bokonon) Afa.

                                 

   



BOKONON LEO

My name is Leo. I'm a Bokonon Priest in West African Vodoun. Vodoun is practiced by the Ewe, Fonn and the Mina tribes of West Africa, from Benin to Togo and Ghana. According to the Ewe, this is diverse ancient tradition with its many cults and complex structure is rooted in beginnings of the universe. The practice of Vodoun is highly spiritual, calling on practitioners to communicate with ancient deities on a daily basis.



I want you to join me and my group as we help preserve these incredible traditions. It will be a struggle to ensure that the history, knowledge, and wisdom passed on to us from ancient times isn’t drowned out by the waves of newer faiths brought by missionaries. Whether you would like to join our organization or make a donation for our center, or even just spread the word so that more will know about our projects, I would like to thank you on behalf of all of us. One day, with your help, people around the world will be able to visit the Vodoun Castle and experience the wonders of Vodoun.

  


We thank all who can contribute and those who can't but want to we ask those too also pass the word around about our project so maybe one day many can visit the VODOUN CASTLE  and experience the wonders of Vodoun.
story_txt:
Help preserve
                  VOUDUN
We are seeking funding to build a Vodoun Castle center where we will help preserve West African traditions that have been around for centuries. Vodoun is an empowering and universal spiritual tradition that faces constant challenges to survival, including popular misconceptions and damaging stereotypes such as  zombies that flourish due to lack of factual information.  

Your donation will go directly toward the creation of our center. As a token of our gratitude, you’ll receive a documentary about Afa, the Oracle of Destiny. Larger donors will also receive a documentary that delves into the story of the Mami Wata cult of the mermaids. We are of course deeply grateful for any level of support you are able to offer for this important project.


This is Legba messenger and gate keeper of all the spiritual realms. Help us to keep these ancient traditions preserved. 



                                      Mami Wata 
   The Mami Wata deities, commonly referred to as mermaids, are another frequently misunderstood aspect of Voudon. Even though priests have been communicating with the Mami Wata for centuries and they constantly interact with and possess followers even in the present day, a lot of people still picture Disney mermaids. 





 A project like this is important to educate, help, preserve. African traditions not just for Ghana but for all.


   Vodoun charm for luck one of our lucky perks ! 





Afa "Ifa" "Fa"
Afa, also known as Ifa or Fa, is a sacred divination system that can reveal a person’s destiny, even how a child’s life will unfold all the way through adulthood. Afa is widely practiced in Ghana, Togo, Benin, Nigeria, Cuba, and Brazil and is spreading across the globe. By supporting our Afa project, you will allow us to conduct studies and produce educational documentaries following the spiritual experiences of initiates. Our first study will be an extensive comparison of Cuban Ifa and West African (Bokonon) Afa. 
                                    

   






BOKONON LEO
My name is Leo. I'm a Bokonon Priest in West African Vodoun. Vodoun is practiced by the Ewe, Fonn and the Mina tribes of West Africa, from Benin to Togo and Ghana. According to the Ewe, this is diverse ancient tradition with its many cults and complex structure is rooted in beginnings of the universe. The practice of Vodoun is highly spiritual, calling on practitioners to communicate with ancient deities on a daily basis.







I want you to join me and my group as we help preserve these incredible traditions. It will be a struggle to ensure that the history, knowledge, and wisdom passed on to us from ancient times isn’t drowned out by the waves of newer faiths brought by missionaries. Whether you would like to join our organization or make a donation for our center, or even just spread the word so that more will know about our projects, I would like to thank you on behalf of all of us. One day, with your help, people around the world will be able to visit the Vodoun Castle and experience the wonders of Vodoun.   


We thank all who can contribute and those who can't but want to we ask those too also pass the word around about our project so maybe one day many can visit the VODOUN CASTLE  and experience the wonders of Vodoun.

story:
Short Summary

  • Mildred's Confections is an online bakery that features "Homemade Treats Without the Hassle."
  • Our first product was Coconut Ladies. My grandmother, Mildred,  taught me how to make them when I was a little girl. As customers asked, we added more products including:
  1.  Ghirardelli White Chocolate Walnut cookies, 
  2. Ghirardelli Chocolate Chunk cookies, 
  3. Brownies with salted walnuts and crushed Ghirardelli chocolate, 
  4. Lemon Brownies,  
  5. & Nutella oatmeal raisin cookies. 

  • We have the opportunity to expand into restaurants and cafes, but need to update our business structure and required licenses with the state of Washington before we can do so. 

What We Need & What You Get

To enter into wholesale restaurant and cafe markets, we need to get additional licensing from the Washington State Department of Agriculture.  Also, we will have to expand our kitchen capacity.  

Here is the budget breakdown:  

    

  • $230 Washington State Department of Agriculture (food processors license)
  • $200 Washington Secretary of State (change business structure)
  • $45 Commercial Size Baking Sheets (4 from Amazon)
  • $350 Quality Commercial Mixer 
  • $ 2300 Commercial Kitchen Deposit ($500) & 3 months Rental Fee ($600 per month)
  • $225 Crowdfunding Fees (up to 9% of monies collected).
  • If we get more money than we need, we will look to paying up more kitchen rental and bringing on an assistant making a living wage. 
In exchange, you will have the option of the following: 
  • Mucho thanks and mentions via our social media platforms.
  • Mildred's Manifesto - words of wisdom that we live and cook by. 
  • A dozen Ghirardelli Chocolate Chunk Cookies
  • Mildred's Confections Mystery Box- a mixed box of 24 treats for your eating or sharing pleasure. 

Photo: Coconut Ladies by Darnita L Howard

The Impact

Your support will allow us to be more time efficient, reduce our overhead costs, all while reaching a wider audience of Mildred's Confections fans and fans to be. You will help a home based baker move into the big leagues.  We will up our credibility with additional licenses that allow us to sell more products. 

 Mildred's Confections relieves the stress of homemade baking by providing  "Homemade Treats Without the Hassle." 

  • You will help eliminate nasty freezer burned or stale desserts from your potluck or next event.  
  • You will help eliminate fights over who is going to clean the messy-baked-in kitchen. 
  • You will help relieve the anxiety of many people who are expected to bake at a moments notice, but have no time or care to do so.  
  • You will reduce the number of runs to the grocery store because who just has vanilla, butter, sugar, flour, salt, baking powder, and brown sugar - on hand? 
  • You will eliminate the need for people to have contraptions - stand mixers with dough hooks, paddle attachments, and whisks.  What happened to just having the basic mixer?
  • AND you will reduce the stress of every person who is trying to put a dessert on the table but looks like this

By DebSpoons -FreeDigitalPhotos.Net
We're here to support these people.  I have made magical delights with 3 cookie sheets, my home oven,  and a bistro table.  We could do so much more.  Moving into restaurants and cafes was always the dream; we just never thought the opportunity would arise so quickly.  You are making a dream come true. 

Risks & Challenges

We could fail. We could get our food into the restaurants and people decline the offer to buy. The food business is a risky bet. Some people's taste buds are more precise than others.  That's why I moved from tasters to trusting my own opinion. If I like the product it goes to my test market. If I don't, and I can't stand behind it...there's no need to offer it.  

We could underprice ourselves out of the market.  However, I have taken classes and gained business mentors to support this endeavor.  We've diversified our offerings so we are not solely relying on Coconut Ladies. We create and test one new product every week.  We are currently testing gluten free options as well as traditional flavors.  Some make it to the Instagram page and others make it to the garbage. 

Our kitchen vendor could close or lose its health department certificate.  There are a plethora of other kitchens in the area that I have contacted.  I chose this one because of the cost, proximity, and additional perks (space to meet with clients, gluten free facility, etc.). Additionally, I have a food worker card through the WA State Department of Public Health.  I taught Nutrition and Wellness in Seattle Public Schools where I was responsible for training students and using a commercial kitchen safely.  I have also attended workshops on food allergies and cross-contamination.   

As a teacher, I encourage my students to never give up, to try their best, and to play with a problem until a solution presents itself.  If there is a problem, I have mentors and resources to gain the answers. 

On the flip side, we could SUCCEED beyond our WILDEST DREAMS! You could be a part of  our success story.  


Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute monetarily, feel free to assist in other ways:

  • Spread the word to your network.  
  • Follow and like us on our Social Networks:  
  • Instagram: www.instagram.com/mildredsconfections 
  • Facebook: www.facebook.com/mildredsconfections
  • Website: www.mildredsconfections.com  
  • Brighten someone else's day.  Send them a dozen cookies from our shop. 
  • Have Amazon Gift Cards? The baking sheets are affordably priced there.  
  • Know someone with a commercial kitchen to share? Hourly rates are ideal versus a monthly rent. Early morning hours are okay.

story:
What is Hub Etzion?

Hub Etzion is the first coworking space in Gush Etzion. The magic of coworking spaces are that they aren’t just a place to go to work. Coworking spaces are a community of small business owners, entrepreneurs, and freelancers who collaborate, inspire, and network. People who would normally work from home or pay costly rent for an office can now work in Hub Etzion.

But it’s more than just a workspace. Hub Etzion is creating a thriving business ecosystem complete with flexible seating options, conference and event space, networking opportunities, experienced mentors, special events and programs.

We are raising the bar for our local community. We are creating an exciting, viable, dynamic center for business and innovation that will become the “go to” place for professionals that live here and for investors who want to profit from the extraordinary talent and excellence in our corner of “Start-up Nation.”


Where is Hub Etzion?

Located in the Judean Hills just south of Jerusalem and Bethlehem and north of Hebron, Gush Etzion is rich with history, industry, and community. From the time of the Patriarchs, this area has served as a route to Jerusalem which contributed to the commercial and religious significance of the area. It has served many times as a crucial strategic position in defense of the Holy City. In the war for Israel’s Independence, the Jewish communities of Gush Etzion fought valiantly in that mission, but ultimately perished. The dedicated children who had been evacuated from their homes were determined to return, rebuild, and flourish. Today, Gush Etzion is growing, filled once again with families and a population that is idealistic, hard-working and has a desire to see the region, and the Modern State of Israel, prosper.

Hub Etzion is located in an attractive, state-of-the-art, professional building in the up-and-coming Gush Etzion Industrial Park. The Industrial Park, open since 1998, is currently home to numerous businesses, with an expectation of at least doubling in size over the next two years.

The 350 square meters of Hub Etzion has seating for 60, including 2 large offices, 3-4 smaller offices, phone booths, a conference room, a kitchen, and an informal loft ideal for brainstorming and creativity. Members of the Hub Etzion community have access to the building's spacious event space with full catering kitchen, a room for resting (with a nursing chair and portacrib) and a full gym.

We have a vision of a vibrant, inspiring space. You know how you need to be really comfortable to focus and be productive? Now imagine a place that has a variety of options to help you find your creative groove. A place where the energy of the people working around you makes you motivated to grow, excel, and succeed. A place that encourages interaction and collaboration, where the enthusiasm for helping one another is infectious. Imagine a meeting room that sparks conversation and ignites innovation. With your help THIS will be Hub Etzion.

This campaign will make our vision the reality. The funds raised will be used to complete and furnish our space. You can build Hub Etzion.


Why Build Hub Etzion?

Gush Etzion is filled with independent workers, consultants, and telecommuters, some of whom work US hours. The lack of professional, suitable office space in Gush Etzion has meant until now that most work from home, coffee shops, or empty apartments that are isolating. Hub Etzion offers a place to work that isn’t a living room. It is a professional place to meet with clients and an environment that increases focus and productivity while creating organic opportunities for networking and collaboration. Hub Etzion empowers local business owners to thrive and grow through such networking, collaboration, professional services offered on site and by the sheer empowerment of the new, shared economy.

By harnessing the potential of the people of Gush Etzion, creating, developing, and retaining businesses and startups, we can make Gush Etzion an essential part of Israel’s landscape.

“I’m actually experiencing [first hand] the “shared economy”. I’m being exposed to people who are self-starters, who think big and do big things. Being brought into the conversation of start up people has already made me want to do bigger, think bigger and share.”- Avital, Early Adopter, Independent Language Specialist


When is Hub Etzion Opening?


How Can You Help Hub Etzion?

We have secured a bank loan and some private investment to begin renovations and make Hub Etzion a reality. We still need $50,000 to finish and furnish it so it can be the place where people and businesses flourish. The more we raise, the more amazing Hub Etzion can be.

Not everyone is prepared or able to be a large sum investor. You can still make a difference. By giving what you can to this project, you are investing - in us, in the people of Gush Etzion, in the growth of businesses in Israel.

(If you want to be a large sum investor, contact us! We would love to tell you more.)


Who is Hub Etzion?

Amy Shuter & Rachel Moore

As the founders of Hub Etzion we are dedicated to the people, communities, and businesses of Gush Etzion. We personally know how community can change your life. In fact, we met in the online community of bloggers before we became neighbors, friends, and business partners.


Rachel Moore

Director of PR/Marketing, HubEtzion

Owner, Moore International Connections PR & Communications

Rachel has been a Communications professional working in Israel and the United States for 20 years, With a majority of her experience in the public and non-profit sectors, she has been a part of establishing other community-growth related enterprises. She is a former speaker for CAMERA, a founding board member of the Netivot Montessori School, a member of the fundraising committee for the Women’s Beit Midrash of Efrat, and on the PR and Development Committee for Raise Your Spirits Theater Company. She brings that experience and passion for helping others to Hub Etzion. Rachel has eight children, which has often felt like the creation of a not-so-small business of a very different sort.

“I fervently believe that the Jewish response to the BDS movement is “investment, not divestment.” The economic improvement and prosperity of this region will benefit all residents and change the geopolitical dynamics for the better. For everyone living here. “

Amy Shuter

COO, Hub Etzion

Amy has a Master’s Degree in Library and Information Science. She spent many years developing, restructuring, and managing libraries. Amy served as the Chief Administrative Officer of the Jewish Children's Museum where she built the organizational infrastructure as the Museum expanded from its infancy. She brings to Hub Etzion her talent for multitasking and long range planning, her management experience, research capabilities and attention to detail. As a widow and mother of triplets, she has learned not only the strength of survival, but has been “kicking the ‘stuff’ out of plan B”. She feels a tremendous personal debt to the community of Gush Etzion for helping her build her family back up after the loss of her husband. It is this sense of indebtedness that fuels her tireless efforts to give back.

“Living in Gush Etzion during the hardest time of my life taught me about resilience, strength and how the community can benefit the individual. Hub Etzion is the chance for me to take my professional experience and my personal experience and give back. I believe in the people of Gush Etzion. They are creative, collaborative and hard-working. The potential for growth and prosperity is boundless. And they deserve it.”


Hub Etzion meeting with Davidi Perl, Mayor of Gush Etzion


Shuey Fogel

Advisory Board Member

Principal, Fogel CFO & Management Services Ltd.

Shuey is dedicated to small business and nonprofit financial advocacy. His passion for transparency and financial leadership drives him to identify unique, flexible solutions for his for-profit and nonprofit clientele. Currently, Shuey acts as an outsourced financial adviser, and delivers lectures and workshops on financial topics including incorporation challenges, implementing social change, cash flow management, credit options, and budgeting for long term stability.


Jo Friedman

Advisory Board Member

Product Consultant, thinkflame.

Jo is an innovative and experienced product design and development leader, who has pioneered product design and development on a wide range of emerging platforms since 1996. In senior product strategy and product management roles, she has designed and delivered products and services to platforms such as Internet TV, Broadband Internet, mobile devices, telematics-enabled vehicles and the public and private cloud. Currently Jo runs a consultancy helping early stage startups and more established companies to take their ideas and grow them into successful products.


Perks

$18 - Thanks!

Your name will appear in the Thank You section on the Hub Etzion Website.

$36 - Stuck on Hub Etzion

We will send you an eye-catching sticker so you can show your support and love for Hub Etzion community. We will also thank you on the website.

$72 - Shout it Out

Hub Etzion will send you (and your business if you want) a Social Media “Shout Out” telling everyone of your support. You will also get a sticker and a thank you on the website.

$180 - Off the Wall

More like ON the wall! For $180 we will put your name on our stand-out partner wall inside Hub Etzion. You will also get a “Shout Out”, a sticker, and a thank you on the website.

$360 - To a T

We will send you the official Hub Etzion Graphic T-shirt that proudly declares “Gush Etzion: Where Innovative Thinking is an Ancient Tradition”. You will also appear on our partner wall, get a “Shout Out”, a sticker, and a thank you on the website.

$360 - Give us a Try

You are invited to try Hub Etzion for 1 month! Experience the energy of this special community. You will also appear on our partner wall, get a “Shout Out”, a sticker, and a thank you on the website.

$720 - 2 to Try

Come join the amazing Hub Etzion community for 2 full months. To keep you even more inspired, we will send you a beautiful framed picture of Gush Etzion. You will also get a T-shirt, appear on our partner wall, get a “Shout Out”, a sticker, and a thank you on the website.

$1800 - 4 Sure

Come join the amazing Hub Etzion community for 4 full months. To keep you even more inspired, we will send you a beautiful framed picture of Gush Etzion. You will also get a T-shirt, appear on our partner wall, get a “Shout Out”, a sticker, and a thank you on the website.

$1800 - Open the Door

We will send you beautiful traditional stone Mezuzah cover to greet you everyday and remind you of the doors you are opening for the people of Gush Etzion. We will also send you a beautiful framed picture of Gush Etzion, a T-shirt, you will appear on our partner wall, get a “Shout Out”, a sticker, and a thank you on the website.

$5000 - Follow the Path

On your next trip to Israel, be our guest on a personalized tour of historic, breathtaking Gush Etzion. Walk the footsteps of the Patriarchs, learn about the pioneers of Gush Etzion and our special “lone tree”. You will get the Mezuzah cover, the picture, T-shirt, a spot on the partner wall, a “Shout Out”, a sticker, and a thank you on the website, too!

$5000 - Official Hubnik

Spend the whole year as a full member of Hub Etzion! Of course, you also get the Mezuzah cover, the picture, T-shirt, a spot on the partner wall, a “Shout Out”, a sticker, and a thank you on the website.

$10,000 - Build the Future

For this donation, we give you it all: A 1-year Hub Etzion membership, the tour of Gush Etzion, Mezuzah cover, framed picture, T-shirt, a spot on the partner wall, a “Shout Out”, a sticker, and a thank you on the website. We will also host you at Hub Etzion for a meet and greet with the Hub Etzion community. You will have the chance to speak to each member and hear about their special projects. Who knows? Maybe you will discover the next big innovation to come from the ‘Start Up Nation’!

For more information on Hub Etzion, contact info@hubetzion.com

Photos courtesy of Sharon Altshul of The Real Jerusalem Streets

the PR and Development Committee for Raise Your Spirits Theater
Company. She brings that experience and passion for helping others to
Hub Etzion. Rachel has eight children, which has often felt like the
creation of a not-so-small business of a very different sort.

    “I fervently believe that the
Jewish response to the BDS movement is “investment, not
divestment.” The economic improvement and prosperity of this region
will benefit all residents and change the geopolitical dynamics for
the better. For everyone living here. “

Amy Shuter
COO, Hub Etzion
Amy has a Master’s Degree in Library
and Information Science.  She spent many years developing,
restructuring, and managing libraries.  Amy served as the Chief
Administrative Officer of the Jewish Children's Museum where she
built the organizational infrastructure as the Museum expanded from
its infancy.  She brings to Hub Etzion her talent for multitasking
and long range planning, her management experience, research
capabilities and attention to detail.  As a widow and mother of
triplets, she has learned not only the strength of survival, but has
been “kicking the ‘stuff’ out of plan B”. She feels a
tremendous personal debt to the community of Gush Etzion for helping
her build her family back up after the loss of her husband. It is
this sense of indebtedness that fuels her tireless efforts to give
back. 



    “Living in Gush Etzion during the
hardest time of my life taught me about resilience, strength and how
the community can benefit the individual. Hub Etzion is the chance
for me to take my professional experience and my personal experience
and give back. I believe in the people of Gush Etzion. They are
creative, collaborative and hard-working. The potential for growth
and prosperity is boundless. And they deserve it.”


Hub Etzion meeting with Davidi Perl, Mayor of Gush Etzion

Shuey Fogel
Advisory Board Member
Principal, Fogel CFO & Management
Services Ltd.

Shuey is dedicated to small business
and nonprofit financial advocacy. His passion for transparency and
financial leadership drives him to identify unique, flexible
solutions for his for-profit and nonprofit clientele. Currently,
Shuey acts as an outsourced financial adviser, and delivers lectures
and workshops on financial topics including incorporation challenges,
implementing social change, cash flow management, credit options, and
budgeting for long term stability.


Jo Friedman
Advisory Board Member 

Product Consultant, thinkflame.

Jo is an innovative and experienced
product design and development leader, who has pioneered product
design and development on a wide range of emerging platforms since
1996. In senior product strategy and product management roles, she
has designed and delivered products and services to platforms such as
Internet TV, Broadband Internet, mobile devices, telematics-enabled
vehicles and the public and private cloud. Currently Jo runs a
consultancy helping early stage startups and more established
companies to take their ideas and grow them into successful products.

Perks
$18 - Thanks!

Your name will appear in the Thank You
section on the Hub Etzion Website.
$36 - Stuck on Hub Etzion

We will send you an eye-catching
sticker so you can show your support and love for Hub Etzion
community. We will also thank you on the website.
$72 - Shout it Out

Hub Etzion will send you (and your
business if you want) a Social Media “Shout Out” telling everyone
of your support.  You will also get a sticker and a thank you on the
website.
$180 - Off the Wall

More like ON the wall!  For $180 we
will put your name on our stand-out partner wall inside Hub Etzion. 
You will also get a “Shout Out”, a sticker, and a thank you on
the website.
$360 - To a T

We will send you the official Hub
Etzion Graphic T-shirt that proudly declares “Gush Etzion: Where
Innovative Thinking is an Ancient Tradition”.  You will also appear
on our partner wall, get a “Shout Out”, a sticker, and a thank
you on the website.
$360 - Give us a Try

You are invited to try Hub Etzion for 1
month!  Experience the energy of this special community.  You will
also appear on our partner wall, get a “Shout Out”, a sticker,
and a thank you on the website.
$720 - 2 to Try

Come join the amazing Hub Etzion
community for 2 full months.  To keep you even more inspired, we will
send you a beautiful framed picture of Gush Etzion. You will also get
a T-shirt, appear on our partner wall, get a “Shout Out”, a
sticker, and a thank you on the website.
$1800 - 4 Sure

Come join the amazing Hub Etzion
community for 4 full months.  To keep you even more inspired, we will
send you a beautiful framed picture of Gush Etzion. You will also get
a T-shirt, appear on our partner wall, get a “Shout Out”, a
sticker, and a thank you on the website.
$1800 - Open the Door

We will send you beautiful traditional
stone Mezuzah cover to greet you everyday and remind you of the doors
you are opening for the people of Gush Etzion.  We will also send you
a beautiful framed picture of Gush Etzion, a T-shirt, you will appear
on our partner wall, get a “Shout Out”, a sticker, and a thank
you on the website.
$5000 - Follow the Path

On your next trip to Israel, be our
guest on a personalized tour of historic, breathtaking Gush Etzion. 
Walk the footsteps of the Patriarchs, learn about the pioneers of
Gush Etzion and our special “lone tree”. You will get the Mezuzah
cover, the picture, T-shirt, a spot on the partner wall, a “Shout
Out”, a sticker, and a thank you on the website, too!
$5000 - Official Hubnik

Spend the whole year as a full member
of Hub Etzion!  Of course, you also get the Mezuzah cover, the
picture, T-shirt, a spot on the partner wall, a “Shout Out”, a
sticker, and a thank you on the website.
$10,000 - Build the Future

For this donation, we give you it all:
A 1-year Hub Etzion membership, the tour of Gush Etzion, Mezuzah
cover, framed picture, T-shirt, a spot on the partner wall, a “Shout
Out”, a sticker, and a thank you on the website. We will also host
you at Hub Etzion for a meet and greet with the Hub Etzion community.
 You will have the chance to speak to each member and hear about
their special projects.  Who knows? Maybe you will discover the next
big innovation to come from the ‘Start Up Nation’!For more information on Hub Etzion, contact info@hubetzion.com

Photos courtesy of Sharon Altshul of
The Real Jerusalem Streets

story:
Short Summary

Welcome to Dr Zigs, where we make and sell kits to create extraordinary, giant bubbles. Our bubbles have taken us to loads of places; from their mountain home in North Wales, to festivals, parties, carnivals, weddings, and many more special occasions across the UK, Europe and beyond. 

Ethical and environmental values underpin absolutely everything we do, from the sourcing of our materials to the recycling of our mix. We also have an ever-growing bubble community, and are able to provide over 30 local jobs as a result. We want to make people happy. By doing business responsibly, by sourcing sustainably and by bubbling continuously! But to keep doing good, our packaging needs to change. We need to raise £5,000 to design packaging that reflects these values, and helps us to cover the world in bubbles. 

The Story  

We first stumbled upon the magic of bubbles when my son Ziggy was a toddler - he would get fits of giggles whenever a bubble floated his way.  I’m not sure if we were more hooked on the bubbles or Ziggy’s laughter, but either way it led to more and ever bigger bubbles - my husband researched and experimented until we had a pretty awesome bubble mix.  We bottled one of those early batches up and took it down to the beach and ended up selling every bottle we had. 

And so Dr Zigs Extraordinary Bubbles was born. As my son grew up, so did the business. We went from the kitchen table of a small quarryman’s cottage in North Wales, to a garden shed, to a new building, to two new buildings, to the very new and wonderful headquarters where we are based today!

The driving force behind Dr Zigs is to do business in a way that is totally sustainable and ethically responsible. I started the business because I loved seeing the happiness that bubbles could bring, not only to my son, but to everyone.


These ethical and environmental values underpin everything we do. Our bubble mix is green in every sense of the word. With Bangor University, we’ve developed a bubble mix that is guaranteed phosphate-free. It even has less surfactant (goopy stuff) than a bottle of Ecover. We use 100% untreated cotton for our UK manufactured bubbling ropes. One day soon we hope to be using nothing but Fairtrade cotton.

We also care about our communities and economies.  Dr Zigs has an ever-growing bubble crew, now providing more than 30 jobs in North Wales. We love showing children that you can make a business out of anything (even bubbles!) and have had the opportunity to communicate this to thousands of kids and adults through the work that we do.  

We also run a project called Bubbles Not Bombs, where we send bubbles out to kids who need them round the world - kids who could just do with a few moments of play.  So far our bubbles have gone to Romania, Kenya, Uganda, Chernobyl, Delhi and even to a refugee camp in Libya.

Our motto here at Dr Zigs is simple – "Changing the World One Bubble at a Time"

  Dr Zigs isn’t just about bubbles. It’s about making a difference. 


What We Need 

Our current packaging is still pretty much what I created back at our kitchen table using MS Publisher and clip art.  It’s no longer fit for what is a really cool and wonderful product – and certainly no good for helping us to #sharethebubblelove.

We have a lot more people to make happy, but in order to be stocked in shops, and to be considered by distributors, we need packaging that is not only good for the environment, but also looks good too. We want to communicate the huge amount of excitement and goodness a little bottle of bubble mix can bring, so we can fill the world with bubbles, far beyond North Wales!

We need:

-  £5,000 – this will form the basis of the packaging budget, allowing us to redesign our packaging and make it more fun and ecologically friendly.  We’re currently seeking the advice of some top bubble packaging experts – our customers!  We’ve put a call out to children to come up with ideas for us, and hopefully some of these will get used in our new design.  We’ve budgeted £1500 for design work to translate our ideas into drawings, £500 for materials, £2500 for prototyping,  and £500 for print work. 

 What you get

Dr Zigs reward scheme works slightly differently – you can either choose to have a bubbly reward yourself, or you can choose to cash in your Bubble Karma and send that reward into your local community.

You can earn the chance to get your hands on some exclusive, customisable rewards – in the form of customisable bubble mix, exclusive brand new products and a free test of our brand new app. 

-  Bubble Karma: You’re helping out a small business to reach new dizzying heights.

-  The chance to help your local community, by bringing bubble kits to local schools, care homes and hospitals.

-  Tangible rewards for you, or for others.

-  Most of all, you will become part of this amazing story, of a little business from North Wales as it sets out to change the world with bubbles! 

The Impact 

Along with the chance to become part of this exciting Dr Zigs story, we also have an exclusive range of perks available. For the first time ever we are offering colour customisable bubble mix, and the opportunity to try a brand new product & app. Most importantly, you can enjoy these rewards yourself, or send them to an organisation or community of your choice - an easy way to share the bubble love! Check out the sidebar to find out what treats are on offer.  

Risks & Challenges 

-  If we do not meet the £5000 target, we will still direct all of the money raised into redeveloping the packaging, and try to top it up with capital generated by the business.

-  If we raise more than £5000 we will direct any money not needed for packaging to providing free bubble kits for charitable organisations across the UK and into our Bubbles Not Bombs project, to continue sharing bubbles with the world! 

Other Ways to Help 

Even if you can’t contribute financially, there are many other ways in which you can cash in  your Bubble Karma:

-  LIKE – Like us on Facebook

-  SHARE - Share our campaign either by text, social media, e-mail, or just talking to your friends and family.

-  MAKE BUBBLES  – Bubble your way into Bubble Karma.

story:
Save Sturt Farm Community Fund Campaign

Sturt Farm in Haslemere, Surrey dates back to the 12th century and holds a place in the hearts of many members of the local community. The farm has been enjoyed by many generations and is still much-loved today. 

Waverley Council have granted outline approval for 135 houses on the farm, which would see  this part of the Surrey Hills AONB destroyed forever. As well as being "the green lungs" of the town, there are many other important reasons why this area should be protected at all costs..........

Sturt Farm is a designated Area of Outstanding Natural Beauty (AONB) and is an Area of Great Landscape Value (AGLV). It is also included within the Surrey Hills AONB policy.

The farm is sited on an aquifer which provides a source of drinking water for Haslemere. For this reason, the area is in a ground water protection zone.

The bottom of the site at Sturt avenue is a within a flood zone

Local infrastructure ie schools and doctors surgery  are full.

Sturt Farm provides a safe haven for wildlife, both fauna and flora with many protected species.

A previous application to develop on this land has been turned down by the Secretary of State for the Environment. 

If full approval goes ahead within the assigned 3 years then this land will be lost forever hence the need for a judicial review of this application.

 The application  for review must be with the High Court office no later than SIX WEEKS from the date permission was issued and from when the Section 106 Agreement has been submitted.  The Court will then consider our case, for reasons of confidentiality those cannot be divulged on this site. 

What We Need & What You Get

  • We need £3000.00  to cover the cost of a Planning Barrister  to prepare and present our case.
  •  We need £800.00  to cover high court fees.
  •  In the event we lose we also need a further £5000 (capped)  to cover  the  councils legal costs.
  • We also need to cover this sites fees for running this campaign which will be included in our target. Please see pricing fee structure below from Indiegogo.com for credit card fees.
  • If we win we have no costs and we will donate the money  to local  Haslemere community groups such as the Haslemere Museum, Guides/Scouts Groups, Alzheimer's Charity and/or any other organisations already suggested via our social media Facebook page.
  • If we lose, contributions will go towards legal fees and high court costs. 
If everyone who objected to the development donated just £10 then we will have enough to go ahead, but time is short so please don't delay donate today.

If we reach our campaign goal Indiegogo.com will charge a 4% fee, this will be debited from your contribution and the above procedure will go ahead.

Third party fees
  • 3-5% for credit card or PayPal processing (varies depending on your financial institution)
  • $25 wire fee: Charged once when non-US campaigns have raised funds in USD via Direct Credit Card. The funds are wired in one lump sum to a non-US bank account after the campaign has ended. 
  • Additional currency exchange fees may also apply.

Your Impact

  • Save Sturt Farm from development protect this  designated AONB and support local charities.
  • Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about our campaign.
  • Remind them to use the Indiegogo share tools!

story:
Marva Louise Collins

That's me. As I mentioned before I am in the fourth quarter of my life and it is the best and I want to share that with others. My mission is threefold

  • Support women over 50 who are beginning new ventures.
  • Coach young women who are changing their lives to live their full potential.
  • Continue the dynamic work with mothers and adult daughters.

I do this work as a Life Coach, Workshop and Seminar Leader. 

Where the money goes


  • To get this venture to the next phase I need to hire a coach to help me with launches and technical issues, such as website, online pay systems and other things technical. I am asking for $8,000 to help accomplish these things. I have invested in getting the business started and continue to work a part time job to keep it going.
  • I have over 20 years counseling experience with translates easily into this coaching business.
  • I have a Bachelor's Degree in Liberal Arts/Psychology and a Master's Degree in Psychology.
  • My first goal is to get the computer system, that is where the money will go should I not reach the entire goal.

The Impact

The work I do with women 50+ is vital. Baby Boomer women are retiring, getting packages and some under employed. It is clear that retirement as we understand retirement will not happen for these women. In many cases the retirement check and Social Security is just not enough.

These women leave the work force with many skills that can be used to create their own businesses, but they don't know how to package it. That is where coaching comes in to get them from idea to start up for their businesses.

I will be the example for them to follow because I am doing it as well.

Risks & Challenges

My biggest challenge is creating campaign launches and creating the online presence that I need. That is where coaching comes in to assist me until my business is successful enough for me to hire someone to handle those duties

Other Ways You Can Help

  • Tell others about me and what I am doing
  • Remember to used the Indiegogo share tools!

story:
Shenandoah Hops has a mission to Celebrate Virginia Craft Brews, Beer/Wine/Cider On Tap and by the Bottle!

Shenandoah Hops has a goal to promote Virginia Craft Brews, Beer/Wine/Cider, On Tap and By the Bottle with the expansion of our  our new Virginia Craft Brews section in our Store! 

Shenandoah Hops was founded in 2010 by John and Cheryl Huggins, it was the first Bottle Shop in Staunton, Virginia. Our mission was to offer the best selection of Craft beers and Imports to this area. In 2013, we relocated to a larger building and expanded our inventory to include Beer, Wine and Cider. The industry has evolved into a race to pursue the biggest, the newest and the most unique brew. Our customers are using the hippest apps to track and search for these brews. We seek to order these highly sought after brews from across the US and abroad to stock our coolers and shelves. Hey, it is fun riding the newest rave!

However, in the heat of the race to order the newest brews from across the US and Imported brews for our shelves, we would like to step back to support our award winning Virginia Breweries, Cideries and Wineries.   

This brings us to our new adventure to create a Growler Fill Station and Bottle Section exclusively for Virginia Craft Brews!

How you can help

Your contribution will catapult your favorite Virginia Winery, Cidery and Brewery into the spotlight with media coverage of this campaign. We are proposing to add a 5 Tap Kegerator,  a standup cooler, and shelving for the exclusive use of Virginia beer, cider and wine. The new Taps and Shelves will be stocked with suggestions from you! As a High Level contributor, your Perk will include, naming your favorite Winery, Cidery or Brewery that will be featured for the celebratory "Tasting Takeover" at Shenandoah Hops. We will also buy you a free Tasting at your chosen winning brewer! Hey, Cheryl and I will go with you, if you would like and together we can pick the brews you want to feature!

Other Ways You Can Help

 

Contributing is not your preference at this time? Okay, you can still help! Share the Indiegogo campaign with your friends, family and everyone who would like to make a stand to Celebrate Virginia Craft Brews.  Follow the campaign, follow and share it and also on our Facebook Page and vote for your favorite Brewery, Cidery or Winery to be chosen. We can do this!


How to Choose  your Winery, Brewery, Cidery

Your favorite Winery, Brewery, or Cidery must  have distribution in our area in order for Shenandoah Hops to place an order. We can help you with that information!
story_txt:
Shenandoah Hops has a mission to Celebrate Virginia Craft Brews, Beer/Wine/Cider On Tap and by the Bottle!
 Shenandoah Hops has a goal to promote Virginia Craft Brews, Beer/Wine/Cider, On Tap and By the Bottle with the expansion of our  our new Virginia Craft Brews section in our Store! Shenandoah Hops was founded in 2010 by John and Cheryl Huggins, it was the first Bottle Shop in Staunton, Virginia. Our mission was to offer the best selection of Craft beers and Imports to this area. In 2013, we relocated to a larger building and expanded our inventory to include Beer, Wine and Cider. The industry has evolved into a race to pursue the biggest, the newest and the most unique brew. Our customers are using the hippest apps to track and search for these brews. We seek to order these highly sought after brews from across the US and abroad to stock our coolers and shelves. Hey, it is fun riding the newest rave!  However, in the heat of the race to order the newest brews from across the US and Imported brews for our shelves, we would like to step back to support our award winning Virginia Breweries, Cideries and Wineries.     This brings us to our new adventure to create a Growler Fill Station and Bottle Section exclusively for Virginia Craft Brews!How you can help   Your contribution will catapult your favorite Virginia Winery, Cidery and Brewery into the spotlight with media coverage of this campaign. We are proposing to add a 5 Tap Kegerator,  a standup cooler, and shelving for the exclusive use of Virginia beer, cider and wine. The new Taps and Shelves will be stocked with suggestions from you! As a High Level contributor, your Perk will include, naming your favorite Winery, Cidery or Brewery that will be featured for the celebratory "Tasting Takeover" at Shenandoah Hops. We will also buy you a free Tasting at your chosen winning brewer! Hey, Cheryl and I will go with you, if you would like and together we can pick the brews you want to feature!     Other Ways You Can Help Contributing is not your preference at this time? Okay, you can still help! Share the Indiegogo campaign with your friends, family and everyone who would like to make a stand to Celebrate Virginia Craft Brews.  Follow the campaign, follow and share it and also on our Facebook Page and vote for your favorite Brewery, Cidery or Winery to be chosen. We can do this!


How to Choose  your Winery, Brewery, Cidery
Your favorite Winery, Brewery, or Cidery must  have distribution in our area in order for Shenandoah Hops to place an order. We can help you with that information!

story:
Tribute to Fallen Soldiers NW is asking for your help to produce ( 16 ) 'Memorial Plaques of Distinguished Service' for families of fallen soldiers who are being honored during our upcoming Tribute to Fallen Soldiers Motorcycle Ride scheduled for May 16th & 17th in Dallas, Texas. ( Armed Forces Weekend )

What We Need & What You Get

During each 'Tribute to Fallen Soldiers Motorcycle Ride' we make scheduled 'Fallen Soldier Home Visits' to families of fallen soldiers.  During these home visits we present each family with a 'Memorial Plaque of Distinguished Service' in memory of their fallen hero.

Each Memorial Plaque is hand crafted ( 13 x 16 ) and gives family members left behind a beautiful keepsake that can be handed down through generations. 

Tribute to Fallen Soldiers NW is trying to raise $750 to go towards the cost of producing ( 16 ) fallen soldier memorial plaques being presented May 16th & 17th to Gold Star families during Armed Forces weekend.

Because Tribute to Fallen Soldiers NW is a volunteer organization dedicated to honoring and paying tribute to our fallen soldiers, we're not able to continue this mission without generous public support. 

For those who choose to support this endeavor, Tribute to Fallen Soldiers NW will graciously provide several perks including; 

* Personalized thank you cards - Exclusive social media messages - Tribute to Fallen Soldiers wristbands - Exclusive Tribute to Fallen Soldiers T-Shirts - Exclusive Tribute to Fallen Soldiers Challenge Coins and more.

Monies raised go directly to our exclusive Plaque-maker.

MISSION STATEMENT  

The 'Mission Statement' of Tribute to Fallen Soldiers is simple.   As grateful Americans, we visit the families of our fallen soldiers and present them with a 'Memorial Plaque of Distinguished Service' to acknowledge the service of these brave fallen heroes and to make sure those left behind know their fallen soldier will never be forgotten. 

In six years of volunteer service, Tribute to Fallen Soldiers NW has honored more than 125 families of fallen soldiers.  To continue this mission, we need the help and support of friends, veterans and businesses.

Risks & Challenges

Like most endeavors, there's always Risks & Challenges.   If we're not able to raise enough funds to pay for these 'Fallen Soldier Memorial Plaques', it's likely we'll be unable to deliver them to our honored families on-time for this years tribute ride event.  

Please help us make sure we can deliver these plaques on-time by May 16th & 17th. 

Other Ways You Can Help

There are many ways people can help.  Of course financially is the first option.  Please pass this endeavor along to your friends, family, civic organizations, veterans and co-workers via social media and word of mouth.   The more people who are aware of this campaign, the better chance this campaign will succeed.

For those who can't support this endeavor financially, we're always open to plaque and trophy making businesses willing to donate their service and materials.
