story:
Dying is a difficult subject to talk about, so let’s talk about it.

  Hello, welcome to Nuntias. We are a small startup seeking help in funding our new website www.nuntias.com.

  The word Nuntias is a Latin word that means “Messengers” and the purpose of our website is to help give people a better understanding of the end of life process through our user submitted videos. It is our mission to help terminally ill people and their family members not only to understand that they are not alone in their journey, but to give them the opportunity to talk about their own personal experience or whatever they feel is important for others to know from their own perspective about the dying process.

  We are currently using a temporary website www.nuntias.com and are seeking funding to build and operate a much more sophisticated user interactive website. Any funding raised will be used for building our new site, legal fees, advertising and other startup costs. All aspects of our site will be absolutely free to all users to ensure that everyone can participate.

  Nuntias.com will provide a safe platform for patients, family members, health care professionals, survivors and clergy members to help inform and educate others about the end of life process. Aside from user videos, Nuntias.com will also feature a section for books and articles that provide people with important and useful information about the dying process. We will also be producing a monthly doc-u-series titled Before I Go that will be made up of the more memorable and important points of our user contributed videos.

  Nuntias.com will also help to raise money for charities related to fighting terminal illnesses. The “Donations” section of Nuntias.com will be entirely devoted to helping users that wish to donate to charities that are close to their hearts. Nuntias.com will not accept any form of payments through our own site, so through links to the charities, users will be taken directly to their selected charity to make their donations. Users may also request to have a charity added to our donations section.

  In addition to helping fund our Nuntias.com campaign we need help getting the word out about our site. We are asking EVERYONE to please send us an email at Nuntias1@gmail.com and put the word “Friend” in the subject line. Once our new site is complete we will send you an email asking you to help launch our site by contacting as many people as you can via, email, Facebook and twitter and letting everyone you can know that we are here and ready to serve.

Also, we are looking for videos from people who would like to tell their stories and provide others with their thoughts. So if you are a survivor of a terminal illness, have ever lost a loved one to terminal illness or know someone who is battling a terminal illness, please consider contributing your own video. The more insight we can help give to others the better we will become.

  For anyone who has ever battled or has lost a loved one to terminal illness, you understand exactly how important Nuntias.com will be for others. For those who have never had to go through the experience of losing a loved one to terminal illness, this site is for you.

  It is our hope that with your help, Nuntias.com will be there to potentially help millions of people in the very near future.

  Thank you so much for your support.

story:
The fundraiser is being held for a dear friend of mine named Lindsey Mogan. 

Lindsey is a lively rocking snowboarder chick who absolutely loves the mountains. She grew up in Oliver, BC and when she was old enough she moved straight to Whistler to live her dream. At the young age of 24 Lindsey was diagnosed with Multiple Sclerosis. She has a very severe and unique case that has ended up debilitating her harder and faster than most. While she was still capable Lindsey immediately started working with people with disabilities as she knew one day she would need the community to help her. She moved back home with her parents at the age of 27, and then into a care home. Lindsey is currently 33 years old and she resides in palliative care in Kelowna, BC. Lindsey, the once thriving snowboarder and artist is now bed ridden and her losing her spirit. Lindsey can't move on her own and hasn't been up a mountain in over 7 years. When we speak on the phone, her first question is always "how's the snow?"...

In coordination with the Whistler Adaptive Program, the Athletes Village, the Gibbons group, and support of the Whistler community, we are getting together to get our lovely girl back on the mountain. Monies raised will be covering the cost of Lindsey's time on the mountain, her transportation to and from Whistler, her 24 hour care-aid, and her accommodation. Any left over proceeds will be donated to Lindsey and the Whistler Adaptive Program.

We appreciate any support, even positive vibes sent Lindsey's way. Thanks for reading!

The Fundraiser will be held at the Longhorn in Whistler on the 14th of April. Come one, come all! We look forward to it.

story:
Who we are:

We are self-proclaimed secular missionaries.  By that, we mean that we are committed to doing good in the world, not just out of the goodness of our own hearts, but on behalf of all those who are good, with or without religion and with or without God.  We serve in the name of the human spirit.  And with faith that that’s enough.


To meet our team members and learn more about us, click here.



What we’re doing:

For this project, we are putting together care packages that we will be distributing to people affected by homelessness in Portland, Oregon.  Our delivery date is set for August 22nd.  Our goal is to give out 50 packs, which will include the following:

  • food (sandwiches and snacks)

  • a reusable water bottle full of ice water

  • personal care items, such as toothbrush and toothpaste, deodorant, etc.

  • socks

  • sanitary products for women (some packs)

  • dog food, for people with canine companions (some packs)

  • a printed list of local resources for those experiencing homelessness

  • a pamphlet explaining who we are and our mission

  • a handwritten note

  • an invitation to submit a piece of writing to be published on our blog, and supplies for doing so (pen, paper, envelope, stamp, etc.)

  • all in a cotton, drawstring bag


What we need:

Our goal of $3000 is based on a budget for the contents and distribution of 50 care packages.  The breakdown of where that money will go looks like this:








What you get:

We think the coolest thing about contributing to this campaign is that it is, at any contribution level, a vote of confidence for human goodness.  It says that, whether or not you’re religious, and whether or not you believe in God/s, you are a good person.  That you believe the goodness in others does not depend on their religion or beliefs about God/s.  And you believe that the people we’re serving with this project - and that people in general - deserve respect regardless of their religious beliefs and deserve support without spiritual strings attached.  That’s a pretty cool statement to make.


But in addition to making an awesome statement, you get perks!  Higher contribution amounts come with greater perks, and each level of contribution comes with the perks from all the lower levels.  Here are some things we’re offering:

  • Your name will be featured on our website next to those of our other wonderful supporters.  (All contribution levels.)

  • We’ll post a personal shout-out to you on Facebook, thanking your for your support.  ($10)

  • We’ll create a personalized “(Your Name) is good for nothing” image for you with your face on it for you to use as you wish.  We’ll also send you a 3” x 5” vinyl Secular Missionaries sticker.  ($25)


  • We’ll send a personal message from you to the recipients of our care packages.  Got a favorite quote or something you want them to know?  Words of your choosing** will be included in our printed materials.  We’ll also send you Secular Missionaries car magnet.  ($50)

  • We’ll make a personal thank you video for you from the day of the project.  We’ll also send you a DIY Kit (5 of our cotton drawstring sacks, 5 of our reusable water bottles and instructions) so you can spread the love in your own town.  ($100)

  • We’ll plant a tree in your name with Friends of Trees and send you a Secular Missionaries Tshirt.  ($500)

  • We’ll hold a beach clean-up event in your name.  ($1000)


*Remember, perks at any level also come with the perks from all the lower (dollar amount) levels!

**For the personal message perk, the printed words must not conflict with our core message, nor can they be considered by us to be offensive, disrespectful, derogatory or otherwise inappropriate.  In the unlikely event that we object to your submission, we’ll invite you to revise it.



Why it matters:

We’re serving the community in two very distinct, but both important, ways.

  1. We’re working to bring relief, comfort, hope and dignity to people who are experiencing some pretty rough circumstances.  We believe that in a country with the wealth of resources the United States has, it is unjustifiable that people are left homeless and hungry.  But this project is not about that, on that large scale.  This is about recognizing that people experiencing homelessness are human beings with feelings and needs, on an individual level.  And it's about our firm belief that they are important, and that they deserve respect and support.  Each person that we reach with this project is, in our eyes, a complete reason to do this.

  2. We're also working to bring attention to the fact that human goodness does not depend on religion or belief in God/s.  We don't think there's anything wrong with religion or believing in God, but we object to the popular myth that those things are necessary parts of a good life.  We know that neither kindness nor compassion nor virtue depend on them.  And this project serves as one real (if small) example of that.



What if we don’t meet our goal?

We like this Teddy Roosevelt quote, “Do what you can, where you are, with what you have.”  If we do not raise our goal, we will go on with the project at whatever volume we can with what we do raise.


What if we pass our goal?

More money will just mean more people reached.  One great thing about this project is that it is easy to adjust in scale.  Every $40 we raise over our goal means one more of our care packages will go to someone who needs it.  We (Secular Missionaries) have members in all three west coast states, and sadly it is highly unlikely that we will run out of people to give care packages to.  All money raised by this campaign will be used for this project and its associated costs.




How to get involved:

  • Contributions to this campaign at any level are hugely appreciated.  We couldn’t do this without you!

  • Whether or not you can contribute, a fantastic way of showing your support is sharing our campaign with your friends.

  • Liking us on Facebook helps us get the word out.

  • Interested in volunteering?  If you are in the Portland, Oregon, area and would like to lend a hand, please contact us and let us know.  We’d love your help!

  • And finally, a wonderful way of supporting our mission is to carry our message with you in your own life.  Spread the word that a person’s worth does not depend on their religious perspective.  Serve as a living example of human goodness that does not depend on religion or belief in God/s.  Be good, for nothing!

story:
Hello, My Name is Cheryl Thomas, and I have developed a product that will be gratefully embraced by moms and little girls everywhere. As we all know, little girls love hair accessories. Moms love them even more because they keep their little girls’ hair neat and away from their faces. But keeping track of hair accessories can be a royal pain! Sometimes it seems that barrettes, hair clips, and ribbons always end up in a tangled heap in a drawer, on the floor, or even under the bed – with each clip or ribbon missing its mate.

I have designed the perfect solution that both moms and little girls will love! The Barette Kaddy is a rotating, vertical storage unit that is fun, practical, colorful and unique to the market. It is, ideal for storing on the top of a dresser, table or counter. The Barette Kaddy will be available online and through local retailers in the metro Atlanta area with future plans to include a personalized line of ribbons and barrettes.My vision is clear; my business plan is sound; my fulfillment and distribution procedures are in place; and the market is ready! However bring a product to market is not an easy task, I am now seeking start-up funding to produce and cover initial tooling costs. Your donation will take my product to the next level! I read once that, “Vision without action is merely a dream. Action without vision just passes the time. Vision with action can change the world.” (Joel A. Barker). The Barette Kaddy may not literally change the world, but for moms and little girls, it can make all the difference in their world!Please help me take the next step!! For more information, please visit www.barettekaddy.com.
story_txt: Hello, My Name is Cheryl Thomas, and I have developed a product that will be gratefully embraced by moms and little girls everywhere. As we all know, little girls love hair accessories. Moms love them even more because they keep their little girls’ hair neat and away from their faces. But keeping track of hair accessories can be a royal pain! Sometimes it seems that barrettes, hair clips, and ribbons always end up in a tangled heap in a drawer, on the floor, or even under the bed – with each clip or ribbon missing its mate.I have designed the perfect solution that both moms and little girls will love! The Barette Kaddy is a rotating, vertical storage unit that is fun, practical, colorful and unique to the market. It is, ideal for storing on the top of a dresser, table or counter. The Barette Kaddy will be available online and through local retailers in the metro Atlanta area with future plans to include a personalized line of ribbons and barrettes.My vision is clear; my business plan is sound; my fulfillment and distribution procedures are in place; and the market is ready! However bring a product to market is not an easy task, I am now seeking start-up funding to produce and cover initial tooling costs. Your donation will take my product to the next level! I read once that, “Vision without action is merely a dream. Action without vision just passes the time. Vision with action can change the world.” (Joel A. Barker). The Barette Kaddy may not literally change the world, but for moms and little girls, it can make all the difference in their world!Please help me take the next step!! For more information, please visit www.barettekaddy.com.

story:
Supporting a Cause:

In 2009 my wife and I travelled to Cancun and met a real party animal working at the resort we visited named Chinos Liner. Chinos is a crazy man with a big heart and always strove to make sure that us and everyone around him had the time of their life. 
In 2012, Chinos was diagnosed with and treated for cancer. His attitude was "F$ck cancer!" throughout his entire ordeal. He fought it... and he won.

Many of us took the opportunity to support Chinos in making sure that he could afford the surgery that he needed and he was very grateful for all of the support that he was given.
After that experience, Chinos became an advocate for supporting kids with cancer. He has done many fundraisers, charity runs, and hosted charity events to support others. Some would call it "paying it forward". Chinos just calls it "kindness".

The Next Step:

Chinos has been collaborating with AITANA House in Cancun for several years. AITANA House supports children with cancer and their families. It provides a place to stay, food, and even toys for those children. There have been losses. Some of the children don't make it.
This year, Chinos embarked on a crusade to do something special for those kids. Not an effort like granting a child a single "wish" just before their time to pass, but something to help raise the spirits of any child with cancer. He wants to take them to Disney World!


We Want to Help:
Chinos has worked it out at a cost of approximately $1000 per child to get them to Orlando, FL, pay for them to stay, and take them on the adventure of a lifetime to Disney World. My wife and I want to help and will personally donate $1000 to sponsor sending a child with cancer to Disney.
But we also thought we might be able to do more. We wanted to get the community involved and see if anyone else would be interested in donating for this cause. This isn't a registered charity in the United States so there are no tax write-offs... But it is an opportunity to give a child suffering with cancer something that they would never otherwise experience.
We've set a funding goal of $5000. This would sponsor sending five children to Disney World. If, out of the generosity of all of you, we exceed that amount, the remainder will be used to either sponsor more children or to buy toys for those who cannot go.

What You Get:

We want as much of this funding as possible to go to the children. Indiegogo will take their cut as will PayPal and any other third party services. But the rest will all go towards these kids.

That said, we will be purchasing silicone wristbands to give to any supporters who donate over $50. The wristband and the shipping will be paid for out of my own pocket so that every possible penny can go to the kids.

If we hit our funding goal, these will be ordered and sent to anyone who donates $50 or more.


For the Kids:

I hope we can hit our funding goal of $5000 over the next month. These kids deserve the chance to feel amazing, even if it's only for a few days. I hope you feel the same way that I do and will help in this cause. Again, we're putting our money where our mouth is and donating $1000 as well as buying the wristbands and mailing them out. I hope you'll join us in supporting this cause.

Even if you can't donate, please share out this campaign to everyone you know. Maybe they will be able to help and you'll be supporting the kids by extension. Getting the word out for a campaign like this is hard so please share this around!

I'd like to finish this out with a great video posted by CancunCare for Christmas 2014. Please take a look and see a great example of how these kids are supported by Chinos and AITANA House!

story:
Short Summary

"For a good time all the time, come on down to Vault 131! We come highly recommended by 3 Dog, our favorite radio personality. Vault 131 is recently opened to the public, for the first time since the Great War of 2077. As you know, it has now been more than 200 years since the nuclear disaster that ended the Great War and we are still here. We have survived, thrived, and wish for you to share in our success with us. Escape the devastated wasteland, The New California Republic (NCR), raiders, radiation, and the like by retreating into our post-apocalyptic retro-futuristic dining area where all are friends and all forms of life are welcome. Straight from our atomic powered soda fountain are a number of beverages scientifically designed by Vault-Tec engineers using the most up-to-date technology to wet your whistle and refresh your soul. Vault 131 is furnished with all the modern comforts of today and homey aesthetics of yesterday. Our atmosphere is completed with outstanding live musical entertainment for the cocktail hours inspired by our predecessors' combined of hope for the promises of technology and lurking fear of nuclear annihilation from the golden age of our history."

  • My Name is Cornelius. My team and I make AWESOME Parties.
  • With your help we would like to make a room at Con unlike any before.
  • With a great concept: "Welcome to vault 131".
  • Complete with Top shelf drinks, Live music, Great ambience, and Beautiful women & Hot guys.

What We Need & What You Get

  • $5  Gets You: A barrage of compliments by the team. They're compliments, but due the tone they will sound like insults ; )
  • $10 Gets You: A Shout-out during the live performances, and the location of 3 Vault Secrets around Con. *All Lower Tier Perks Included
  • $15 Gets You: A Photo of you and your friends posing in Vault 131 with our volunteers posted up on our Facebook page! *All Lower Tier Perks Included
  • $25 Gets You: The Password to get the Hidden Vault Hunter's Drink (The ______ _____). *All Lower Tier Perks Included
  • $50 Gets You: A Singing Telegram to anyone you choose at Con. *All Lower Tier Perks Included (Same tier as Red Child)
  • $50 Gets You: The Official "IndieGoGo Backer" Vault Hunter's Ribbon delivered by The Girls, or The Guys. *All Lower Tier Perks Included (Same Tier as Apocalyptic Bard)
  • $75 Gets you all lower tiers.
  • $200 Gets You: A Cartoon likeness (in the style of Pip-Boy) that we'll hang up in the Vault. *All Lower Tier Perks Included

The Impact

We are trying to do something great here. How many times have you spent $50 on a night out, if not more? So take that, come join us, and get some cool stuff while you're at it!

  • Con has so much potential, but it's nothing without you. So lets get it done!

Other Ways You Can Help

We are also looking for people to volunteer to help build the sets. If you have the time please come out and help. contact me at Giordanicc@gmail.com

story:
About Our Campaign

At Bayou City Vibes our goal is the preservation and growth of Jazz Music locally, nationally and internationally. We are huge fans of jazz as well as a group of professionals who will provide artist valuable information and resources. We will also spotlight jazz music and events. To accomplish our goals for 2015 & 2016 we will need your help. Our fundraising goal for 2015 and 2016 is $75,100.00. This fundraising campaign will take place from June 2015 until August 15, 2015. We are asking you to support our efforts by contributing what you can.

What We Need Funding For

Expenses 2015 & 2016

  • Website Design $2000.00
  • Website Hosting $100.00
  • Website Maintenance $300.00
  • Graphic Design $700.00
  • Mobile Application iPhone-Android $2000.00
  • Office Space 3,200.00
  • Office Equipment (computer, printer,desk,chair,supplies) $1,100
  • Legal Advise & Fees $1,500
  • Jazz Preservation Non Profit Foundation Formation $1,500.00
  • Event Coverage $3000.00
  • Journalism & Content Creation $3000.00
  • Branding, Marketing & Public Relations $20,000.00
  • Jazz Festival Summer 2016 Houston Texas $50,000.00


Funding Perks

  • $50 contributions receive official calendar.
  • $100 contributions receive official t-shirt.
  • $250 contributions receive official calendar and t-shirt.
  • $500 contributions receive all perks plus 2 VIP tickets to 2016 Jazz Festival. (note: in the event that we do not secure funding for our jazz festival, we will substitute 2 VIP tickets for either the Red Cat Jazz Festival or HIJF or comparable event. 


Whether we reach our goal or not, we will still have the above expenses. The only expense we will eliminate if we cannot reach our goal is the 2016 Summer Jazz Festival in Houston Texas. 


What We Want To Accomplish

This campaign will assist us with operating cost and ensure that we are able to showcase Jazz artist as well as their music. We will provide a platform for artist to receive valuable information and techniques to increase their professional reach. We want to become a major player in the Renaissance of Jazz music.

  • Jazz is the foundation of all music.
  • We want to educate artist on how to utilize the internet.
  • We want to assist artist with the distribution of their music.
  • We want to teach artist to create additional revenue streams.
  • We want to provide artist a platform to advertise their events as well as products.

Our Challenges

Our major challenge is securing the necessary funding to enable us to build our brand properly and to reach the targeted markets we have to. Our plan is to hire A&M Entertainment (www.amentertainment.com) to handle our Branding, PR and Marketing. A&M Entertainment is one of the top firms in the world. 


    Other Ways You Can Help

    If you are unable to contribute now, please help us by.

    • Ask your friends to get the word out and make some noise about our campaign.
    • Please use the share buttons on our campaign.
    • Like us on Facebook at https://www.facebook.com/bayoucityvibes.
    • Follow us on Twitter at https://twitter.com/BCVibes.

story:
Did you know that you can save more money buying groceries at the right time of the month than by using a coupon to 'save' at the wrong time of the month? Let me teach you how.


Hi, I'm Emilie and I used to hate grocery shopping. I'd always come out of the store with more than I needed and having spent way more money than I wanted to. I was always overwhelmed trying to "compare prices" and looking for the "best deal." After years and years of failing at being frugal, I was ready to throw in the towel and just accept that this would be how life was. Then I met a friend who was feeding her family of 5, three growing teenagers at that, for less than $100 a month- and I knew that I had to learn it all.

I knew that it had to be my responsibility to share this with more people. How often have you bought bread to see it go BOGO the next day? There is nothing more frustrating!

One recent afternoon, I walked into the grocery store after an hour of preparation.  Not too long after, I walked out of that grocery store with MORE money than I walked in with. I made that store PAY ME to shop there. I was astonished by this possibility. And even more surprising, I could not believe other people weren't doing this too. Over time, from continuous application of these techniques; I have been able to save an average of 35% on my grocery store purchases. With just 15 minutes a couple of times per week, I've been able to significantly cut down my grocery bill so I could pay off my student debt and work towards financial freedom.


From a recent trip to the grocery store.


I want to help the average consumer become informed like I have. And not just with groceries, either. Consumer electronics, clothing, cars, you name it - having knowledge of what goes on behind the scenes always means you get to pay less than the next guy, and that's what I want to put in this field guide. Me and a small team of my dedicated friends plan to not only gather this information, but to condense it into actionable processes that will save you the most money with the least effort. To do that, I need your help.

Right now we have the most experience in a systematic way for buying groceries, and so that's what will form the core of the ShopHack Field Guide. Throughout the funding process we'll be polling you guys to see what other areas of consumer goods you're interested in to see how we can best allocate our funding to acquire the key knowledge that'll keep you 'in the know'. At the end of the day, our goal is to make you a more informed consumer so you can take better control of your financing.


  • A kickass PDF document that'll teach you everything you need to know to start instantly shaving money off your receipts. This is split into two tiers. The first tier is our core methodologies we've developed over the years to save money on groceries. The second tier includes our core grocery shopping method and also all subsequent chapters we plan on writing which will cover any number of other product categories.

  • T-Shirts & Pint Glasses!

  • 1 on 1 consultations with our team on any major purchase!


  • We are seeking $1500 in order to research, develop and create our informational guide which will eventually outline a system for not just saving money on groceries but any number of different purchases from mattresses to cars to speakers and clothes. The majority of this money will go into getting in touch with industry experts and industries and experimenting with the different shopping strategies to develop that into something easy to use and digest.We plan on constantly updating the guide with new chapters on different products based on what YOU guys want us to research.


ShopHack empowers the everyday consumer to improve their purchasing experiences by making informed decisions about their purchases.

Our goal with ShopHack is to help the everyday consumer make better timing decisions when it comes to consumer goods shopping. Our methods don’t only include couponing. It turns out that many of our favorite shops follow very specific rules in regard to the pricing of their products. Based on years of experience, we have determined the best methods in helping you save money. You can even save up to 100% on your purchases!

Besides a How-To guide, we plan on helping you navigate modern informational databases that save you the most money. Ultimately, we want to help you change your lifestyle and make you a more frugal person!

Your support in helping us develop the product will allow us to help you save money on your consumer goods. We need your money to help you save money!


You can help us by subscribing to Emilie’s blog on Bloglovin' or mailing list to show your support for saving money and our #Shophack mission.

story:
ENGLISH BELOW 

Con tu apoyo podemos re-estructurar y expandir el apiario, proveerle trabajo a ex-convictos y familiares a través de la apicultura y educar sobre las abejas!

Nuestra miel viene de abejas africanizadas que se reproducen mucho más rápido y necesitan unas cajas especializadas. Nuestras colmenas están libres de químicos, antibióticos y son hogar de abejas que recorren la isla!

El sábado, 29 de agosto comenzamos un curso para trabajar con abejas que se dará todos los sábados consecutivos hasta el 24 de octubre. Nos interesa que la agricultura pueda ser un trabajo para el pueblo. 

Por lo que hemos desarrollado tres cursos para formar Promotores de Agroecología Bieke (2013-2015). La formación de promotores se basa en la metodología campesino a campesino que busca entrenar de manera horizontal partiendo del conocimiento agrícola que tengamos y requiere de un compromiso entre los que luego pasan a ser promotores de agroecología, con seguir practicando la agricultura y enseñando sobre la misma.

El primer curso se ofreció en el huerto comunitario de la Esperanza que Ique, Miguelina, Hilda y Elías llevan trabajando por unos años. El curso facilitó la expansión del huerto y la organización del mismo a lo que hoy día llamamos Finca Comunitaria Sembrando Esperanza en la Esperanza. El segundo vino siendo un intercambio entre huertos comunitarios e interesados con el Huerto Comunitario de César Coca y el Huerto Comunitario de Lucila Franco. Hace dos meses culminamos el curso para promotores en la Finca Conciencia en Monte Carmelo.

El Proyecto Las Abejas busca capacitar y adiestrar a confinados, ex-confinados y familiares mediante la producción agroecológica, la preparación de promotores agroecológicos, y la promoción de la justicia social y ambiental. Empoderando y apoyando a confinados, ex confinados y familiares para crecer, mercadear y educar sobre alimentos sanos, ampliando las oportunidades de empleo y acercándonos a la soberanía alimentaria en el archipiélago de Puerto Rico. A su vez reducimos riesgos, aumentamos la sustentabilidad y resiliencia en comunidad y proveemos seguridad alimentaria. Como las abejas entendemos que podemos organizarnos, y trabajar duro entre todos para una mejor convivencia. 

Sobre las abejas

Las abejas son vitales para que nos alimentamos, ya que son las encargadas principales de transportar el polen para fecundar los óvulos de las flores. Lo que se le llama polinización. Sin ellas todos los árboles con flores, que dan frutas dejarían a la larga de reproducirse, causando un desastre alimentario mundial. 1/3 parte de la comida que consumimos los humanos depende de las abejas. 3/4 partes de las plantas del planeta dependen de la polinización para reproducirse, y las abejas son cruciales para que esto sea así. 1 colmena poliniza 3 millones de flores por día. Una colmena es una comunidad organizada de abejas que vive en una caja preparada. La reina pone hasta 2 millones de huevos en su vida productiva y en una colmena de 30,000 abejas existen 100 zánganos, el resto son trabajadoras. Los zánganos no tienen aguijones, solo están para aparearse. La próxima vez que le digas zángano a alguien piensa en las abejas.

Para comer las quenepas, aguacates, cacao (de donde proviene el chocolate), limón, naranja y tomarnos ese rico café necesitamos a las abejas. En Estados Unidos los agricultores buscan desesperadamente a los apicultores para polinizar las grandes extensiones de almendros de California, donde se estima que son necesarias más de un millón de colmenas cada año. En Florida pasa otro tanto con los cítricos, ya que tienen muy claro que las abejas pueden mejorar hasta un 60% la producción cada año.

Una colonia completa de abejas se enferma y muere en un periodo de dos semanas. Hasta el momento, cerca de la mitad de las abejas en Europa y Estados Unidos han desaparecido repentinamente de esa forma, y los científicos conocen este fenómeno como el Problema de Colapso de Colonias (CCD, por sus siglas en inglés). (Suzanna Engman, Revista de Investigación Inventio) Las causas mayores por su muerte son la agricultura industrial, la pérdida de hábitat y los pesticidas tóxicos. Todo esto hace que las abejas se debiliten y mueran rápidamente y las ha hecho mucho más susceptibles a enfermedades y plagas. Entre estas se encuentra un ácaro sanguijuela que se les pega y trata de chupar su sangre y la de sus larvas. Este ácaro se llama varroa. Aunque es más pequeño que los puntos en esta oración, para una abeja es grande, vendría siendo como del tamaño de un gato para nosotros. Este ácaro se adhiere a la abeja y le crea heridas abiertas que las dejan más susceptibles a infecciones. Las abejas africanizadas han mostrado ser mucho más resistentes a la varroa, ya que pelean por sus vidas intentando eliminarlo. Aquí estamos hablando de abejas Apis mellifera, la abeja relacionada a la miel y de Apis mellifera europea y africanizadas. Por eso apostamos a la agricultura ecológica y a la inclusión de abejas africanizadas en nuestros apiarios. Es lo único que puede cambiar el estado actual de las abejas.

Sobre las abejas africanizadas en Vieques 

En Puerto Rico y en muchos países no quieren a las abejas africanizadas, ni siquiera se quiere hacer mención de ellas por su fama de asesinas. Sin embargo esta abeja está establecida en Puerto Rico desde los años 80, no se sabe bien los cruces que ha generado pero se entiende que es menos agresiva que en muchos países del mundo. En el 2005 cuando las abejas melíferas del mundo empiezan a tener trastornos, comienzan las investigaciones en laboratorios en Europa y Estados Unidos para ver como se podía bajar la agresividad en las abejas africanizadas. Estas investigaciones se dan desde grandes laboratorios, pero ya en Vieques se han observado cruces con las abejas africanizadas y en la práctica se ha hecho mucho trabajo con ellas. La propuesta entonces es establecer apiarios africanizados en Vieques que a su vez sirven como una especie de laboratorio. Jorge Cora lleva investigando las abejas africanizadas desde el 1996 y a través de un curso que tomó de apicultura en el 2005 comienza a hablar sobre la africanización y hacer pruebas con cera estampada. Las abejas europeas ponen 2,000 huevos diarios, mientras que las abejas africanizadas ponen 4,000 huevos diarios. Además la abeja africanizada Apis mellifera nace dos días antes a la europea Apis mellifera, son más pequeñas pero son más veloces y visitan mayor cantidad de flores. Son más defensivas, pero esto no significa tengan ningún interés en picarte así por que sí, van a proteger su colmena con más tenacidad de depredadores. Por lo tanto con estas ventajas, hay que darle la oportunidad a las abejas africanizadas. Darle la oportunidad a las abejas africanizadas salvaría el mundo, es vital no temerle a las abejas de esta especie.

Sobre Finca Conciencia:

En Puerto Rico se importa más del 85% de lo que se consume, en Vieques la cifra es aún mayor. Actualmente la seguridad alimentaria en Vieques es una precaria, por lo que nos hemos dado a la tarea de facilitar la producción, distribución y comercialización de la agricultura local. La familia promedio come productos enlatados a diario, que además de tomar el ferry toman buques, aviones y camiones tardándose semanas para llegar a nuestra mesa. Si en Puerto Rico ocurriese una crisis en los puertos habría comida para tan solo cuatro días, ¿qué pasaría en Vieques?

La Finca Conciencia comenzó hace ocho años con la preocupación del agricultor Jorge Cora de producir lo que comía y para el pueblo. La finca se ha desarrollado a pico y pala por los últimos años, sin maquinaria ni insumos tóxicos como los pesticidas y herbicidas. Actualmente sirve como una especie de finca escuela. En los últimos meses hemos celebrado una Finca Abierta, visitas guiadas a escuelas y jóvenes, días de brigadas de trabajo, un cine foro con la coordinadora de una escuela de formación del Movimiento de los Sin Tierra en Brasil (gracias a la Organización de Agricultura Ecológica Boricuá), talleres sobre abejas y apicultura y un curso para promotores de agroecología Bieké. Gracias a los estudiantes de la Escuela 20 de Septiembre y la maestra Elda Guadalupe hemos organizado un banco de semillas de las semillas locales viequenses.

Un poco sobre nosotros:

¡Ana Elisa y Jorge Cora van a expandir el apiario! Por treinta años Jorge Cora ha estado trabajando con abejas, en Vieques lo conocen como el Hombre Abeja! Por más de treinta años lleva sembrando de manera sostenible en su pueblo de nacimiento, Arroyo y 8 años en Vieques. Vieques es caliente y susceptible a sequías, Jorge pensó que sería un desafío comenzar una finca en Vieques y se tiró para crear un modelo que le enseñara a la gente que todo era posible con la agricultura sostenible. Ana Elisa ha estado trabajando con proyectos de agricultura sostenible desde que tenía trece años de edad, el rescate de un solar abandonado en su escuela y la comunidad, la organizando agricultores y formando promotores de Agroecología en Vieques, México, Haití y Guatemala y facilitando el desarrollo de huertos y fincas comunitarias en Vieques y Puerto Rico. Hace apenas ocho meses se mudó a Finca Conciencia donde está ayudando a desarrollar aún más el apiario, creando cursos y actividades educativas.

Sobre Apiarios Bieké y el Proyecto Las Abejas:

Jorge Cora estuvo encarcelado durante cuatro años, cuando en la cárcel pensaba en la importancia de mostrar a los demás confinados sus capacidades para proveerse puestos de trabajo a sí mismos a través de la agricultura ecológica. Esta es la razón por la cual Finca Conciencia comenzó con ya más de 20 cajas que hay que arreglar y adaptar para las abejas africanizadas. Ana Elisa ha estado trabajando con huertos comunitarios desde que era muy joven y encuentra de la mayoría de los mete-mano han sido ex-confinados (y familiares) que no podían encontrar trabajo a causa de sus antecedentes penales. El Proyecto Las Abejas es para todos; no nos fijamos en sus antecedentes penales, pero sí en su ética de trabajo. El Proyecto Las Abejas capacita a futuros agricultores/as ecológicos dentro y fuera de una diversidad de instituciones correccionales y a sus familias. La certificación de los participantes proporciona un espacio para desarrollar, producir y educar sobre la agricultura ecológica como un modelo socioeconómico alternativo. Capacitar y apoyar a los confinados, ex confinados, y familiares en comunidades marginadas para cultivar alimentos saludables, implica la ampliación de las oportunidades de empleo y que nos acerca a la soberanía alimentaria en Puerto Rico.

¡Nuestra meta! ¿Por qué necesitamos tu apoyo?

Necesitamos $40,000 en apoyo a proyectos y propuestas que ya hemos hecho para lograr sustentar este proyecto. A través de esta campaña estamos pidiendo $15,00 que nos provee una base saludable para el apiario y de esta manera podemos movernos a conseguir otras Fuentes de fondos que incluyen la venta de productos de la finca. Necesitamos re-estructurar nuestro apiario. . 

------ENGLISH-----------------------------

With your support we can replace outdated beekeeping boxes, provide jobs for the formerly incarcerated through beekeeping and educate about bees!

Our honey comes from Vieques’ africanized bees that have outgrown our hives. Our hives are chemical-free, antibiotic-free and home to bees that fly around our island.

About Africanized bees 

(watch this video about Africanized bees in Puerto Rico: http://www.smithsonianmag.com/ist/?next=/videos/category/science/why-puerto-ricos-killer-bees-stopped-killing/)

Bees are vital to us as they are responsible for carrying pollen to fertilize the eggs of flowers. This is called pollination. Without them all flowering plants that give fruits would eventually cease to reproduce, causing a global food disaster. 1/3 of the food that humans consume depend on bees. One hive can pollinate over 3 million flowers per day. An organized community of bees that live in a box made for that specific purpose is a hive. We can eat quenepas, avocados, cacao (chocolate), lemons, and oranges thanks to bees.

About half of the bees in Europe and United States have suddenly died from what scientists have named Colony Collapse Disorder where a full colony of bees gets sick and die in a period of two weeks. The major causes for his death are industrial agriculture and toxic pesticides. This makes bees die quickly or become sick and are more susceptible to diseases and pests. Among these is a mite called varroa, that tries to suck their blood and larvae, which leaves bees with open wounds that make them more susceptible to infection. Africanized bees have shown to be more resistant to varroa, as they fight for their lives trying to eliminate it.

In Puerto Rico and in many countries people don’t want Africanized bees, because of their killer bee reputation. However, this bee is present in Puerto Rico since the 80s, studies have not yet found exactly how they are crossing among European bees but they are known to be less aggressive than in many countries. When honeybees started to have problems, the research began in laboratories in Europe and the United States to see how they could lower the aggressiveness of Africanized bees. In Vieques already beekeepers have observed less aggressive Africanized bees. Jorge Cora has been investigating Africanized bees since 1996 and through a course that he took on beekeeping in 2005 he begins tests with the beeswax. European bees could lay 2,000 eggs a day, while Africanized bees could lay 4,000 eggs a day. The Africanized Apis mellifera is born two days before the European Apis mellifera, also Africanized bees are smaller but faster and can visit more flowers a day. They are more defensive, but this isn’t to sting you, they will protect their hive with more tenacity against predators. So with these advantages, we must give the opportunity to Africanized bees. Africanized bees could save the World.

About Finca Conciencia: 

Finca Conciencia is a small off-grid farm and apiary in Vieques that focuses on the beauty and bounties of our Monte Carmelo. Apiculture has a strong agriculture base in the Caribbean. Everyone needs to eat and there is little to none fresh, locally grown crops. Finca Conciencia began seven years ago with the concern of farmer Jorge Cora to eat and produce local food due to the 85% of imported produce in Puerto Rico. In Vieques this rate is even higher. The farm has been developed with no machinery or toxic inputs such as pesticides and herbicides.

We are now transforming the farm into a sort of farm school, as an incubator farm for Proyecto Las Abejas. In recent months we have held an Open House, tours for schools and youth, workdays, bee-keeping workshops and movie forums. Thanks to the students of the 20 de Septiembre Middle School and their teacher Elda Guadalupe we have organized a seed bank of local seeds in Vieques. We produce honey and a great variety of vegetables that we sell to local businesses, restaurants and residents every Tuesday and Friday.

A little bit about us:

Ana Elisa and Jorge Cora are expanding the apiary! For 10 years Jorge has been working with bees in Vieques, were he is better known as the "Bee Man". He has been farming sustainably for more than 30 years in his hometown in Arroyo and 8 years in Vieques. Vieques is hot, and prone to drought, Jorge thought it would be a challenge to farm in Vieques and was up to develop a project were he could teach people that anything was possible with sustainable agriculture. Ana Elisa has been working with sustainable agriculture projects since she was thirteen years old, rescuing an abandoned lot at her school and community, organizing farmer to farmer training(s) in Puerto Rico, México, Haiti and Guatemala and community gardens in Vieques and Puerto Rico. Just a few months ago she moved to Finca Conciencia were she is helping further develop the apiary, setting up courses and educational activities.

About Vieques Apiary and The Bee(s) Project:

In Vieques the unemployment rate is 60%, so we promote educational projects in agriculture, to help us re-think ourselves within the island's agricultural economy. From August 29 to October 24 we will meet every Saturday in Finca Conciencia to teach a course on bees. The interest of this course is to train a group in Vieques of producers of honey and other bee products. It will be free for the formerly incarcelated and families, as we want Apiarios Bieké to be one of the incubators for Proyecto Las Abejas. Jorge Cora was incarcerated for four years, when in prison he thought about the importance to show inmates their abilities to provide jobs for themselves through agriculture. This is why Finca Conciencia started with already more than 20 boxes that need fixing and revamping. Ana Elisa has been working with community gardens since she was very young and constantly found formerly incarcerated men, women and families that couldn't find jobs because of their criminal record. Proyecto Las Abejas is for everyone; we don't look at your criminal record but at your work ethic. Proyecto Las Abejas (The Bee Project) trains future farmers in and out of a diversity of correctional institutions and their families. Certifying participants as Sustainable Agriculture Promoters and providing a space for the formerly incarcerated and families to develop, produce and educate about sustainable agriculture as an alternative socioeconomic model. Empowering and supporting inmates, formerly incarcerated, and families in underserved communities to grow healthy food, expanding employment opportunities and bringing us closer to food sovereignty in Puerto Rico.

Also we want to give AFRICANIZED BEES AN OPPORTUNITY. These bees could save the world and they are special in Vieques, producing tasty, dark, fruity honey at great speed!

Why do we need your help? Our goal

We need $45,000 to sustain and make viable this project but we are asking for $15,000, with $15,000 we would be able to provide a healthy base for our work and search for new materials. We need to revamp our apiary with new boxes fit for africanized bees like the ones we have in Vieques. Your donation will support 1.) new beekeepers from low income families in Vieques and their materials, 2.) a room for honey extraction and processing.
story_txt:
ENGLISH BELOW 
Con tu
apoyo podemos re-estructurar y expandir el apiario, proveerle trabajo a ex-convictos
y familiares a través de la apicultura y educar sobre las abejas! 

Nuestra
miel viene de abejas africanizadas que se reproducen mucho
más rápido y necesitan unas cajas especializadas. Nuestras colmenas están
libres de químicos, antibióticos y son hogar de abejas que recorren la isla!
El sábado, 29 de agosto comenzamos un curso para trabajar con
abejas que se dará todos los sábados consecutivos hasta el 24 de octubre. Nos
interesa que la agricultura pueda ser un trabajo para el pueblo. 
Por
lo que hemos desarrollado tres cursos para formar Promotores de Agroecología
Bieke (2013-2015). La formación de promotores se basa en la metodología
campesino a campesino que busca entrenar de manera horizontal partiendo del
conocimiento agrícola que tengamos y requiere de un compromiso entre los que
luego pasan a ser promotores de agroecología, con seguir practicando la
agricultura y enseñando sobre la misma.
El
primer curso se ofreció en el huerto comunitario de la Esperanza que Ique,
Miguelina, Hilda y Elías llevan trabajando por unos años. El curso facilitó la
expansión del huerto y la organización del mismo a lo que hoy día llamamos
Finca Comunitaria Sembrando Esperanza en la Esperanza. El segundo vino siendo
un intercambio entre huertos comunitarios e interesados con el Huerto
Comunitario de César Coca y el Huerto Comunitario de Lucila Franco. Hace dos
meses culminamos el curso para promotores en la Finca Conciencia en Monte
Carmelo.
El
Proyecto Las Abejas busca capacitar y adiestrar a confinados, ex-confinados y
familiares mediante la producción agroecológica, la preparación de promotores

organizarnos, y trabajar duro entre todos para una mejor convivencia.

de trabajo. El Proyecto Las Abejas capacita a futuros agricultores/as
ecológicos dentro y fuera de una diversidad de instituciones correccionales y a
sus familias. La certificación de los participantes proporciona un espacio para
desarrollar, producir y educar sobre la agricultura ecológica como un modelo
socioeconómico alternativo. Capacitar y apoyar a los confinados, ex confinados,
y familiares en comunidades marginadas para cultivar alimentos saludables,
implica la ampliación de las oportunidades de empleo y que nos acerca a la
soberanía alimentaria en Puerto Rico.¡Nuestra
meta! ¿Por qué necesitamos tu apoyo? 
Necesitamos
$40,000 en apoyo a proyectos y propuestas que ya hemos hecho para lograr
sustentar este proyecto. A través de esta campaña estamos pidiendo $15,00 que
nos provee una base saludable para el apiario y de esta manera podemos movernos
a conseguir otras Fuentes de fondos que incluyen la venta de productos de la
finca. Necesitamos re-estructurar nuestro apiario. . 

------ENGLISH-----------------------------With your support we can replace outdated
beekeeping boxes, provide jobs for the formerly incarcerated through beekeeping
and educate about bees!

Our honey comes from Vieques’ africanized bees that have
outgrown our hives. Our hives are chemical-free, antibiotic-free and home to
bees that fly around our island. 
About Africanized bees (watch this video about Africanized bees in Puerto Rico: http://www.smithsonianmag.com/ist/?next=/videos/category/science/why-puerto-ricos-killer-bees-stopped-killing/)

Bees are vital to us as they are responsible
for carrying pollen to fertilize the eggs of flowers. This is called
pollination. Without them all flowering plants that give fruits would
eventually cease to reproduce, causing a global food disaster. 1/3 of the food
that humans consume depend on bees. One hive can pollinate over 3 million
flowers per day. An organized community of bees that live in a box made for
that specific purpose is a hive. We can eat quenepas, avocados, cacao
(chocolate), lemons, and oranges thanks to bees. 
About half of the
bees in Europe and United States have suddenly died from what scientists have
named Colony Collapse Disorder where a full colony of bees gets sick and die in
a period of two weeks. The major causes for his death are industrial
agriculture and toxic pesticides. This makes bees die quickly or become sick
and are more susceptible to diseases and pests. Among these is a mite called
varroa, that tries to suck their blood and larvae, which leaves bees with open
wounds that make them more susceptible to infection. Africanized bees have
shown to be more resistant to varroa, as they fight for their lives trying to
eliminate it. 
In Puerto Rico and in
many countries people don’t want Africanized bees, because of their killer bee
reputation. However, this bee is present in Puerto Rico since the 80s, studies
have not yet found exactly how they are crossing among European bees but they
are known to be less aggressive than in many countries. When honeybees started
to have problems, the research began in laboratories in Europe and the United
States to see how they could lower the aggressiveness of Africanized bees. In
Vieques already beekeepers have observed less aggressive Africanized bees.
Jorge Cora has been investigating Africanized bees since 1996 and through a course
that he took on beekeeping in 2005 he begins tests with the beeswax. European
bees could lay 2,000 eggs a day, while Africanized bees could lay 4,000 eggs a day. The
Africanized Apis mellifera is born two days before the European Apis mellifera,
also Africanized bees are smaller but faster and can visit more flowers a day.
They are more defensive, but this isn’t to sting you, they will protect their
hive with more tenacity against predators. So with these advantages, we must
give the opportunity to Africanized bees. Africanized bees could save the
World. 

About Finca Conciencia:  

Finca Conciencia is a small off-grid farm and apiary in
Vieques that focuses on the beauty and bounties of our Monte Carmelo.
Apiculture has a strong agriculture base in the Caribbean. Everyone needs to
eat and there is little to none fresh, locally grown crops. Finca Conciencia
began seven years ago with the concern of farmer Jorge Cora to eat and produce
local food due to the 85% of imported produce in Puerto Rico. In Vieques this
rate is even higher. The farm has been developed with no machinery or toxic
inputs such as pesticides and herbicides. 

We are now transforming the farm into a sort of farm school,
as an incubator farm for Proyecto Las Abejas. In recent months we have held an
Open House, tours for schools and youth, workdays, bee-keeping workshops and
movie forums. Thanks to the students of the 20 de Septiembre Middle School and
their teacher Elda Guadalupe we have organized a seed bank of local seeds in
Vieques. We produce honey and a great variety of vegetables that we sell to
local businesses, restaurants and residents every Tuesday and Friday.
A little bit about us:

Ana Elisa and Jorge Cora are expanding the apiary! For 10
years Jorge has been working with bees in Vieques, were he is better known as
the "Bee Man". He has been farming sustainably for more than 30 years
in his hometown in Arroyo and 8 years in Vieques. Vieques is hot, and prone to
drought, Jorge thought it would be a challenge to farm in Vieques and was up to
develop a project were he could teach people that anything was possible with
sustainable agriculture. Ana Elisa has been working with sustainable
agriculture projects since she was thirteen years old, rescuing an abandoned
lot at her school and community, organizing farmer to farmer training(s) in
Puerto Rico, México, Haiti and Guatemala and community gardens in Vieques and
Puerto Rico. Just a few months ago she moved to Finca Conciencia were she is
helping further develop the apiary, setting up courses and educational
activities.

About Vieques
Apiary and The Bee(s) Project: 

In Vieques the unemployment rate is 60%, so we promote
educational projects in agriculture, to help us re-think ourselves within the
island's agricultural economy. From August 29 to October 24 we will meet every
Saturday in Finca Conciencia to teach a course on bees. The interest of this
course is to train a group in Vieques of producers of honey and other bee
products. It will be
free for the formerly incarcelated and families, as we want Apiarios Bieké to
be one of the incubators for Proyecto Las Abejas. Jorge Cora was incarcerated
for four years, when in prison he thought about the importance to show inmates
their abilities to provide jobs for themselves through agriculture. This is why
Finca Conciencia started with already more than 20 boxes that need fixing and
revamping. Ana Elisa has been working with community gardens since she was very
young and constantly found formerly incarcerated men, women and families that
couldn't find jobs because of their criminal record. Proyecto Las Abejas is for
everyone; we don't look at your criminal record but at your work ethic.
Proyecto Las Abejas (The Bee Project) trains future farmers in and out of a
diversity of correctional institutions and their families. Certifying
participants as Sustainable Agriculture Promoters and providing a space for the
formerly incarcerated and families to develop, produce and educate about
sustainable agriculture as an alternative socioeconomic model. Empowering and
supporting inmates, formerly incarcerated, and families in underserved
communities to grow healthy food, expanding employment opportunities and
bringing us closer to food sovereignty in Puerto Rico.
Also we want to give AFRICANIZED BEES AN OPPORTUNITY. These
bees could save the world and they are special in Vieques, producing tasty,
dark, fruity honey at great speed! 

Why do we need your help? Our goal
We need $45,000 to sustain and make viable this project but
we are asking for $15,000, with $15,000 we would be able to provide a healthy
base for our work and search for new materials. We need to revamp our apiary
with new boxes fit for africanized bees like the ones we have in Vieques. Your
donation will support 1.) new beekeepers from low income families in Vieques
and their materials, 2.) a room for honey extraction and processing.

story:
Hello 

My name is Nancy, and I’m an Entrepreneur. 

Sure, I'm a lot of other things too. I work as a social media manager, internet marketer, web developer and social networking host... but I'm also a self-employed, stay at home, mom. I have two amazing children, my greatest achievement thus far.

Passion

I’ve always had a desire to dream big and do big things. I’ve always had a desire and passion to push myself beyond the limits and create my own non-limits.

I don't just wish, I do. I enjoy achieving goals. 

I like working hard. I like working smart.

But, it's not really work when you love what you do. 

Project

What is this campaign for? I need funding to finish development on a website:
Hang it! The Social Commerce Network

This new Social Network and Social Commerce platform has the winning features of today's top visited social media websites. It's like Facebook + Pinterest + Instagram + Etsy + Amazon = all in one place!

It'll save people time by using fewer networks to curate & create content, discover interests, organize digital media, engage with community, share products and services and to follow inspiring ideas, trends, brands and people.

I believe that if you create a people powered, content creation platform, that it will develop organically to build trust and make it simple for anyone to grow social and business relationships, sell their products and services to increase influence, develop social proof and to generate more sales for people, brands and stores. 

Most large social networks (Pinterest, Facebook, etc) don't have full commerce features yet. With a successful campaign, I can launch the site in beta in 2-3 months and allow people to use it for feedback and to improve the user experience.

 Here's a video about the technology of -- The Social Commerce Network:

I’d love it, if you would, allow me to tell you about a project that I’ve been working on, for the last, 3 and a half years. 

I know that sounds like a LONG time to develop a “product” but, this happens to be a complex web platform - built from scratch. It was also expensive, paying for it, on my own, but, I have. :)

Inspiration came by wanting to combine the visually interesting and hot new social media site, Pinterest, with the buy/sell functionality of Etsy, because I could see the desire that some people appeared to have, while they were impulsively buying products on Etsy or purchasing items, off of Pinterest. 

The idea of being available at the moment when: visual inspiration, met with product discovery and resulted in spontaneous gratification, seemed necessary.

I talked to developer after developer, only to decide that with every custom feature that I wanted and to have an exceptional cart and commerce software solution, that I had to develop the site, from scratch. I wanted an unlimited amount of buyers and sellers and stores - with personal and business profiles, so I had to try to create something unique that didn't exist already.

I had this vision of a global social commerce site that could do everything all the top blockbuster social websites did, in one place. I wanted to facilitate the sale and trade of anything that can be bought and sold, across the web. I wanted it to be like eBay and Amazon, as well. It was time to make E-Commerce - Social and Fun!

After some time and research, I wrote up exactly what the site needed, the programming types required and what functions were going to be necessary.

Moving Forward

3 years later - I'm on the 2nd phase of this social commerce and social curation network.  It was a lot of work and effort to get here. After endless hours of research and interviewing countless freelance developers, I finally got it launched, in Phase 1. (although private).

It was challenging getting this developed because of work distance, costs, funds and lack of web development resources. (at the time of dev, around Sept, 2012).

Things have changed alot! Here is the current revenue for Social Commerce:

Social Commerce - is still in it's infancy. I want to make Hang it, truly SOCIAL.

Over the years, it's given me a few challenges and became discouraging at times, but I never stopped believing that I could build it. It became a creative and design challenge for me. I understood the vision and direction it needed, so I slowly guided it there. I feel invested in this project. Aside from time and a good amount of my own money, I'm just thrilled to finally see this concept become a reality!!

This project has been with me through a few phases of my personal life. 

In the video below, I share my thoughts on the product, my prior and current work experience and a personal story about adversity and triumph and why launching this website and tech startup will be a dream come true for me.
          Campaign

I created a Crowdfunding Campaign, so that I can finish this product, Hang it! 

I’m seeking funding in the amount of: $20,000

The successful funding of that amount would help:

  • Complete Phase 2
  • Get An Adequate Server
  • Secure The Website
  • Create Backend for Cart/Commerce
  • Update Design & Usability
  • Launch in Beta (invitation only)
  • Marketing & Optimization
  • Begin Phase 3 (mobile app)
I need your support to finish it, in this present phase.

Your contributions would help get it completed.

How this product is different from the competition:

Features

I need to raise more funds in this campaign to finish the site and launch it!

My goal is to complete Phase 2 and launch by Fall, to test out the e-commerce, curation and userability and to get valuable feedback from initial users.

I feel passionate about watching it grow and I feel confident about getting it done.  If you've been overly enthused about something before, you get it. :)

Any donation (contribution) would be greatly appreciated. I'm grateful for any small gesture. If you can't donate, share. When you contribute, you get exciting perks!

Perks

$1 - Thank you

You rock! Thanks for your awesome support! =)

$5 - Social Media Shout Out 

For your awesome donation, you: Receive a special thank you message on Facebook and Twitter that will be seen by 25,000 friends and followers.

$10 - Early Access to Web Platform

You’ll get early access to the Social Commerce Network when it launches in beta. Select a username. You also get a thank you blast on Facebook and Twitter.

$25 - Founding Member 

You get the perks listed above. AND: 

  • You get listed on our founding members page on website. 
  • You get 250 guru "bonus" points when you register, once site is live. 
  • You have access to pre-launch news, added features and will be invited to sign up when the site goes live and gain some beta invitations to share with friends! 
  • You have the opportunity to pick a good username. (it's a reason some internet and social media marketers rush to sign up on new social networks).

$35 - Founding Member & T-Shirt 

You get the perks listed above. AND: 

  • You get to decide the best t-shirt design for both men's and women's style. These tees will be fun to wear once you hear the name of the site and choose ideas! You receive the crowd favorited t-shirt, after the site officially launches! 
  •  You gain 350 guru "rewards" points when you register, once site is live. 
  •  You have priority email notification access over the perks listed above that will allow you to register on the site sooner, to choose a username.

$50 - Blogger/Writer & Style Curator 

You get the perks listed above. AND: 

  • You gain 500 guru "rewards" points when you register, once site is live.
  •  You're invited to become one of our "featured: guest blogger or style curator.
  • You will have a "featured blogger/curator" badge on your photos and profile.
  • You will be featured on our Founding Members - Authority Expert's Page.

$60 - VIP Launch Party 

You get the perks listed above. AND:  

  • You gain 600 guru "rewards" points when you register, once site is live.
  •  You're invited to be our VIP Guest at our launch party, in Orlando, Florida. (transportation or accomodations, are not included). 
  • Complimentary admission, open bar, appetizers and entertainment, included.

$75 - Featured Expert 

You get the perks listed above. AND:  

  • You gain 750 guru "rewards" points when you register, once site is live.
  •  You will be featured on our Founding Members - Authority Expert's Page.
  • You will have a "featured expert" badge on your photos and profile.
  • Featured experts should already be skilled and reputable in their area/niche.
  • You'll get higher priority access to choosing your username, when you register.
  • Experts accepted: Marketers, Small Businesses, Media, Service Providers, Celebrities, Brands, Stores, Entrepreneurs, Consultants, Writers, Etc...

$100 - Vendor Perk 

You get the perks listed above. AND:  

  • You'll also gain 1,000 rewards points
  • You'll be featured on our founding member's featured sponsor's page.
  • You'll get higher priority access to choosing your username, when you register.
  • You'll receive a social media marketing promotion at your venue. This perk may include marketing, promotions, design, web development and advertising and sponsorship opportunities for your website or local events.

$200 - Advisor/Mastermind 

You get the perks listed above. AND:  

  • You'll also gain 2,000 guru rewards points.
  • You'll be featured on our founding member's - Mastermind Advisor's Page.
  • You will have a "featured advisor" badge on your photos and profile.
  • Advisors should already be skilled and reputable in their expertise or niche.
  • You get higher priority access to choosing your username, when you register.
  • Advisors accepted: Internet Marketers, Small Business Owners, Entrepreneurs, Coaches, Consultants, E-Commerce Experts, Social Media Marketers, Etc...
  • Advisors may receive: group tele-coaching mastermind/advisor fees.

Your Perk, Your Way 

You may donate any amount you wish, just because... 

Have an idea for an interesting perk? 

Email: nancy @ socialmediax. com - to discuss opportunities. 


Market Opportunity

Campaign Impact

I plan to have a team of advisors and marketing partners who can assist with the strategy and implementation, before & after the site launches, in the beta phase.

I can hire staff once the site is live, getting traffic and generating revenue, at that point,  I may seek additional private funding, angel investors and co-founders. 

Risks & Challenges

I plan to complete this website. But, even best- laid plans can go awry.

These possibilities do exist: 

  1. There may be risks and obstacles that come up before launch.
  2. All of the features may not be fully completed in this phase.
  3. I can launch this site and no one wants to use it . ( that would suck though :)

Ways You Can Help

Contribute! Pick a Perk and make a donation. The first week of a campaign is very important to the success of the funding goal and campaign, overall, so, if you can, consider contributing as soon as you're able to, don't wait. Thank you.

Some people just can't contribute, I get it. Here are other ways to help:

  • Ask friends to get the word out and make some noise about this campaign.
  • Remind them to use the Indiegogo and Facebook share tools! Thank you!!

What's Next

Pick a perk. Help fund a dream. :)

As an entrepreneur, having a dream realized, means so much! 

I would love to have the support of my community to bring it to market.

Website 

Sign up here for an email notice of when we intend to launch publicly.
You will receive a beta invitation when one becomes available.

Thank you

~ Nancy Arroyo Perez

www.fundnancy.com

http://the-social-commerce-network.launchrock.com/

story:
See crypto contribution addresses here!
Read the covered story at CoinTelegraph.com!  We're making progress!


What is BuyAnyCoin, what's our vision?

BuyAnyCoin is a natural creation from the demand of the cryptocurrency market. So, what are doing? We are giving a physical face to a virtual product - and by doing that we are bridging the gap the digital currency economy has been bottlenecked by.  Merchants are accepting bitcoin faster than customers are spending it - but that is about to change!

*     *     *

Imagine this:

You walk in to your local convenience store, grab a drink and head to the register.  In your peripheral vision you catch a glance of a card on the counter, that says BuyAnyCoin Voucher. You ask the cashier about the card - she tells you, "You just redeem it at their website for any of the popular digital currencies like bitcoin".




Oh, sweet, you think to yourself.  This is awesome; I figured out how to get bitcoins a few months ago, but what a hassle!  This seems way easier - just grab the card and go.

*     *     *

Yes - 'figuring out' how to get bitcoin (or any other digital currency) has been one of the biggest hurdles to get over for someone curious about the technology.  Even die-hard geeks that understand how amazing it is to be able to manage your finances with futuristic tools and applications have had difficulty cobbling together a good plan to get started.  But these are just temporary problems; the internet made this technology possible, and now it is going to make it REAL.

There's no reason you shouldn't have the power and speed of digital currency at your fingertips while stopping at the gas station to buy a beverage.   With BuyAnyCoin's marketing strategy, the average individual is finally given direct physical access to a virtual product. This is the best gateway to adoption, giving the customer something they already know and connecting it to something they want to use; digital currency!

Digital currency is moving from the high-tech space to public relevance, and BuyAnyCoin is here to accelerate that transition by both understanding and appealing to real people.  Instead of asking them to change their habits to try something new, we're aligning with their existing habits and legitimizing the next generation of financial technology - literally before their very eyes.

Our company is not a bet on the success of Bitcoin alone, but rather an investment in the millions of people and billions of man-hours already spent building this unprecedented new industry which already blows the competition away.  Digital financial tech is ready to be put in the hands of the everyday consumer!

Your Dollars Making Sense

BuyAnyCoin is looking for $10,000 to engage our online retail market and finish development for our merchant partnerships. The money will also provide initial operating capital and enable a first-round production of our gift cards.
Development - We have a fast, stable, sleek web application that serves as the hub for our selected cryptos and assets (BAC Web App). What we need to develop is a merchant-accessible back end that will allow new merchants to sign up, receive cards and be able to settle balances on accounts with us. To ensure we can stretch our dollars the furthest we contract with a friend and developer in India who provides a great price-to skill-ratio.


Operating Capital - Every business needs operating capital; we are not unique in this charge. To be able to provide near-instant access to all of the digital currencies we provide, we will need to have a stock of them. This ultimately will require a small but liquid amount of money that can freely move in and out of digital currencies.



Gift Card Production - Our very first gift card run will be through a 3rd-party card manufacture costing us about $600-$800 for the first 1,000 cards. After we get our first cards and merchant partners, we'll acquire a printer to manufacture the cards in-house. The card printer we priced is $1,800 which will give us a better ROI per card in the long run than the 3rd-party solution.


PERKS PERKS PERKS!
If anyone has ever heard of Coinbase, they might remember that when they first got funded, they had over 20,000 applicants apply for positions. Well, a few of our perks are going to provide you direct insider access to BuyAnyCoin. We want you to get involved, see us grow and potentially become a valued member of BuyAnyCoin! What better reward is there than to donate to a growing company and be able to be a part of that growth from then on?
**We would love to give people some of our first round production gift cards but with regulatory concerns with money law restrictions we cannot do this, sorry!**

The Impact; The Social Significance

No fraud, no chargebacks, money anywhere in the world within seconds, unprecedented security of your money. The impact of widespread adoption of digital currencies is enormous. If merchants can save thousands and pass those saving to you by 10-20% off goods because they don't need a fraud department, why are you not using digital currency?  If you can send money to your best friend without massive fees, why are you not using digital currencies?

The answer is simple, BuyAnyCoin hasn't launched yet!  Right now, the hardest part about using digital currencies is acquiring them in the first place.  We're going to make this as easy as buying a bag of Doritos!

Everest In The Eyes Of BuyAnyCoin (aka challenges)

Our biggest challenge is going to be education of customers.  We are watching the adoption rate of bitcoin and other digital currencies rise around the world, but it will happen a lot faster when we successfully educate our customers.

This is why, as you can see in our introductory video, we promote the three primary benefits of digital currencies (Security, Logistics, and Irreversibility), and do NOT focus on price.  We will be putting out a blog post with an in-depth explanation of these primary benefits soon!

Wanna Help But Lack The Dough? No Problem...

We understand that not everyone can contribute financially to the company but that does not mean you cannot be involved and help!

We have tons of ideas that need to happen and we need people just like you, people that want to help make positive change. 

Here is a list of awesome projects and tasks we need help with regardless of money!

  • Social Media sharing:    FACEBOOK    TWITTER
  • Tell your friends and family about BuyAnyCoin!
  • Make a BuyAnyCoin account and provide feedback on features and usability!
  • Blog posts and PR - organic traffic is priceless!
  • Media kit designs

If BuyAnyCoin inspires you to contribute your time and effort towards our vision of financial evolution, definitely get in touch with us at team@buyanycoin.com!

The volunteers we need (but are not limited to)

  • Social Media Manager 
  • US based Javascript/Meteor Developer
  • Customer Service and Support

Prefer To Donate Your Favorite Crypto? (Awesome!)

See updates page for contribution addresses!


_____________________________________________________________________________


FAQ

Why we started the Company - We all recognized a vital missing link in the digital currency ecosystem and asked ourselves, if not us, who will make this a reality?

What problems do we solve - We are connecting to people with something they're already doing (this model is already being used to process billions of dollars with gift cards for products like iTunes and Facebook).  We are solving digital currency's biggest hindrance; getting it into the hands of the people in a way they are already comfortable with. We are the central hub and access point for digital currencies.

Why we will be successful - We know the market, we know what people want and we can deliver. Additionally, we have a pipeline of updates that will continue to empower our customers and only serve to strengthen our position. Our level of planning goes beyond a single year; we are thinking many years in the future and positioning ourselves to capitalize on the market when it catches up with our planning.

Thanks for your time!  We can't wait to start working with some of the ideas YOU bring to the table!
