story:
Help us Connect Startups all over the world!

What is StartupBlink?

StartupBlink is a massive global map connecting the startup ecosystem with the information and resources necessary for success. The project includes tens of thousands of startups, coworking spaces, accelerators, startup organizations, tech reporters, influencers and much more. StartupBlink and its team were featured in dozens of magazines including Forbes, TNW and CNN.

All around the world new startups appear every day, representing a universal and collective human drive to create innovative solutions for the problems we all face.

However, the startup ecosystem lacks a globally organized meeting, information, and resource nexus for all its active members.

That is exactly what we are building, and need your help to complete it.  


We officially launched the StartupBlink global startup map in October 2014. Since then, thousands of startups, coworking spaces and accelerators have registered on our platform. To date, StartupBlink has appeared in dozens of magazines, including Forbes, CNN, and Business Insider. You can view all articles in our blog. 


Even Guy Kawasaki thinks StartupBlink is a cool project.

We agree! The project is cool, but we want to take the platform a step further. Currently, StartupBlink offers a graphic display of each local startup hub, and allows thousands of startups, coworking spaces, accelerators, tech reporters and similar organizations to add themselves to the map.

We also allow users to filter these thousands of entities by industry and location, and the entities can share their milestones and news on the map by Blinking.

Seeing thousands of Blinks from startups around the world is exciting, and shows the potential of the platform to become an invaluable communication tool for the global startup ecosystem.



We aim to help founders improve the survival rate of their startups and achieve growth by connecting them with relevant information and resources.

StartupBlink will not only become a global resource for the startup ecosystem, but it will hopefully help to change the way startup founders are able to communicate with each other.

Many founders around the world are working on the same problems and solutions in isolation, and lack a way to communicate with other relevant startups teams. Startups often fail due to a lack of communication and an inability to connect to critical resources. StartupBlink bridges this gap.

Here are our numbers so far:

StartupBlink also aims to help global startups gain traction and receive valuable feedback. Startups from traditional "startup hubs" such as San Francisco and London have a much better chance of receiving favorable press, acquiring investment, finding mentors, and hiring high quality team members than startups in developing countries. By building a global platform, StartupBlink will narrow this gap and create an open channel of communication between startup founders around the world.


We want to keep the platform open and free for all startups while continuing to add features and functionality geared toward entrepreneurs.

If you’re reading this, you’re probably interested in helping the startup ecosystem grow, and you want to support innovation and entrepreneurship. Our team has worked for over a year with limited resources to build the current platform. Now we turn to you with the existing model as a proof to our commitment to this project, and we ask for your support to help us continue making the platform better and more interactive.

We are confident that if we have your help, StartupBlink will truly be the world’s first global startup ecosystem hub.


One of the most exciting developments we have had so far is the voluntary participation of dozens of Ambassadors from around the world in developing the map. For us, the ambassadors are committed local startup leaders who want to push their startup ecosystems to the next level.

StartupBlink is also making connections between entrepreneurs offline. We are working hard on establishing hundreds of meetups around the world with the help of our ambassadors. Your support will help us accelerate the facilitation of these global meetups.

In addition to startups companies, StartupBlink connects many other assets within the global startup ecosystem. We are big fans of the coworking concept, and we are proud to have more than 700 coworking spaces registered on the map.

As well as coworking spaces, hundreds of accelerators and startup-related organizations are also registered on the map. We have even added a startup reporters section where startups can share their story and receive press coverage in their relevant industries.

Even more, we’re mapping global startup Influencers from around the world - startup leaders with proven track records in the local startup ecosystem who act as both sources of inspiration and potential mentors for entrepreneurs.

We will soon add more new areas to the platform, including sections for investors, startup resources, and startup events, each with integrated search filters.  


The Founders of StartupBlink are Roderick Warren, an American-Swiss entrepreneur, and Eli David, an Israeli entrepreneur.  Both Eli and Roderick are startup fanatics, constantly working on their own startups while mentoring others and participating in startup events around the world. 


Just like our startups, our life stories are far from ordinary. Eli had a normal life as an accountant working for firms such as BDO and KPMG, and then 5 years ago decided to become a digital nomad, constantly changing locations every month or so (Eli's Nomadic blog can be seen Here). 

Roderick was a Specialist in Fire Protection and Emergency Management in conflict zones such as Iraq and Kosovo before pivoting to become a startup founder.  

We are fortunate to have with us an amazing team from all over the world helping us developing our site and community:


Your money will make StartupBlink truly interactive. 

The current platform provides a wealth of information in an intuitive interface, but doesn't support interaction and communication between startups as well as it could. We would like to build up features that support interaction within the site and further develop the ideas of Blinking your milestones and connecting you to relevant resources customized to your needs.  

We are now working on building an extension to the site that will allow your project to receive feedback and reviews from the StartupBlink community, giving you valuable insight into things you should consider changing,

We will also add 3 new sections to the map:

1) An Investor section that will allow startups to pitch directly to investors.

2) A Resources section with startup resources filtered by location and subject.

3) An Events section which will filter relevant startup events by dates and locations.

We will continue to work on a new feature that will allow everyone to create their own individual startup map. These maps can be customized and embedded easily in any website.

We will create hundreds of active startup meetups around the world, and will focus on helping local startup ecosystems grow in developing countries.

We will greatly improve the amount of data available within the platform and create a startup information hub for each local startup ecosystem, updated in real time.

In order to accomplish all our plans, $30K is the bare minimum. However, $100K would allow us to continue improving the platform well into 2016.


Our list of Perks is quite varied! First and foremost, the biggest perk is knowing that by supporting us, you are supporting the global startup ecosystem itself. Your funding will help the StartupBlink platform become more valuable to users and founders, and we all thank you for that.

In addition, we have some practical perks that will help your startup or organization grow and gain traction.

You can become a sponsor on our global sponsor map:


You can also appear as a sponsor in your local meetup group:


Have a “Check It Out” Box pointing to your project appear at the left corner of the screen every time someone zooms into your city:

We have perks to feature your startup on our Newsletter and Social media, consutling perks to help you get advice and build your executive summary or marketing plan, and much more.

Simply pick the one most relevant perk to you, and help us grow the global startup community!

Every perk purchased supplies us with oxygen to keep on working on this great platform. 


Help us spread the word about StartupBlink and encourage other startups, coworking spaces and accelerators to add themselves to the StartupBlink map.  

Follow StartupBlink on 

Twitter, Facebook, Google+, Linkedin, Newsletter 

You can also join one of our Meetups

We can't wait to see you on the StartupBlink map!

From all of us at StartupBlink, thank you for your support!

story:
I am from Austin Texas and a graduating senior from McCombs School of Business. For my last semester of college I am studying abroad in Copenhagen, Denmark. I am part Danish and would love the opportunity to experience the best Nordic cuisine but it is costly. With your help I can enjoy a meal and record my experience so it may be shared with others. I will be grateful for any support provided.

http://noma.dk/

Check out the gallery featuring some of my previous work

story:
Owning your own woodland in Scotland will be a very eco friendly pastime to enjoy even if we have to share it with fellow owners.

Nature lovers will find the flaura, fauna and wildlife to their liking in the scots pine woodland currently on sale for £55,500 being 9 and a half acres approximately, near to Carrbridge in the Highlands of Scotland.

Here is the link to Stuirt Wood

Own Your Own Woodland

All contributors to buying our own woodland would have equal access no matter how much or how little their contribution, it should be said that there are rules and regulations, basically common sense, i.e. keep the peace, no litter, please try not to fall out with the neighbours, no permanent building etc. all the rules can be perused on the website : www.woodlands.co.uk

The power of crowdfunding means that for the price of a lottery ticket £2 can buy you your own woodland shared with 27,749 other co-owners. What could be next, maybe we could crowdfund to buy our own island, maybe we could start buying each other houses? the list is endless. To make this work, please share far and wide around the globe or even just around Scotland would work.
story_txt: Owning your own woodland in Scotland will be a very eco friendly pastime to enjoy even if we have to share it with fellow owners. Nature lovers will find the flaura, fauna and wildlife to their liking in the scots pine woodland currently on sale for £55,500 being 9 and a half acres approximately, near to Carrbridge in the Highlands of Scotland.Here is the link to Stuirt WoodOwn Your Own WoodlandAll contributors to buying our own woodland would have equal access no matter how much or how little their contribution, it should be said that there are rules and regulations, basically common sense, i.e. keep the peace, no litter, please try not to fall out with the neighbours, no permanent building etc. all the rules can be perused on the website : www.woodlands.co.ukThe power of crowdfunding means that for the price of a lottery ticket £2 can buy you your own woodland shared with 27,749 other co-owners. What could be next, maybe we could crowdfund to buy our own island, maybe we could start buying each other houses? the list is endless. To make this work, please share far and wide around the globe or even just around Scotland would work.

story:
Economics

MoorCoin Digital is presenting the decentralized market to the African Diaspora. MoorCoin Digital is developing the MoorA coin specifically to build a direct global business to business, business to consumer and consumer to consumer connection amongst the African Diaspora. 

The MoorCoin Digital motto is “Think Globally, Act Locally” and it’s referring to using the MoorA coin to make purchases globally, with the convenience of a local purchase. Anyone can own the MoorA coin, but initially only African Diaspora owned businesses will be given access to the MoorA coin (other businesses will be granted access at a later date) because our unequivocal goal is to showcase the African Diaspora buying power, recycle African Diaspora money and build a direct global b2b, b2c and c2c connection. 

Reward points are available via the NXT Asset Exchange (Nxt is the foremost 2nd-gen cryptocurrency) and the MoorA coin via CoinPrism (A Bitcoin 2.0 company).
To sign up for a FREE NXT address visit trade.secureae.com;
FULFILLED - First 10 sign ups* - 1000 MoorCoins Stock + 10 NXT Coins and up to 10 MoorA**.
FULFILLED -Next 10 sign ups* - 800 MoorCoins Stock + 10 NXT Coins and up to 7 MoorA**.
FULFILLED -Next 30 sign ups* - 400 MoorCoins Stock + 10 NXT Coins and up to 3.5 MoorA**.
Next 50 sign ups* - 200 MoorCoins Stock + 10 NXT Coins and up to 1.75 MoorA**.
Last 50 sign ups* - 100 MoorCoins Stock + 10 NXT Coins and up to .875 MoorA**.

* Email your NXT address and public key to info@moorcoin.com to receive your sign up bonus.

** To receive your MoorA you must sign up for our Su Su Savings Game - Nation Building Fund.

For more information about the MoorCoin and how it directly will affect Black Economics visit our website at www.moorcoin.org.

Current State

Currently, Black/African Americans have about 1 trillion dollars in buying power.

This enormous amount of money pours out of our community before it has exchanged hands with another member of our community twice. In comparison to others communities, money is exchanged a minimum of 4 times before it leaves the community. 

Black/African American Communities are burdened with high unemployment, high crime, poor police interactions, poor schools, poor supermarkets... I think you get it.


The Republic of Alkebulan Community Organization

The Republic of Alkebulan Community Organization (The RAC) will be a filed as a 501(c)(3) non-profit. A nonprofit organization is exempt from federal income tax if its activities have the following purposes: charitable, religious, educational, scientific, literary, testing for public safety, fostering amateur sports competition, or preventing cruelty to children or animals.
Some plans we have with the organization are;
  • Organize after-school programs
  • Organize transportation from public/private schools to after-school programs 
  • Put together a peace core of officers to protect Black/African American interests


What We Need & What You Get

A breakdown:

  • Support - Signing up for MoorCoin Digital, gives you an opportunity to initially earn up to 1,000 MoorCoins Reward Points, 10 NXT coins and 10 MoorA. 
  • Promote - We have programs where by just gathering contact information from your friends/family or black businesses you gain bonus MoorCoins reward points.
  • Invest - Take your newfound MoorCoins reward points and buy and trade on the "NXT™ Asset Exchange" to continue to build value.


The Impact

The difference your contribution will make to our community is an incalculable asset. By spreading the word, you're introducing our brothers and sisters to money management, savings, and investment in one short phrase... 'Start with MoorCoin Digital today!' 


Risks & Challenges

  • Convincing those unfamiliar or uncertain about digital currency (or the Internet <X_X>) to feel comfortable working with a new age idea.
  • We plan on working directly with businesses and people uncomfortable with the idea of having assets live in the cloud by discussing security, checks and balances, and using testimonials of others to reassure them that this is the real deal.


Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help:

  • Share, share, share! Word of mouth promotion is still the name of the game, but, a viral campaign is a very close second. Share on all social networks (shout out to Tributaree.com) and let's keep the momentum alive.

story:
Greetings!

     My name is Deborah Stewart. Proud mother of a wonderful son, my educational background at Liberty University is in Psychology/Christian Counseling. I am a member of the National Association for Christian Counselors (NACC)  and The National Society for Collegiate Scholars (NSCS.) An artist with a background in theater, I also enjoy jewelry design, garden and interior design, cake decorating, singing, writing and illustrating.
     I am sorry that I do not have the proper formatted images to share with you; the jpegs from my publisher do not work; I've tried. But if you click on the link provided in my campaign, you will be led to my website- which will provide you with the images of both my book cover and my logo (which I have designed myself.)
     My pen name is Queen Dreama; a character I have created for children of all ages to advocate the importance of following your heart's dream. To realize and believe in your heart's dream is the beginning of discovering who you are, who you were created to be, and why you are here.
     The Arbor Day Foundation has partnered with me in promoting the preservation of our trees through the current WestBow Press release of my first young reader's book: "The Magic Toy Tree." 
     My book is the first in a series of seven which advocates family, the love of children, and the "magic" of God's miracles- one of which is our "living treasures: trees." My ultimate goal is to grow the humble beginnings of my own business in order that I may help to feed the hungry in a very special way. 
      Will you help me provide seeds, tools, flyers and plots of earth in order that both children and parents will learn how to save seeds, to grow their own healthy, organic food and how to preserve it? A meal feeds only once: a good, healthy garden feeds; forever.
     I am seeking an overall campaign goal of $5,000.00 in order to establish "Queen Dreama Enterprises;" my own multi-faceted business. I am qualified and prepared to become successful enough to make a difference in the lives of many of our forgotten/ignored hungry and hurting children. Though I have managed to publish my book, create my first website and outline the courses I will be offering in the near future, I lack the remaining required "seed money" to make this dream come true. Without the proper book launch, waiting for enough royalties from my publisher (which is how my book sales are currently set up) to take my business to the next level will take "forever." Hurting, innocent children experience "forever" each day that they suffer with hunger. 
     My business expenses thus far have prevented me from taking the next important step to succeed. I need to be able to buy inventory and to launch and market my book in the manner in which I have studied for the past five years. The sooner I can put my marketing skills into place the sooner I will reach my ultimate goal of being able to give back via feeding our hungry children and helping children of all ages to believe in themselves and the power of making your heart's dream come true. I am preparing life-courses based upon my life-experience and my college education which will also promote and expedite my ultimate goal.
     If I reach my campaign goal of $5,000.00 and am able to purchase my own inventory and properly launch my first book, for each $20.00 donation I will send you a signed, first-edition copy of "The Magic Toy Tree" as a remembrance of your selfless part in feeding hungry children and helping to promote the preservation of our trees. (Information on joining The Arbor Day Foundation is in my book.) I will keep your donations on file, and for each additional $20.00 donation increment, I will also send you a signed, first-edition copy of the upcoming books in the series. ($20.00; I will send a signed copy of "The Magic Toy Tree", $40.00; I will also send you a signed copy of the second book in the series "The Wishing Tree", $60.00; I will also send you a signed copy of the next two books in the series- and so on. You may acquire an entire first-edition collection of these very special books. For contributions of $100.00 or more, you will also receive a free e-book stub; downloadable on any "readable" device. Future editions of this and my other books in the series will be in color format.
     All funds received, whether I reach my campaign goal or not, will go toward my ultimate goal while simultaneously promoting the Arbor Day Foundation; both in my book and in my public speaking engagements. 
     We all know that life can be unkind. I have known many disappointments. I have known the loss of everything. I have known hunger; and I know that of all the dragons we must fight in this world- hunger is the most terrible. But as they say, "You cannot kill one who has dreamed a dream like mine." That is why I began from "ground-zero", and in my fifties- picked myself up, educated myself and determined that I would do everything in my power to help as many children as possible to be freed from the indescribable pain and horror of hunger. A meal only feeds once. A good, healthy garden feeds forever. 
     That-is my heart's dream. Now, at 60- the realization of that dream is within my reach- with your love and help.
     I realize that not everyone can contribute. But won't you share this campaign with others in order to help me reach my goal? I know that if I am able to purchase my own inventory and use it as a spring-board for my business, that within the next twelve months we will see the fruit of our labors become a beautiful reality. I will share the good news with you. And even though each child helped may not be able to personally say "thank you;" you will know in your heart that you have done a sacred, beautiful thing. 
     If you should ever forget just how important your contribution is- just go to your library and take out your copy(ies) of "The Magic Toy Tree" series and read your inscription again. Share it with the children in your life, and remember how good love feels. 
God's Love to You;
Queen Dreama

story:
The money raised will help to offset the cost of expanding to a new market. Having the help of like minded individuals that want to aid in supporting a small business owner in growing would be what I would need to be successful.

The cost of launching a second shop means having to buy double what I already have in order to be successful from launch.

The money raised will go to offset the cost of retail equipment (cases, cash register, shelving, electrical), inventory, and advertising.

The ultimate goal is to take this hard working single mother of four with a great small business and expand the opportunity to be able to offer a better alternative to smoking tobacco based products.

Vaporizers are taking the world by storm and we want to share the love of a cleaner way to smoke with the world. By expanding our brand we can serve a larger community.

story:
True PASSION

I would like to take a minute to thank everyone who has contributed to my first Indiegogo fundraiser. My goal hasn’t been reached yet, but I’m grateful for every donation and I’ve learned a lot. This campaign has led to a new Non-Profit direction for myself and Holy Grailz which is better than a trailer. I’m on a mission to help fight hunger. Please like the new Facebook page to stay in the loop. Thank you :)

https://www.facebook.com/projectrepurpose

The Purpose

There are 17 million kids in America that have no idea where their next meal is coming from. At the same time, we are throwing away 40% of the food produced. Please help me form this community based Non-Profit to help fight hunger in our local and surrounding areas. I plan to start right here in rural Maine where I know there are plenty of families that could use delicious well balanced meals delivered to them every week.

Don't Forget the Chef

Most of you know me as the VW guy now, but let’s not forget about the 16 years I spent working in exclusive culinary arenas prior to restoring bikes and buses. I’ll be honest, I still have a ton of passion for food, but the food in this country has changed drastically over the last few decades. I feel it is my calling to stand up and spread my knowledge about food while helping rectify some of the issues within the food system in our country. 

Win The Bus

This is where you, your donation and your chance to win the bus come into play. It’s ONLY $100 for your entry to win this fully restored bus and 100% of the proceeds will benefit Project Repurpose which will provide delicious well balance meals to people in need. 

The vision

This summer it’s one bus, next summer it’s two buses. This year we provide one million meals, next year we provide two million years. 

Paying it FORWARD

People say Karma is a bitch, but I think she’s beautiful. So everyone that shows me some love and helps create this amazing contest will find their love reciprocated back to them. 

Anyone who donates $100 or more will receive free entry into the contest that I am planning. The contest is still in the works, but the winner will receive the fully restored bus. This is a skilled contest, not a raffle or lottery or randomly selected contest. Each entry will be judged fairly and individually.  Not everyone loves VW’s like I do. Therefore, a CASH prize of $50,000 will be offered to anyone that prefers. Runners up will receive generous cash prizes as well.  

Thank YOU!

I greatly appreciate your support.

story:
Saint Barbe Catholic Church is located in the remote community of Manono in northern Katanga province, DRC.  The church serves as a social hub for the community and provides church services and a variety of social programs for the residents of Manono and surrounding rural villages.  Saint Barbe is also home to a primary and secondary school in Manono with over 700 students.  The mission also runs 9 other small schools in the surrounding villages.

The church has limited means and all income from school fees, rental of rooms in the mission to travelers, and food sold from the kitchen is used to cover operating expenses.

This fundraiser is for some small capital projects including:

1. Solar panels and batteries ($5000). There is a small generator that supplies power for an hour a day but this is turned off when there are no guests at the Mission.  Fuel for the generator is also very expensive.

2. Scholarship fund ($2500). There are orphans and many families who cannot afford to pay the school fees.  This fund would be used to pay for school fees and school supplies for disadvantaged kids.

3. Motor bike ($1500). The church provides outreach to surrounding villages and could greatly benefit from having its own motor bike.

4. Sports equipment and supplies for youth program ($1000).  There are many young boys and girls who would benefit from sports equipment (soccer balls and nets, skipping ropes, etc.), board games, and art supplies.


Yves and Lance

story:
Who Are We?

St Mary's Scorpions are a university cheerleading team based at St Mary's in Twickenham. We are an all-girl, non-profit, competitive cheerleading team and we are currently 1st, 2nd and 3rd place National Champions. We compete annually as well as perform at local events within the university. Furthermore, we fundraise all year round to fund our successes and have been known to raise 12,500 pounds in just one year to put towards improving our facilities and competition fees/travel etc.

What We Need 

In the past 2 years, YOU have helped us raise thousands of pounds,  YOU have helped us get Twickenham on the map and YOU have supported us on the road to being National Champions.
We need YOUR help to continue this legacy and remain champions! Every little helps and we are grateful of any contributions. In addition to this, if any companies would like to discuss sponsorship we are more than happy to accommodate & discuss advertising opportunities etc.
Every penny is a brick on the road to success... Thank you for your help and continued support.
Scorpions x
story_txt:
Who Are We? St Mary's Scorpions are a university cheerleading team based at St Mary's in Twickenham. We are an all-girl, non-profit, competitive cheerleading team and we are currently 1st, 2nd and 3rd place National Champions. We compete annually as well as perform at local events within the university. Furthermore, we fundraise all year round to fund our successes and have been known to raise 12,500 pounds in just one year to put towards improving our facilities and competition fees/travel etc.   What We Need 
In the past 2 years, YOU have helped us raise thousands of pounds,  YOU have helped us get Twickenham on the map and YOU have supported us on the road to being National Champions.
We need YOUR help to continue this legacy and remain champions! Every little helps and we are grateful of any contributions. In addition to this, if any companies would like to discuss sponsorship we are more than happy to accommodate & discuss advertising opportunities etc.
Every penny is a brick on the road to success... Thank you for your help and continued support.Scorpions x

story:
Short Summary

My name is Nancy Nelson, I love to read and I love books, and my intent is to bring Barefoot Cowgirl Books, a new bookstore and newsstand, to downtown Flagstaff.   I'm totally in on this project--all of my savings are dedicated to this effort, but I need some financial assistance (and bookshelves) to make it happen.  Please help! This would be a Great Thing for the community!

The revitalization of downtown Flagstaff has been terrific, but in my humble opinion we are ready for something both different and reminiscent.  The local folks miss McGaugh's, a bookstore and newsstand, which closed a couple of years ago.  I'd like to bring an independent bookstore back to downtown Flagstaff in a different way.  Barefoot Cowgirl Books will be a haven for readers, news-seekers, and book-lovers, a "light under the covers."  A place where the locals and out-of-town visitors can browse, buy, and bring their kids for story-time.  We will host book events, writing and publishing workshops, and book clubs.  I would also like to provide a venue for local authors to sell and perhaps publish their books (maybe a cookbook with recipes from local restaurants?), and to partner with the wonderful Flagstaff public library and literacy volunteers to promote reading and a love of the printed page.  

My own money will pay for the Barefoot Cowgirl Books' business start-up costs, securing a location, and a bunch of books.  I need help to buy some comfy chairs and to stock the store with even more books, cards, toys, art, and perhaps some classic vinyl and local musicians' CDs.  And to buy bookshelves!

The campaign will continue past the target date.  If I reach my goal by August 1, we expect to have Barefoot Cowgirl Books open October 1, 2015.   My pledge to you is that, if I do not open Barefoot Cowgirl Books by May 1, 2016, I will return everyone's money to them in full.

If I exceed my goal, I will be able to begin the publishing venture with local authors (perhaps a "coffee table" book of local artists' work?), buy an espresso machine, put a puppet theater or train set in the children's book section.   I pledge to keep as much of this money local as possible.

Even the tiniest contribution is so appreciated!  If you don't have any funds to contribute, I completely understand and I'd still like your ideas and suggestions and good thoughts!  If you'd like more information, please contact me.  I have a business plan and have joined the American Booksellers Association.  I can answer your questions on how this will work.

We have a webpage www.barefootcowgirlbooks.com and a Facebook page, check us out!

THANK YOU! And please share the campaign!

story:
Highlander's  New Brewery  and School

About three years ago, shortly after Highlander Brew Co began production in South River,  the new highway through Northern Ontario was rerouted past the village.  During that time Highlander Brew Co has grown by distributing beer throughout Ontario. We have added a few fermenter tanks to the original brewery and have outgrown the small rented space we currently share with another local business. However the rest of the community has not grown. Rather than move away, Highlander with the support of the local and regional community will create a destination brewery that would encourage tourism in the area and provide a focal point for music, art and social events.  The new brewery will also become a  brewer technician school in association with a local college. The village has secured funding for a new building to house the new brewery destination. Now with some help from you we can complete the project .

The School at Highlander Brew Co 

With the support  of other craft breweries in Ontario along  with the local community college Highlander will establish a brewer technician school within the brewery itself.  It will be a practical apprenticeship  program. The program will be available at minimal cost that will help  graduates find a rewarding  job immediately after the  6 month program is complete. 


The Highlander Music Room 

The  brewery has always held musical events  that showcased local artists. This draws the community together and makes it attractive to visitors. We want to expand this activity and the new building being provided by the village will allow us to do that. 



Your  contribution will help us equip the event centre (light, sound, and furniture) and the technical school (lab  equipment,materials etc.  ) . It will also help Highlander expand its marketing program to make the whole project  sustainable for the long term. 


We have some good stuff for you 

Like you we have worked hard for what we have.  In return for your hard earned money we are offering excellent rewards including four premium exotic beers.

In addition to any reward listed you will get:

• An ofﬁcial Highlander Board of Advisors certificate

• $10 off your next visit to the Highlander retail store.

Whether you contribute or not, you are always welcome at Highlander brewery where there is a cold one waiting for you.


The Four Special Beers We are Making for You 

These four unique beers in special 750ml bottles are our special thank you.

These four beer come in three packaging options:

  • Single 750ml bottle - $20
  • Case (12 bottles) - $200
  • Distributor pack (10 Cases) - $1,700


Spring

This English Style IPA like you never had before is based on Chinook, Centennial and Cascade hops with 2 Row crystal malt. Spring is in every sip and the soft Labrador tea and wintergreen flavour wakes your senses to the new spring . With a slight bite at IBU 40 and a 6.0 % alcohol, this is a refreshing and invigorating experience. Think of the rush of scent while walking through a forest in spring!

Summer

A rollicking good time. Aged in Tequila barrels this beer has a light honey colour. Additional flavour comes from the prickly pear, lime rinds, and Himalayan mountain salt. For this full flavoured summer beer we use Flaked rye, Maris malt and other German wheat malt. ABV 5.4 and IBU 30 – A well balanced summer beer.

Autumn

Fall is an English Nut Brown style of ale that uses apple wood smoked beached hazelnut which grows wild at the brewery near Algonquin Park. The use of Maris malt gives the beer a rich profile. Our friend M. Rheault  who makes a fantastic whiskey has provided the oak chips and whiskey barrels for aging, which provide the deep flavoured whiskey scent to the beer.. ABV 5.4 with IBU 38. Depth with a slight bite but great balance.

Winter

Winter will be a comfort beer. Intense profound flavours deriving from locally produced organic honey, along with subtle amounts of cinnamon, ginger and orange zest to remind you of all the warmth and comfort of winter evenings snuggling around the fireplace. It will be 8% ABV and low IBU of 32 to keep it smooth and balanced. Picture the sleigh ride across the snowy fields and coming home to a full rich balanced beer.


When you visit the brewery

You can stay nearby with our friends at Northern Edge Algonquin. This is a multi cabin resort where you can experience the best the outdoors has to offer with all the comforts of home as well as a chef. Northern Edge has selected  a newly renovated 100 year old cabin to be named    " Highlander House". They have also offered special discounts to friends of Highlander Brew Co who wish to stay there.

A beautiful place to stay in any season.


Delivery

We prefer you come to the new brewery and pick up your beer. For those of you that make it to our brewery to pick up your reward we will give you $10 off anything in our retail store.   There is a variety of beer regulations in North America and this will determine when and how we ship to you. Rather than list all these programs here we will advise you  individually how we will ship the beer if you or your proxy cannot pick it up at the brewery.

Brewery Address: 19 Howard St. South River, Ontario, P0A 1X0

If you are an importer/distributor and wish to arrange for larger shipments to the USA or other Canadian provinces for resale please contact Dwayne Wanner: dwanner@highlanderbrewco.com


Other ways to help

If you cannot contribute. there other ways for you to help out.

  • Help spread the word about Highlander Brew Co and our campaign by sending friends and family to this  address 
  • Buy our current beer offerings at your local LCBO in Ontario..
  • Visit us at the brewery or one of our many events throughout the year. To see where we are going to be check out our events page: Events

If you have not heard of us and want to learn a little more about the beer we currently offer and where you can find it, check out our website: http://highlanderbrewco.com

story:
Short Summary

I am seeking to fund the establishment of CAFFiEND'S Cafe & Real BBQ in Panama City, Florida.  We want to provide Panama City with a unique quality restaurant experience and real BBQ with a full service drive thru.  CAFFiEND'S is a locally-grown small business in Panama City, Fl.  It is time to bring it front and center once and for all with a full service drive-through and BBQ on Beck Avenue.  Your contributions will allow us to purchase the property and the proper licensing to fully establish CAFFiEND'S Cafe & Real BBQ as an established brand and household name in Panama City, Florida.  

What We Need & What You Get

I am looking to fund the purchase of a property on Beck Avenue that is ready to be open for business.  The owner is asking $25,000 for a down payment with owner financing of the property which has 100 ft of street front and is 132 ft deep. It is equipped with restaurant equipment, two drive thru windows and a BBQ grill and all the tables and chairs needed.  Funding for this entrepreneurial project will serve to benefit the community at large as CAFFiEND'S has a five star rating and is a huge supporter and facilitator of the local arts and culture in Northwest, Florida. Members of the community will receive the highest quality service and products from CAFFiEND'S Cafe & Real BBQ and in addition you are invited to attend all of the great live music and food events. In the event funding is not fully reached the funds raised will be used to continue the CAFFiEND'S name in Bay County.

The Impact

Your contributions make all the difference big or small.  CAFFiEND'S Coffee & Tea is a small business that was born in 2012 at the heart of historic St Andrews and it has become an integral part of the local flavor.  Our success over the last three years is due greatly to the unshakable commitment we have in creating a true coffee shop experience.  We are not about the hype but about quality products and quality service at an affordable price.  In the future, historic St Andrews is going to change and develop beyond what it is now as a quaint fishing village and instead of a national chain it is more desirable to have well established local business owners at the helm of the developing business community. Local business owners are invested in the community and are more apt to make the appropriate considerations when it comes to big decisions that affect the neighborhood.  

Risks & Challenges

There are always risks when going into business.  Beyond good security surveillance and a excellent fire retardation system, the risks for a successful business venture at this location are greatly reduced with this particular property because it is grandfathered-in and things like signage and licensing for beer and wine are made easily available with the processing and payment of the appropriate permits, forms and fees.   Establishing CAFFiEND'S Coffee & Tea in 2012 and operating it as a sole proprietorship over the last three years has given me the knowledge and experience for continued success in this new location.

Other Ways You Can Help

I understand that some people just cannot afford to make a monetary contribution to funding this entrepreneurial venture but there are things that you can do which will greatly increase the success of this campaign.  One of the first things is to spread the word about this campaign to people you think can and are will to contribute. Another thing that you can do, which will contribute to the long-term success of a small businesses like CAFFiEND'S Cafe & Real BBQ is to visit our new location once it opens and give us a chance to be part of your daily routine at CAFFiEND'S in historic St Andrews - Panama City, Fl.

story:
The Indie Movement

The Indie Movement is an independent business community that helps you identify and search for privately-owned businesses wherever you are. 

Smaller, locally-focused, independent stores are the cornerstone of our communities and define what is unique about us. Many of the seemingly private businesses in our neighborhoods are actually subsidiaries of much larger companies. Shopping at these corporate investments and other chain stores drains money from our local economies. As a result our communities are stripped of the jobs, the support, and the character our families, friends, and neighbors worked so hard to create.

Our online business directory and app will allow you to easily search for the independent businesses in your community. Our logo and sticker will also help you identify retailers, food vendors and service providers that are owned by the people closest to you.

Help us create a business community in your area that is:

Privately Owned.

The majority of ownership is either private, employee based, or part of a local cooperative. No portion of the business is listed on a stock exchange.

Local.

The owner or majority of owners live within the local community. The business does not have more than three separate shopfronts.

Self-Governed.

The decisions made regarding the business, including branding and marketing, are completely controlled by the owner or majority of owners. The business is not part of an external franchise.

Our Concept.

The Indie Movement is membership based, affordable ($29 p.a.) and completely free of advertisement. Unlike other online directories, all of our listings are based solely on proximity so potential customers can locate the closest TIM businesses in their chosen category. There is no opportunity for members to upgrade their listing or improve awareness within the website so all registered businesses, regardless of revenue or size, are treated equally. A sticker of our logo is also issued to each member so they are easily identifiable to passing foot traffic. Our emblem is designed to blend in with a diverse range of storefronts; it is available in many different colors so the individual appearance of each TIM member is not compromised.

Our Story.

Earlier this year I was enjoying a meal at a local bar with some close friends. Several comments were made about the unique style and ambiance of the hotel. With the intention of complimenting the owner I conducted a quick Internet search and was disappointed to find that the establishment was actually part of the Mitsubishi Corporation. Profits from my meal were potentially headed for a group of executives halfway across the globe.

The following day I did a little research about the ownership of other businesses I frequented; many of those were also owned by multinational companies. My aim from that moment on was to buy only from locally-owned stores; a feat much harder than first anticipated. Many smaller businesses were not listed on the Internet, or didn't immediately show because they had not invested in a search listing, and there was no easily identifiable mark to indicate private ownership.

I mentioned the lack of websites focused on small businesses with an IT friend. He was surprised yet enthusiastic about the idea and convinced me to pursue it further. A mutual friend who had spent some time in the design industry got on board and together we set out to create a movement that identifies locally-owned small businesses, displays them in an unbiased way, and allows them to be easily found and utilized. We hope that you can locate the independent business you are looking for in your area and appreciate your support of The Indie Movement.

   - Timothy Wallace

Your Contribution

Your contribution will assist us in the design and development of a functional website and app for The Indie Movement. Please view the screenshots of our website currently in development - any feedback is most welcome.

Your contribution will also help us create awareness for the movement, through labeling and social media, while educating people about the benefits of supporting small businesses and the issues that many multinational companies create for local communities.

Should we not reach our intended goal we will still go ahead with the project; however, it may be some time before a community can be fully brought together.

Should our funds exceed our goal we will invest in spreading the word of The Indie Movement and further develop our website and app for ease of use.

The Challenge.

The major challenge we face is getting the word out there. Follow us on Facebook or Twitter, tell your friends or business owners that might be interested, and support The Indie Movement!

The Challenge.
The major challenge we face
is getting the word out there. Follow us on Facebook or Twitter, tell your
friends or business owners that might be interested, and support The Indie
Movement!

story:
My Grandmother passed away from a long term bout with cancer. The cancer ravage my grandmother at the end and my mother was unable to reconcile with my grandmother before she passed. My mother was left with a void that slowly ate her away. She refused to visit my grandmothers grave and over the months fell into deeper depression. I felt helpless to help my mother so I simply decided to visit the grave and send pictures of the stone to my mother on her phone. I visited the site one day and realized how the stone was extremely dirty so I decided to clean it on my next visit. I researched the best way to clean stones and I purchased the equipment I needed. After a week I felt I was ready to clean my grandmothers stone confidently. After my first cleaning I was surprised how new the stone looked. I was proud to take that picture and send to my mother. She told me it brought tears to her eyes and the next time I visited she would attend. A few days later I took my mother to my grandmothers stone for the very first time. We stood there speechless for what seemed like a eternity then my mother said "Thank You". I asked for what so she stated the pictures and the cleaning helped her heal. At that moment I realized I could help others and Stone Gentlemen was born. I started to clean stones as a hobby and began to sketch the stones for donations and realized I could really build a business. 

"Love Still Lives After Death" This is what we at Stone Gentlemen believe and practice day to day through our services. My name is Kevin Roddy and I’m the founder and owner of Stone Gentlemen, where we specialize in the capturing the families memory in Artwork, maintenance and upkeep of gravestones. We exhibit a level of sophistication, professionalism, and supreme customer service and respect for the families lost. Our services allow family members to continue to care for their loved one after death. We never move the stones or perform restorations! We only perform general cleaning and beautification to give the family peace of mind and assurance that the memory of their loved one is being maintained and respected. We are a licensed business with years of experience. We only use high quality, eco and stone friendly solution, water, and soft bristle brushes to gently clean the stone and refresh its beauty. We never use harsh chemicals, bleaches, power tools, or power sprays. With the proceeds of this campaign I will purchase a Quality camera and the tools for the business to be more efficient.

Risks and challenges

I currently am insured, licensed, build a website, cards and brochures. I did this thru odd jobs, selling possessions and giving blood (literally). The current challenges are advertising, transportation and the necessary equipment to preform the task efficiently. The Risk is getting my service out to the public and unable to handle the traffic or the risk of moving too slow and developing competition (currently there is none in Philadelphia or New Jersey).

story:
Keeping Roads Safe (KRS) is a new device with the amazing potential to save thousands of lives each year. The use of cell phones while driving has become an epidemic across North America that has led to the unnecessary & tragic loss of thousands of lives.

We are Keeping Roads Safe, and we are introducing you to the first device on the market that can put an end to using cell phones while driving. This is the perfect solution for new drivers to never form the habit of checking their phone while driving.

Once installed in your vehicle, KRS is activated as soon as the vehicle is in gear and is deactivated when the vehicle is put in park and it's once again safe to check in.

We are using the money from this campaign to create a large public awareness campaign to highlight the dangers of texting and driving, and how it affects thousands of families & communities across North America.

KRS can be installed in any vehicle by one of our authorized dealers* and once installed it is highly unlikely that someone with general knowledge would be able to uninstall it, making it a much safer solution for your son or daughter than an app-based solution on their phone, which can easily be deactivated or deleted.

How KRS Works:



Important Statistics:

Pre-Order Your KRS Device Now:


Want to make sure you're among the first people to get your KRS Device? We are accepting pre-orders from now until May 31, 2015 on our website with special early bird pricing.

Pre-Order

* Authorized dealers information will be announced soon.

story:
In Short 

Locally Sourced, Nano-Brewed, Consciously Crafted. 

  • My background comes from being a tea barista, spring water enthusiast, and a passionate cook in a handful of top rated Metro-Detroit restaurants. 
  • I am expanding this small business idea based heavily around the community and locality of the Great Lakes State of Michigan. Showcasing the great resources, ingredients and my methods.
  • With the help of the indiegogo campaign funding it will allow me to produce the highest quality Kombucha in Michigan, and offer it at local cafes, small businesses, and farmers markets.
  • SOL Kombucha is hand crafted, gathered, labeled, bottled, & distributed. 
  • I bottle Kombucha by hand in german made amber Flip top glass bottles, and kegs, which are reusable and protective against light to ensuring the best SOL.
What is Kombucha?!

Q. What is Kombucha?

A. Kombucha cultures or SCOBY have been used traditionally for hundreds of years throughout the world as a beneficial health drink and daily tonic. Kombucha tea​(pronounced kom-boo-cha), also called a Manchurian mushroom, is a living culture which grows on top of a mixture of brewed tea and sugar in which the culture has been introduced.

Kombucha tea is a healthy and refreshing fermented beverage that has been used for generations. It is said to come from eastern Asia and now has traveled all around the world.

Although it is called a mushroom, it is not a mushroom at all as it does not produce spores or "fruit." The "mushroom" or SCOBY can be describe as a light brown or creamy white disk that grows on top of the liquid tea/sugar mixture and will take the form of the container that it is in. Again, it is not a mushroom at all, but really a yeast culture that has a symbiotic relationship with various bacteria, which duplicates itself during each brewing cycle. The correct name for the "mushroom" is a S.C.O.B.Y - a ​symbiotic culture of bacteria and yeast. The culture may look fragile, however, it is really thick and leathery in consistency. The finished brewed tea should be regarded principally as a live food unusually rich in nutritive properties.

Q. What is unique about your kombucha?

A. SOL Kombucha is very unique but not a new production concept. SOL Kombucha contains only Raw Spring water from Michigan, it does not use municipal liquid, “filtered” water, or ph recycled water. This is the very best water source in Michigan. Raw, Living, Structured naturally with the greatest life force.

Besides the best water, which is crucial for any brewing, Michigan herbs, fruits, and suppliers are used to produce a truly local product made with care.

Q. What does kombucha taste like?

A. It tastes somewhat like a sparkling apple cider with a tang of vinegar, depending on how long it ferments. The flavor is also unique to the flavors SOL Kombucha offers.

Q. What can your Kombucha do for my health?

A. The benefits to the physical body vary widely. As with yogurt or miso, the bacteria and cultures in the tea are a great source of nutritional. Most common benefits are it's detoxifying and metabolizing effects; aiding in metabolic function and balance. It is also said to enhance the immune system, due to the organic acids and antioxidants contained in the finished beverage. By detoxifying the body and providing natural probiotics, it is unlikely for disease causing bacteria and viruses to find a suitable growth environment.

Q. What flavors do you offer?

A. SOL Kombucha offers many flavors and types of Kombucha.

Using a wide range of teas from around the world, and even local coffee, we pride ourselves on working with the season and adapting with the lunar calendar.

Q. What ingredients go into Kombucha?

A. Truly 4 Ingredients; Water, Tea, Sugar, and a Scoby.

Q. Does finished kombucha contain alcohol?

A. Yes, as with all cultured and fermented foods, a small amount of naturally occurring alcohol is typically present in the finished product. Although the amount will vary from batch to batch, the amount should be quite small, if any (less than 0.05%).

Q. Why is using Raw Michigan spring water important to SOL Kombucha?

A. I believe that the true source of life comes from Raw Spring water gathered at the source. It contains vital nutrients and life force that is more than any bottled water, or filtered water can ever offer. It is genetically structured and is essential for life.

Q. Explain the ‘milk-man’ discounted return system?

A. This system is very simple, I like to reuse and communicate with people as much as possible, so I am holding true to this. Once you purchase and return an empty SOL Kombucha bottle, you will receive a discount on your next purchase. This is similar to returning empty plastic and glass beer and soda bottles, but better because we wash and reuse the beautiful amber flip top bottles.

Q. Where can I contact SOL Kombucha?

A. SOL Kombucha has a Facebook, website, and soon to have an instagram and twitter page. http://www.Facebook.com/solkombucha is the best way to contact us.

Q. Where can I purchase SOL Kombucha?

A. Currently SOL Kombucha is running a crowd funding campaign; we are looking for support so we can bring the SOL to you. Here is the link, and any donations at all would be greatly appreciated and help! This campaign will help make SOL Kombucha available throughout the local area.

Q. ​What are the existing Kombucha products on the market lacking?

A. I like to try and see different kombucha on the market develop and first off, the more the better! This means that people have the choice for the kombucha they want. Friendly competition makes for a better product. SOL Kombucha is different from the other kombucha brands predominantly because of the energy and love that goes into producing it. Using the finest water, highest quality tea and proper flavor combinations as well as the DIY aspect of the kombucha line and the integrity in the methods used.

Q: Why should I drink your kombucha over other Kombucha brands?

A. SOL Kombucha is more than other Kombucha brands, in that it is brewed in nano-batches, and only limited to a specific number of bottles, once those are gone, its on to a new batch and flavor. What this does is promise the best quality kombucha, with integrity, love and spirit that truly feeds your SOL. 


*NOTE*: This is not my first attempt at brewing kombucha, I am looking to expand the nano-brewery starting with equipment and bottles, etc.

What We Need & What You Get

+/+

  • I will need to raise $1,441.00 with a variable **($2,996.00), which will be used for the following: 
  • $636.00 for brew gear (2) 19 Gal. Kettles, & Pourer fittings 
  • $218.00 (2) 5 Gal. Picnic Kegs & Tubes for Sampling
  • $149.00 for labeling (Hand Labeled, Dated, Numbered)
  • $393.00 for Ingredients. (Ingredients, Tea, etc,)
  • **$1000.00 Re-useable german made flip top amber bottles (1024) 
  • $45 for (2) 5 Gal. Glass Carboys & Hoses for filling
  • *$555.00 for vendor space, table, & tent at local farmers market located in Clarkston, MI.
  • With SOL Kombucha, I am using a uniquely tailored idea dating back to the mid-1900's , the "Milkman" method.
  • When you purchase any quantity of SOL Kombucha, you will get a discounted refill of SOL Kombucha, just like the milkman refills your milk jugs. 
  • Return the glass bottles, and you receive discounted bottles!
  • **Variable, depending on number of supporters
  • *Extra funds go towards this.

  • Successful Funding: I will Brew, Craft, & Bottle the SOL for you, and the community.
  • Kombucha flavors offered:
  • Original Tea
  • Ginger & Lemon  
  • Hawaiian Spirulina & Japanese Matcha
  • Michigan Montmorency Tart Cherry & Chia Seed 
  • Michigan Chaga Mushroom, Cinnamon, Clove, Nutmeg & Michigan Maple
  • Dandelion Leaf & Gogi Berry
  • Burdock Root & Pau d'arco Bark

  • Long Term: Along with bottling, and selling at markets locally, I plan to have SOL Kombucha on tap at a limited number or Metro Detroit Restaurants, using Kombucha as an aperitif, nightly drink, and a common mixer in place of other syrupy pre-bottled things. 
  • Unsuccessful Funding: Funds will go directly towards buying bottles, and working towards getting the SOL working. I am pursuing this passion long after this campaign comes to a closure. 

SOL Impact

  • Nano-Brewed SOL Kombucha is the best way to not only support your community, but your own body. 
  • With your contribution, as little as $1, or (as much as you feel comfortable) $1000.00 you will help make this dream a reality.

Risk

  • Risk is involved with anything we as humans do, that is why I can promise to deliver the product I speak of.
  • All funds are being measured with business principles in mind. 
  • Ensuring proper use of quality products from the earth to the bottle; Keeping the local artisan in mind.

Other Ways You Can Help

+/+

  • Keep your friends in mind, make this a community effort.
  • Share on social networks, invite your family out to the farmers markets and try a free sample of SOL! 
  • If you have any questions or comments, PLEASE contact me and I would be more than happy to share with you!
  • And of course use the Indiegogo share tools on social networks.

story:
«Был странником, и вы приняли Меня»
                                                               Евангелие от Матфея, гл. 25, ст. 35

Дорогие!

Давайте все вместе сделаем подарок на Рождество и Новый Год всем обездоленным и бездомным!

Меня зовут о. Вадим Арефьев. Я по благословению Старца Илия занимаюсь страждущими. 

Нам надо накопить 30 тыс. долларов, чтобы ОСУЩЕСТВИТЬ МЕЧТУ: ОТКРЫТЬ РЕАБИЛИТАЦИОННУЮ ФЕРМУ для бездомных и потерянных русских, украинцев, белорусов, грузин – всех, кого мы кормим на улицах Нью-Йорка!  Построить ферму на эти деньги мы пока не сможем,  но уже могли бы арендовать помещения, чтобы приняться за дело.

Есть земля для будущего обустраивания фермы, есть люди, которые готовы начать работать и вытаскивать ребят.

Есть только что вставшие на ноги и мечтающие о такой ферме.

Не хватает только одного – финансовой помощи для Божьего Дела.

Проект осуществляет Фонд Надежды на Св. Иоанна Кронштадтского – Новый Дом Трудолюбия.

Организовали Фонд миряне разных юрисдикций из Грузинской и Русских Церквей.  Помогают батюшки из Американской Автокефальной и Сербской Церкви – помогают все, кто может.

Может быть стучится Господь и в ваше сердце?

Фонд Надежды на Св. Иоанна Кронштадтского – Новый Дом Трудолюбия.
Организовали Фонд
миряне разных юрисдикций из Грузинской и Русских Церквей.  Помогают батюшки из Американской
Автокефальной и Сербской Церкви – помогают все, кто может.
Может быть
стучится Господь и в ваше сердце?

story:
My name is Emmitt South and I have poured my savings, energy and passion into the development of a my product. The last step in order to bring my product to market is to pay for the mold for mass production and placing my first order. I am $3,000 shy from being able to make this happen! I am raising money to eliminate that gap in order to continue to move forward.

This is an expandable band for an array of items with a retractable string for your lighter. The purpose is to keep it attached to your device with a lighter in order to always have a lighter when and where you need it. ELIMINATE THE LIGHTER THIEF'S. Prevent losing your lighter every time a friend comes over. My product is elastic enough to fit on different shapes and sizes of devices while remaining snug so it does not expand when the lighter is pulled. It is easy to take on and off when desired, insert and remove the lighter and simply let go of the lighter after use for it to automatically retract to the band!

It is *patent pending, with the patent covering every imaginable type of band you could add a retractable string unit or lighter attachment to, safe-guarding my product and your investment!

Upon mass production it will be available on our website, online retailers, in-store retailers and will seek wholesalers/distributor sales.

This fund will help push the product to the finish line and make it available for purchase world-wide!

Thank you for visiting my fund, I appreciate any donations and PLEASE share with anyone you think would be interested in pre-ordering my product!

Gratitude,

Emmitt South

story:
• A $1 donation would grow to $189,905,276.46 
  • A $20 donation would grow to $3,798,105,529.21
  • A $50 donation would grow to $9,495,263,823.02
  • A $100 donation would grow to $18,990,527,646.05

A New Kind of Giving

We want to make the world a better place. Similar to what we’re all doing here on IndieGoGo, the idea is to fund artists, activists, and the poor with a massive infusion of cash…in the future. We think it’s important to care for a world that’s beyond our lifetimes and this campaign is a great way to do it. 

So how about we be totally rebellious and  try to give away nearly $2 Trillion? Really. ($1,899,052,764,604.62 to be more precise.)

The idea is simple: use the same method that we’re always being told to use to create wealth—the stock market. We just do it for longer.

During the twentieth century, the stock market returned an average of about 10 percent per year.  If we take $10,000 and invest it in a total stock market Index Fund for 200 years and if the return matches the historical average, that $10,000 would become almost 1.9 trillion dollars. It’s amazing, right? Our eyes nearly popped out of their sockets when we ran the numbers. Check out any compound interest calculator—like this one from the Securities and Exchange Commission—and do the math to see it for yourself.

So we’re going to try to do that and then give all the money away…in the year 2215.

There’d be inflation of course. And if we factor for inflation at about 3%, that $1.9 trillion would be worth something like $5 billion in today’s dollars.

It’d be so much fun to give away $5 billion dollars. And we’d love your support for this idea. Please donate if you can.

What We Need & What You Get

We’re going to establish an Index Fund and try to make 2215 especially awesome. And we need funding to help create a legal entity to guard the fund over time. While this is a totally fun idea with the potential for a huge impact, it’s also a new idea so we need to build a structure that will see it to fruition. 

The Impact

The impact of giving away billions of dollars would be huge. Imagine giving $1 billion to the poor. Imagine giving $1 billion to artists. Imagine giving another $1 billion to environmentalists. And so on. Imagine what we could do. We think it’d be absolutely amazing. And fun!

story:
Short Summary

Debra Jones is the founder of Red Tent Ontario and Regional Coordinator of Gather The Women Global Matrix.

After hosting the very popular Energy Shares, she discovered a deep desire for people to connect in a meaningful way.  She noticed how people, when supported by their authentic community, thrived and blossomed.

"See a need - fill a need" is her philosophy and so Red Tent Ontario was born.

Visit our website: www.RedTentOntario.com

Red Tent Ontario's campaign is to fund the purchase of the community Red Tent - to provide a safe, comfortable place for a community of women to gather regularly.  ---  Many women need a safe, supportive environment if they are to find their voice and their power to make changes in their own lives.  Once empowered, women can make the world a better place.

'The world will be saved by the western woman' - Dalai Lama

What We Need & What You Get

  • We need $5000 to purchase a Red Tent large enough to accommodate large groups of women.
  • We are creating our own unique art that will adorn a beautiful silk scarf, a personal journal, a pamper kit and a guided meditation CD - these and other useful items will be gifted to you for your generous donation.
  • If we don't reach our entire goal here, we will host other fundraising events.
  • If we exceed our goal - your money will fund satellite Red Tents in this community and beyond.

The Impact

'Be the change you wish to see in the world' - Mahatma Gandhi
  • Your generous donation will enable women to find their voice, take back their power and find the courage they need to make changes in their lives.
  • Previous bi-weekly Energy Shares (gatherings of like-minded community members) resulted in helping people blossom and grow to share their own healing gifts with the world, and other circles were created.
  • Help to create 'The Millionth Circle'
  • Support 'Gather The Women Global Matrix'
  • Help create the community of 'Red Tent Ontario'

Risks & Challenges

Perhaps it'll take a while to gather the funds necessary to purchase the Red Tent. 

  • Debra is an adept problem-solver, known for gracefully changing course and adjusting quickly to new environments and challenges.
  • There is always more than one path to get to a destination - Debra always finds a way to achieve her goals.

Other Ways You Can Help

  • Help us get the word out about our campaign --- Please Share!
  • Tell all your women friends/relatives that they are welcome in the Red Tent
  • Register to attend a Red Tent Gathering - $10 attendance donations fund the Red Tent

Visit our website www.RedTentOntario.com

Not in Ontario?  Find a Red Tent near you.

story:
We've done everything from filing police reports, contacting local pawn shops and posting flyers around the city.

I'm preparing for the worst and I'm trying to raise money so that he can get a new horn.

He's currently a music student at the Colorado State University in Pueblo. He's very passionate about music and wants to make a career out of it.

Please help and if by some chance we find his horn we'll donate any money we raise to a local charity

story:
The European Parliament is working again on a proposal that would allow personal data about your air travel to be used to profile you as a possible criminal. This data is called the Passenger Name Record (PNR).

Europan Digital Rights (EDRi) and Digitale Gesellschaft (Digiges) want to send a direct message - in a form of postcards - to the members of the European Parliament. We want to tell them why this proposal will not bring more security, but it will involve massive and expensive surveillance and profiling of all air travellers! To make this happen, we want to raise 2 000 euro to print and send these postcards.

How to participate?

To be part of the project, you can:
  1. Send us your suggestion! - What silly reason can you think of to support PNR? Send your suggestion to us by Twitter @edri, or by email to brussels[at]edri.org. The best ones will be printed and sent to the European Parliament! 
  2. Donate! - Help us get the postcards printed and sent to MEPs! Once the cards are printed, we will deliver them to MEPs. If you wish to send some yourself, or to distribute in your organisation to be sent by your members, we'll make sure you'll receive a some.
  3. Share this campaign!


What is PNR?

Passenger Name Records (PNR) are data containing information provided by flight passengers and collected by air carriers. All PNR data are transferred to "passenger information units" that would store the data and profile ("analyse") people as possible terrorists/serious criminals. A PNR contains personal information, such as
  • the complete itinerary of the trip
  • baggage information
  • credit card information
  • travel agent
  • meal preferences...


What's going on?

In 2011, the European Commission put forward a proposal on the EU PNR Directive. It raised serious concerns over the interference with fundamental rights to privacy and data protection, and it was rejected by the European Parliament Committee on Civil Liberties, Justice and Home Affairs (LIBE). Civil society groups and airlines opposed the proposal for its lack of necessity, its cost, and its impact on fundamental rights. Despite this, after the Paris attacks, the European Parliament voted for re-examination of the proposed Directive. In February 2015 a revised proposal was introduced.

Despite the rejection of the proposal in the LIBE Committee, the Commission distributed 50 million euro to EU Member States for establishing national PNR systems. This created a situation where airlines now have to face the cost of complying with different PNR regimes and the Commission claims there is a need to "harmonise" systems that only exist due to its own funding. In short, while the EU was facing a severe economic recession, the Commission spent millions of euros of EU taxpayers' money to bypass a democratic decision taken by the European Parliament.


What can I do?

The debate on PNR agreements is filled with irrational fear, and it's essential that the European Parliament takes a firm stand against mass surveillance and privacy restrictions in Europe. You can contribute by helping us send these postcards, and by sharing this campaign!

This campaign is a join initiative of European Digital Rights (EDRi) and Digitale Gesellschaft (Digiges).

story:
The People's Clinic (“TPC”) is a community acupuncture clinic and a social business that offers acupuncture on a sliding scale of $15-$40 per treatment.  No income verification is required for these rates; it is a pay what you can structure.  It’s been in operation since 2008 and is located in Boise, Idaho.


The owner of The People's Clinic, Donna Selle, was in an automobile accident last summer and sustained a brain injury and was forced to close the clinic in July 2014.  Donna has recovered nicely and the community needs and wants The People's Clinic to reopen! 

The People's Clinic has a unique business structure; it is a social business.  Run very much like a non-profit, the primary reason a social business operates isn’t to make a profit.  A social business creates something other than profit that makes it valuable.  It builds community.  So, because TPC is a social business, there isn't much money set aside.  A crowd funding campaign that depends on the community is a perfect option for The People's Clinic, a clinic that the community depends on.

In its six years of operation, the clinic gave thousands of affordable acupuncture treatments to ordinary people with ordinary incomes, thereby making acupuncture a viable and affordable option for all.  TPC is a proud member of The People's Organization of Community Acupuncture, (POCA), a nationwide co-op of more than 250 acupuncture clinics plus countless patients, community members, organizations, businesses and students all over the country (and in other countries, too!) who believe that acupuncture should be available to all people.  Collectively, POCA member clinics gave over ONE MILLION acupuncture treatments in 2014.  That means there’s been over one million times pain has been relieved, anguish has been erased and comfort has been achieved; one million tiny steps toward making this world and the people who inhabit it just a little bit happier and healthier.

Donna and The People’s Clinic were granted a microloan from POCA to get the doors open again.  TPC is nearly there!  What is needed is just a little bit more help.  Donna has found a couple of great locations with lots of space and affordable rent (supremely important so we can be sustainable and keep our fees LOW).  These properties tend to be pretty ugly and shabby in their current condition.  With your help we can add a fresh coat of paint and do a few other DIY projects on the cheap and make TPC’s new space gorgeous.  

To learn more about Community Acupuncture and the POCA Cooperative, click HERE.  To learn more about The People's Clinic, visit their website HERE.

Please donate what you can; even a few dollars will make a huge difference.
